title: Avionics Engineer
description:
• Description:* Our company specializes in design and engineering of aircraft modifications.

The electrical avionics designer will be responsible for designing electrical wiring diagrams avionics systems. They will prepare engineering documents such as flight test plans, ground test procedures, flight manual/maintenance supplements, and EWIS-electrical wiring inspection system. They will work with the manager of avionics to manage/lead each program schedule and deliverable in which they will be responsible for 1-2 different programs at one time. Lastly they will be required to travel 3-4 times per year for 1-2 weeks at a time so they must be able to travel anywhere. *Qualifications:* -Bachelors in electrical/electro-mechanical engineering or an aircraft maintenance engineer
  • 5+ years designing avionics equipment-power, radio, navigation, lighting or special mission equipment
  • Experience with Transportation Canada- i.e writing reports, FAR's, Part 25, CAR 525, substantiation compliance reports, functional hazard assessment, fault tree analysis, FMEA, flight manual supplements, safety assessments, ICA, test plan
  • Ability to pass security clearance for CGD/ITAR- don't need to do the clearance prior to getting the position

À propos d'Actalent:

Actalent relie la passion à la mission. Nos solutions de candidats talentueux et la performance de nos services produisent la valeur et les résultats, tout en apportant la compétence qui permet à nos clients de réaliser plus. Nos experts situés dans le monde entier inspirent au quotidien. Nous soutenons les initiatives essentielles en ingénierie et en sciences, par les expériences qui favorisent un développement continu. La différence, c’est nos gens. Actalent est une société d’exploitation d’Allegis Group, leader mondial des solutions de candidats talentueux.

L’entreprise souscrit au principe d’égalité d’accès à l’emploi et prendra en compte toutes les candidatures sans distinction de race, sexe, âge, couleur, religion, nationalité, statut de vétéran, handicap, orientation sexuelle, identité sexuelle, information génétique ou toute autre distinction protégée par la loi.

About Actalent:

Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Analyste en sécurité et fiabilité des systèmes / Systems Safety and Reliability Analyst
description:
English Version will follow:

Qui nous sommes

Chez Pratt & Whitney, nous croyons que le vol motorisé a transformé, et continuera de transformer, le monde. C'est pourquoi nous travaillons avec un cœur d'explorateur et un acharnement de perfectionniste à concevoir, produire et entretenir les moteurs d'avion les plus avancés et les plus fiables du monde. Notre portefeuille diversifié - composé de moteurs commerciaux et militaires ainsi que de moteurs destinés à l'aviation d'affaires, générale et régionale, et aux hélicoptères – nous permet, ainsi qu’à nos clients, de passer du possible au réel. C'est ainsi que, chez Pratt & Whitney, nous abordons notre travail et ce qui nous inspire à nous dépasser.

Quelles sont nos attentes?

P&WC est le concepteur et fabricant de turbines à gaz le plus diversifié au monde. À l’intérieur de l’équipe de Sécurité et Fiabilité, vous allez conduire des analyses en support aux activités de design, de développement et de certification de nos moteurs, incluant les turbopropulseurs, moteurs d’hélicoptères et turboréacteurs.

Afin de supporter notre flotte de plus de 58,000 moteurs en service, vous effectuerez aussi des analyses de risque afin de supporter l’établissement de plans d’actions correctives.

Vous allez nous aider à continuellement avancer notre discipline de classe mondiale en Sécurité Aérienne et Fiabilité.

Description de la fonction

En tant que partie intégrante de notre équipe de génie, vous effectuerez des analyses de Sécurité Aérienne basée sur la méthodologie de l’ARP 4761, incluant FMEA, FHA et CMA. Vous allez préparer des rapports de certification et interagir avec Transports Canada, ainsi que les autorités de certification internationales. En plus des activités reliées aux moteurs, vous allez aussi supporter les fabricants d’aéronefs dans l’installation et l’intégration des moteurs.

En tant que partie intégrante du Système de Management de la Sécurité, vous allez conduire des analyses de risques basées sur la méthodologie CAAM/AC39-8. Vous allez guider le développement de stratégies de gestion des flottes d’aéronefs.

Vous serez en charge d’un ou plusieurs pans de notre discipline de Sécurité Aérienne, tels que les opérations en mode dégradé (TLD), Facteurs Humains ou Cybersécurité, et allez nous aider à améliorer nos capacités afin de répondre adéquatement à ces types de défis, présents et futurs.

À quoi ressemblera votre quotidien?
  • Travailler avec les avionneurs, les autorités de navigabilité et les équipes de PWC pour définir les exigences et le transfert des exigences en matière de sécurité; établir la PSSA (évaluation préliminaire de la sécurité du système) et le plan de sécurité
  • Effectuer des analyses de sécurité pour les systèmes et diriger l’AMDEC afin de participer aux IPT (équipes de production intégrées) et de soutenir les activités liées à la conception de moteurs
  • Valider l’atteinte des objectifs de sécurité par le biais de la FHA, préparer le SSA (évaluation de la sécurité du système) pour la certification des moteurs et donner du soutien aux activités liées à la certification des aéronefs
  • Effectuer des analyses techniques et élaborer des solutions pour répondre aux problèmes rencontrés pendant le développement et lors de la mise en service
  • Réaliser des évaluations de risques afin de soutenir les stratégies de maintien de navigabilité de la flotte
  • Les candidats doivent démontrer un vif intérêt pour le leadership, posséder la capacité de travailler en équipe, être doués en résolution de problème et maîtriser la théorie des systèmes.
  • Prendre le leadership de la discipline, y compris en ce qui concerne le développement de nouveaux processus et de nouveaux outils d’analyse

Ce dont vous avez besoin pour réussir
  • Analyse de la sécurité et de la fiabilité des groupes motopropulseurs et de leurs connexions avec les aéronefs
  • Connaissance des turbomachines et des commandes de moteurs, de la motorisation et des systèmes des aéronefs (hélice, inverseur de poussée)
  • Comprenant tout ce qui concerne les systèmes mécaniques (carburant, huile, transmission) et les systèmes de contrôle (hydromécanique, électronique, logiciel)
  • Responsable de la chaîne de valeur de projets globaux complexes de grande portée, depuis les exigences préliminaires jusqu’à la certification des moteurs et des aéronefs en passant par la gestion sur le terrain du cycle de vie
  • Met en pratique ses connaissances avancées au sein de l’équipe afin de diriger ou de créer des champs de discipline dans des domaines tels que la sécurité incendie, l’AMDEC ou le service de gestion de la flotte
  • Encadre et forme les autres employés
  • Possède des connaissances spécialisées dans plusieurs champs de discipline liés à la conception d’aéronefs
  • Baccalauréat avec 6 à 10 ans d’expérience
  • Maîtrise avec 4 à 7 ans d’expérience
  • Domaine d’études : génie des systèmes, génie aérospatial, génie mécanique

Nous offrons:
  • Programme de congé à rémunération différée
  • Garderie pour jeunes enfants
  • Programmes d’avancement professionnel et de scolarisation
  • Horaires flexibles
  • Programmes et formations sur le leadership
  • Gamme d’avantages sociaux, régime d’épargne et régime de retraite
  • Programme d’aide de financement pour les congés parentaux
  • Programme de reconnaissance et de récompense

Diversité, Équité et Inclusion

Le générique masculin est utilisé sans discrimination et uniquement dans le but d'alléger le texte. P&WC souscrit au principe de l’équité en matière d’emploi et est déterminé à encourager la diversité et l’inclusion. Nous sommes heureux d’étudier la demande d’emploi de tous les candidats qualifiés, sans égard à leur race, couleur, religion, orientation sexuelle, genre, nationalité d’origine, âge, handicap, statut d’ancien combattant ou tout autre statut protégé par la loi.

English Version:

Who We Are

At Pratt & Whitney, we believe that powered flight has transformed – and will continue to transform – the world. That’s why we work with an explorer’s heart and a perfectionist’s grit to design, build, and service the world’s most advanced aircraft engines. We do this across a diverse portfolio – including Commercial Engines, Military Engines, Business Aviation, General Aviation, Regional Aviation, and Helicopter Aviation – and as a way of turning possibilities into realities for our customers. This is how we at Pratt & Whitney approach our work, and this is why we are inspired to go beyond.

What Our Expectations Are

P&WC is the world’s most diversified aircraft gas turbine engine designer and manufacturer. Inside the System Safety & Reliability team, you will perform safety analysis in support of design, development and certification of our engines, including turboprop, turboshaft, turbofan and APU installations.

In support of our fleet of more than 58,000 engines in service, you will also perform risk assessment activities to help define corrective action plans

You will help us continuously advance our world-class System Safety & Reliability Engineering discipline.

Function Description

As part of our Engineering team, you will perform safety analysis based on ARP 4761 methodology, including FMEA, FHA, and CMA. You will prepare certification reports and interact with Transport Canada and foreign certification Authorities. In addition to engine-level activities, you will also support aircraft manufacturers in engine installation and integration activities.

As part of our Safety Management System (SMS) process, you will perform Risk Assessment analysis based on CAAM/AC39-8 methodology. You will guide development of aircraft fleet management strategies.

You will have leadership for one or more aspects of our System Safety discipline, such as Time-Limited Dispatch (TLD), Human Factors or impact of Cybersecurity, and will advance our capabilities to meet current and emerging challenges

What your day to day will look like:
  • Work with airframers, airworthiness authorities and PWC teams to define safety requirements and flow down; prepare PSSA and Safety Plan
  • Conduct systems safety analysis and participate in IPT's in support of engine design activities, leading FMEA
  • Validate safety objective are met through FHA, prepare the SSA for engine certification and support aircraft-level certification activities
  • Conduct technical analysis, develop solutions to problems encountered during development and in-service
  • Perform risk assessments in support of fleet management strategies for continued airworthiness
  • Applicants should demonstrate a strong interest in discipline leadership, with solid teamwork, troubleshooting, and systems thinking capability
  • Provide discipline leadership, including the development of new processes and analytical tools

What you need to be successful:
  • System safety and reliability analysis for power plants and interfaces with aircrafts
  • Knowledge of engine turbomachinery and controls, aircraft powerplant systems (propeller, thrust reverser)
  • Includes all aspects related to mechanical systems (fuel, oil, transmission) and control (hydromechanical, electronic, software)
  • Responsible for entire projects with significant scope and complexity through the value stream from preliminary requirements through to engine and aircraft certification and field life cycle management
  • Contributes to the team by applying their advanced knowledge to lead and develop disciplines such as fire safety, FMEA, or fleet risk management
  • Develops and coaches others
  • Has expert knowledge that extends across multiple design disciplines
  • Bachelors degree with 6 to 10 years of experience
  • Masters degree with 4 to 7 years of experience
  • Field of study: Systems Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Mechanical Engineering

What we offer:
  • Long-term deferred compensation programs
  • Daycare for young children
  • Advancement programs to enhance education skills
  • Flexible work schedules
  • Leadership and training programs
  • Comprehensive benefits, savings and pension plans
  • Financial support for parental leave
  • Reward programs for outstanding work

Diversity and inclusion

The masculine pronoun is used without discrimination and solely for the purpose of making the text easier to read. P&WC is an equal opportunities employer, seeking to promote diversity and inclusion. We will consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by law.
skills: ['Provide discipline leadership, including the development of new processes and analytical tools', 'Masters degree with 4 to 7 years of experience', 'Financial support for parental leave', 'Flexible work schedules', 'Responsible for entire projects with significant scope and complexity through the value stream from preliminary requirements through to engine and aircraft certification and field life cycle management', 'Has expert knowledge that extends across multiple design disciplines', 'Includes all aspects related to mechanical systems (fuel, oil, transmission) and control (hydromechanical, electronic, software)', 'Reward programs for outstanding work', 'Bachelors degree with 6 to 10 years of experience', 'Perform risk assessments in support of fleet management strategies for continued airworthiness']

title: Senior Designer, Mechanical and Structural
description:
Field Aviation (aka Field Aerospace), a global provider of aircraft integration, modification, maintenance, logistics and sustainment solutions is in search of a highly motivated, hands-on professional for the position of Senior Designer, Mechanical and Structural. This role is based in Mississauga, Ontario, Canada.


General Duties:

· Investigate vendor installation requirements and technical information and create airframe production installation/fabrication drawings, engineering instructions and related production guidance materials as it pertains to the mechanical and structural aspects of a modification program.


Essential Job Functions:

· Develop 3-D models and 2-D drawings to support the installation of mechanical and structural provisions;

· Prepare engineering documents such as Ground Test Procedures, Flight Test Plans/Reports, Maintenance/Flight Manual Supplements, Modification Instructions, etc.;

· Provide technical guidance to design staff;

· Liaise with Manufacturing and Production Operations;

· Provide technical assistance to Business Development;

· Ensure design content meets requirements of Statement of Work (SOW);

· Manage project deliverables and schedules;

· Prepare engineering design feasibility studies and reports.


Skills and Experience:

· Minimum of (10) years progressive aerospace engineering or design experience

· Transport Canada Aircraft Maintenance Engineer designation (airframe) may be used as credit for (4) years of aerospace experience

· Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering Degree from a Canadian or foreign recognized University may be used as credit for the (4) years of the experience requirement.


Competencies:

· Integrity

· Excellence

· Accountability

· Innovation

· Collaboration and Team Work

· Communicating Orally and in Writing

· Adaptability

· Initiative

· Organization and Planning

· Education

· Decision Making

· Exercising Self-Control and Being Resilient

· Interpersonal Skills

· Leadership


Education:

· Post-Secondary Aviation or Aerospace Technical Education or Degree and or equivalent experience


Reports To: Lead Engineer


Physical Requirements:

· The physical demands described herein are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms.

Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time. The employee is occasionally required to climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee may occasionally lift and move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and move objects up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.


Applicants selected for possible consideration will be contacted to schedule an interview. Accommodation is available through the Human Resources Department.


Additional Notes: Field Aerospace offers a competitive compensation package including medical, dental, and vision insurance, company paid life insurance, RRSP, health spending accounts, generous vacation and paid holidays.

The employee is occasionally required to climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee may occasionally lift and move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and move objects up to 25 pounds.   • Applicants should demonstrate a strong interest in discipline leadership, with solid teamwork, troubleshooting, and systems thinking capability
  • Provide discipline leadership, including the development of new processes and analytical tools

What You Need To Be Successful
  • System safety and reliability analysis for power plants and interfaces with aircrafts
  • Knowledge of engine turbomachinery and controls, aircraft powerplant systems (propeller, thrust reverser)
  • Includes all aspects related to mechanical systems (fuel, oil, transmission) and control (hydromechanical, electronic, software)
  • Responsible for entire projects with significant scope and complexity through the value stream from preliminary requirements through to engine and aircraft certification and field life cycle management
  • Contributes to the team by applying their advanced knowledge to lead and develop disciplines such as fire safety, FMEA, or fleet risk management
  • Develops and coaches others
  • Has expert knowledge that extends across multiple design disciplines
  • Bachelors degree with 6 to 10 years of experience
  • Masters degree with 4 to 7 years of experience
  • Field of study: Systems Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Mechanical Engineering

What We Offer
  • Long-term deferred compensation programs
  • Daycare for young children
  • Advancement programs to enhance education skills
  • Flexible work schedules
  • Leadership and training programs
  • Comprehensive benefits, savings and pension plans
  • Financial support for parental leave
  • Reward programs for outstanding work

Diversity and inclusion

The masculine pronoun is used without discrimination and solely for the purpose of making the text easier to read. P&WC is an equal opportunities employer, seeking to promote diversity and inclusion. We will consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by law.

Looking For: Creative Minds

If you were to measure the cool factor of working at PAL Aerospace, you might be surprised – as one of the best kept secrets in the local market, we work with teams who are building one-of-a-kind aircraft, technology and engineering design to support clients from one corner of the world to the other.

It’s a unique opportunity to work here, and we’re looking for a new PAL to join our marketing team. Do you have previous experience as a Graphic Designer? Awesome, that checks a box. Do you happen to think aviation is cool? That works, too! Our goal is to hire the right fit, with a big-picture vision for creative solutions.

What’s life like for a Graphic Design Coordinator at PAL Aerospace?

This person is responsible for executing the full design lifecycle – from creative concepts to interactive design and everything in between. This PAL plays a critical role in ensuring we’re designing and implementing creative solutions for our consumer and employer brand across the globe.

title: newFall Technical Co-op - Product Designer - Training and Susta...
description:
Specific Job Description

Working alongside the backend-developer, quality assurance, development operations and the product owner, the product designer, bringing a user centric design mindset, will design and prototype the user interface for our products.

Main Responsibilities:
  • Design esthetically pleasing and easy to use interface using an iterative design approach, supported by various user experience research methods.
  • Prototype and test design ideas through various user testing methods.
  • Analyze data from user experience research and use this information to iterate feature designs and help define the product roadmap.
  • Communicate design ideations to the software development team and stakeholder through but not limited to, user flow and journey diagrams, user interface mockups, wireframes and prototypes.

Employee Type

Casual

Vacancy Type

Intern/Co-Op

Business Environment

Lockheed Martin Canada is the Canadian-based arm of Lockheed Martin Corporation, a global security and aerospace company employing 115,000 people worldwide, including more than 1,300 Canadians. By applying innovative approaches of our highly skilled and experienced Canadian workforce, we have been Canada’s trusted defence and aerospace partner for over 80 years. We operate major facilities in Ottawa, Montreal, Halifax, Calgary and Victoria and work on a wide range of programs from advanced naval technology products and unmanned systems software to providing delivery and in-service support of the latest military aircraft to commercial engine repair and overhaul capabilities. This position is part of the Rotary and Mission Systems business area, where employees across Canada support engineering, systems integration, training, sustainment and in-service support programs for Canadian and international military customers across land, air and sea.

Clearance required for role

Nato Secret

Required skills, qualifications and experience

  • Current university or college student in Computer Science, Web Development, or Multimedia (HTML, JavaScript)
  • User Centric Design
  • Wireframing
  • User Interface Mockups
  • Interactive Prototyping
  • User Research Methodologies (Card Sorting, User Testing etc.)
  • Design System Development
  • Interaction Design
  • Information Architectural Design
  • Diagram Designs (User Journeys, Flow Diagrams etc.)

Desired skills, qualifications and experience

  • Jira
  • Microsoft Visio
  • Adobe Experience Design
  • Balsamiq Wireframes
  • Microsoft Word
  • Adobe Photoshop
  • Adobe Illustrator

Workplace Vaccination Policy

Lockheed Martin Canada is committed to lead and support efforts to ensure a safe and healthy work environment for our employees, partners and customers. Our Workplace Vaccination policy provides direction on our approach to managing COVID-19 and that policy will likely evolve as conditions and legal requirements change. At this time, all current and future employees of Lockheed Martin Canada who work on certain federal government sites must be fully vaccinated. We are also asking all employees to voluntarily submit their current vaccine status.

Equal Opportunity Statement

Lockheed Martin Canada is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity in the workplace. We are committed to excellence in serving all customers, including people with disabilities, and we encourage feedback on the provision of these services.

title: newProject Architect and Designer - Peterborough
description:
Product Architect and Designer

Safran Electronics and Defense Canada designs and manufactures electronic control units and components for aerospace and safety critical applications. Our multidisciplinary Engineering team consists of product, hardware, software and test specialists with a vast array of skills and competencies to meet the rigorous demands of the market.

We are seeking individuals to join our Product Architecture and Design team within the Systems Engineering Group. This team is responsible for the high level design, architecture, validation and verification of our products with an emphasis on ARP-4754A Certification Objectives, Safety and Customer Compliance.

This position will report to the Systems Engineering Manager, and work within an integrated team of system, product, hardware, software and test engineers to execute our projects on time, on cost and on quality.

Why Join Us

  • Enjoy flexible working hours
  • We encourage a healthy work life balance with 37 hour work weeks – half day Fridays
  • Work from home options
  • Comprehensive Health and Dental Benefits
  • Employee Share Program
  • Employee Recognition and engagement programs
  • Opportunities to further your career with excellent Training and Development programs
  • Enjoy a positive organizational cultures, social activities and employee events
  • Enjoy the perks of a larger corporation with a small town feel
  • Contribute to an exciting industry with a company that prioritizes quality and safety
  • Mobility opportunities and more offerings of the Safran Group and their 342 locations within 30 countries
  • Located in the beautiful Kawarthas, Peterborough is only 1.5 hours away from Toronto

Responsibilities:

  • Perform product level requirements definition, allocation and validation
  • Design and analyze system functions focusing on cost, performance and complexity including the decomposition at hardware and software levels
  • Support and analyze product verification methods and coverage including assessment of test results for compliance to customer and certification objectives
  • Work with project and program team to refine work estimates, and assess impacts of changes
  • Manage changes to the technical definition and configuration of products

Technical Capabilities:

  • Knowledge of design architectures and methods for safety critical systems
  • Ability to define and partition functions and requirements between technical domains including, but not limited to, hardware, PLDs, software and mechanical
  • Fluency with standard design and management tools such as IBM Doors, MATLAB / Simulink

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical, Computer or Industrial Engineering (or equivalent)
  • 3+ years of relevant experience in Product design, test or manufacturing engineering
  • Knowledge and experience in aircraft product certification requirements including DO-254, DO-178B/C, ARP-4754A and DO-160G

Additional Considerations:

  • A background in embedded control systems, preferably in the aerospace and defense domain, including working knowledge of system interfaces and sensors such as RVDT/LVDT, BLDC motors, Servo Motors, temperature and pressure sensors and ARINC communications.
  • Knowledge of programming and scripting languages such as C, C++, Python and SQL for the purpose of work automation and data analysis
  • Strong verbal and communication skills

We wish to thank all applicants for their interest but advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Software Development, Avionics, Aerospace, developer, software architect, software designer

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Profit sharing
  • Stock options
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Safran Electronics and Defense Canada is following all legislative guidelines as well as maintaining infection spreading protocols ie mask, social distancing

Application question(s):

  • This position is onsite in Peterborough at 2000 Fisher Drive. Does this commute work for you?
  • Are you familiar with DO - 254, DO-178B/C, ARP-475A and DO-160G?

Experience:

  • Software architecture: 1 year (preferred)
  • Product Design: 1 year (preferred)

title: newPCE Designer
description:
Qui sommes-nous? :

Chez Pratt & Whitney, nous croyons que le vol motorisé a transformé, et continuera de transformer, le monde. C'est pourquoi nous travaillons avec un cœur d'explorateur et un acharnement de perfectionniste à concevoir, produire et entretenir les moteurs d'avion les plus avancés et les plus fiables du monde. Notre portefeuille diversifié - composé de moteurs commerciaux et militaires ainsi que de moteurs destinés à l'aviation d'affaires, générale et régionale, et aux hélicoptères – nous permet, ainsi qu’à nos clients, de passer du possible au réel. C'est ainsi que, chez Pratt & Whitney, nous abordons notre travail et ce qui nous inspire à nous dépasser.

Quelles sont nos attentes?

Dans le cadre d'une équipe de spécialistes en conception mécanique des composants de turbomachines, vous devrez fournir un soutien technique à la chaîne d'approvisionnement en exécutant les taches suivantes:

  • Modifier la conception qui permettra de résoudre les défis de productibilité sur les composants de turbomachines.
  • Effectuer des évaluations techniques approfondies de matériel non conforme.
  • Soutenir les activités d'externalisation de définir et d'exécuter des plans de corroboration des composants fabriqués par de nouveaux fournisseurs.
  • Initier des modifications de conception pour des réductions de coûts.


Ce dont vous avez besoin pour réussir

  • Baccalauréat en Génie Mécanique
  • Compréhension des dessins de l’ingénierie
  • Habilités à communiquer
  • Esprit d’analyse
  • Focus sur les résultats
  • Travail d’équipe et rigueur
  • Bilinguisme préférable

Diversité, Équité et Inclusion

Le générique masculin est utilisé sans discrimination et uniquement dans le but d'alléger le texte. P&WC souscrit au principe de l’équité en matière d’emploi et est déterminé à encourager la diversité et l’inclusion. Nous sommes heureux d’étudier la demande d’emploi de tous les candidats qualifiés, sans égard à leur race, couleur, religion, orientation sexuelle, genre, nationalité d’origine, âge, handicap, statut d’ancien combattant ou tout autre statut protégé par la loi.

*********************************************************************************************

Who we are

At Pratt & Whitney, we believe that powered flight has transformed – and will continue to transform – the world. That’s why we work with an explorer’s heart and a perfectionist’s grit to design, build, and service the world’s most advanced aircraft engines. We do this across a diverse portfolio – including Commercial Engines, Military Engines, Business Aviation, General Aviation, Regional Aviation, and Helicopter Aviation – and as a way of turning possibilities into realities for our customers. This is how we at Pratt & Whitney approach our work, and this is why we are inspired to go beyond.

What are our expectations?

As part of a team of specialists in mechanical design of turbomachinery components, you will provide engineering support to the supply chain by performing the following:

  • Design modifications that will resolve producibility challenges on turbomachinery components.
  • Perform thorough engineering evaluations of non-conforming material.
  • Support outsourcing activities by defining and executing substantiation plans for components manufactured by new suppliers.
  • Initiate design modifications for cost reductions

The tools you need to be successful

  • Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering
  • Understanding of engineering drawings
  • Communication skills
  • Analytical skills
  • Focus on results
  • Teamwork and thoroughness
  • Bilingualism preferred

Diversity and inclusion

The masculine pronoun is used without discrimination and solely for the purpose of making the text easier to read. P&WC is an equal opportunities employer, seeking to promote diversity and inclusion. We will consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by law.

title: newGraphic Designer/Illustrator
description:
Job Title: Graphic Designer / Illustrator (1 position)

Role: The Alberta Aviation Museum is looking for a motivated individual with a passion for graphics and design and a strong disdain of Papyrus font to join our team this summer. Hone your illustration, typography, and design skills this summer as you help develop new interpretive and wayfinding signage, engaging worksheets and reusable assets for our public programming. Successful candidates will be familiar and competent with both vector-based and raster-based graphical software (Adobe Illustrator & Photoshop, preferably – but alternates such as Inkscape and GIMP are acceptable), and a demonstrated eye for design.

Responsibilities:

  • Illustrate and create graphics for public programming, stamp passports, tickets, colouring sheets
  • Assist with design of interpretive signage by creating templates to be applied to a variety of existing and current exhibits.
  • Recreate vintage aircraft and airline logos to help design custom products for the gift shop.
  • Video editing – Identifying key points of interest in existing 50-minute interviews and cutting them into shorter segments, supplemented by photographs, title cards, etc for display in the museum and online.
  • Other creative projects to be tailored to the successful candidate’s skills and interests.

As this position is funded through the Government of Canada’s Canada Summer Jobs program. All candidates
must:

  • Be 15 to 30 years old
  • A Canadian citizen, or Permanent Resident of Canada, or person with refugee protection.
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada

Qualifications:

  • Familiarity using vector graphics software (Illustrator, Inkscape), as well as raster graphics software

(Photoshop, GIMP, MSPaint). You should be confident that you can trace the letterhead above

  • Excellent eye for design.
  • Photography skills an asset
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently and in a team environment
  • A recognized Certificate, Diploma, or Degree in Graphics Design or Illustration is an asset.

Reports to: Curator

Wage: $17.00/hour

Hours: 30 hours/week for 16 weeks; ideally primarily during weekday business hours, but with flexibility.

Duration: May 11th, 2021 – August 26th, 2021

Closing Date: May 6th, 2021

Job Type: Fixed term contract
Contract length: 16 weeks

Salary: $17.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Flexible schedule

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • No weekends

Application question(s):

  • Do you meet all of the following criteria: Between 15-30 years of age, legally entitled to work in Canada, and either a Canadian Citizen, Permanent Resident, or Person with Refugee Protection?
  • Are you familiar with the differences between vector and raster graphics?

Application deadline: 2022-05-06
Expected start date: 2022-05-11

  • Git
  • Redux
  • Current university or college student in Computer Science, Web Development, or Multimedia (HTML, JavaScript)

Desired skills, qualifications and experience

In this role it is anticipated you will work with these software applications. Demonstrated experience in these or similar applications is considered a nice to have.
  • GitLab
  • Visual Studio Code
  • Chrome Developer Tools
  • Jira
  • Terminal

Workplace Vaccination Policy

Lockheed Martin Canada is committed to lead and support efforts to ensure a safe and healthy work environment for our employees, partners and customers. Our Workplace Vaccination policy provides direction on our approach to managing COVID-19 and that policy will likely evolve as conditions and legal requirements change. At this time, all current and future employees of Lockheed Martin Canada who work on certain federal government sites must be fully vaccinated. We are also asking all employees to voluntarily submit their current vaccine status.

Equal Opportunity Statement

Lockheed Martin Canada is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity in the workplace. We are committed to excellence in serving all customers, including people with disabilities, and we encourage feedback on the provision of these services.

title: Jr Engineer - Software Development
description:
For those who dream of advancing our space in the Universe and on Earth, we’ll take you there.

Serving the world from our Canadian home and our global offices, MDA is an international space mission partner and robotics & space operations, satellite systems and geointelligence pioneer with a 50-year story of firsts on and above the Earth. Today, we're leading the charge towards viable Moon colonies, enhanced Earth observation, communication in a hyper-connected world, and more.

We’re fueled by a pioneering spirit that carries us beyond. And together we enable highly skilled people to continually push boundaries and tackle big challenges requiring solutions that endure and inspire.

Are you ready to launch the next stage of your career in the new space economy? We would love to hear from you!

We’re on the hunt for an Associate Software Engineer on our Geointelligence team at our Richmond office

As a Software Engineer with the Global Procedure Designer (GPD) program, you will make worldwide flight safer by improving the world’s leading instrument flight procedure design system. You will solve complex problems through hard work, a passion for quality, an inquisitive mind, a team-first approach and an innovative edge. A diverse team of domain experts and software professionals will support you.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Create engineering solutions to achieve the mission of our customers in a cost-effective way
  • Follow industry and corporate quality standards and best practices
  • Plan work, provide effort estimates, and drive your work to completion
  • Design, code, test, integrate, deploy, debug and document high quality software
  • Troubleshoot problems in a fast-paced, continuous integration environment
  • Work from requirements to develop or modify very large complex software applications
  • Create internal tools to support team members and automated test
  • Identify innovative technological advances to support our long-term Aviation business goals

EXPERIENCE

  • A University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or other relevant discipline, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to solve complex problems within budget and on schedule
  • Programming experience in an object oriented language
  • Experience with Java and/or C++ is desirable.
  • Knowledge of object-oriented (OOP) design patterns
  • Previous experience in the Aviation domain and Aircraft navigation concepts and systems is not required—but a keen interest in learning about it is

We’re a dream team of purpose-driven, collaborative and passionate people, and we are constantly looking for others to join #TeamMDA to ignite new and innovative approaches to problem-solving that push us forward to improve life on and above Earth. If you’re excited to expand our place in space and driven to inspire the next generation, we’ll take you there.

We have entered a new era of exploration and development, and MDA welcomes all who yearn to suit up and be part of it. An equal opportunity employer prizing diversity, integrity and collaboration, we are committed to growing MDA’s and Canada’s leadership in this next golden age.

MDA provides competitive compensation and benefits packages for its employees at all locations. As a team member of MDA, you and your qualified dependents are eligible to participate in a benefit plan that ensures a comprehensive level of protection through competitive health care including; extended healthcare and flexible drug plans, dental and vision benefits, disability income protection, life insurance, group retirement savings plans; and an employee and family assistance program.

Comments/Special Considerations:

With a priority on maintaining the safety of our employees, customers and communities, MDA has implemented a mandatory vaccination policy for employees and visitors. Please speak to a recruiter for more details.

Successful candidates must obtain and hold security clearance at the reliability status level, and pass security assessment for the Controlled Goods Program (CGP) and ITAR.

MDA is an equal opportunity employer prizing diversity and inclusion. We are committed to treating all employees and applicants for employment with respect and dignity. If you require assistance and/or reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please feel free to notify us.

title: newChief Aerostructures
description:
The Organization
De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Ltd. (‘DHC’) is a proudly Canadian aerospace company currently transitioning its corporate headquarters to Calgary, AB. DHC is undertaking a consolidation of its underlying subsidiary companies under a single brand currently offering engineering, aftermarket, new aircraft manufacturing, modifications, parts manufacturing and flight training. DHC currently has approximately 1,200 employees based in BC, AB and ON as well as in markets and distribution hubs world-wide. Our strong entrepreneurial spirit, together with a culture of empowerment, quality and innovation create opportunities to grow and succeed in an organization with a proud heritage and bright future.

*
Profile*
The Chief Aerostructures will be responsible for overseeing a group of Structures and Systems Engineering Designers, interacting with various supporting departments, ensuring proposed design changes meet project milestones.

*
Location*
This position will be located on-site in Toronto, ON, or Calgary, AB.

*
Duties & Responsibilities*
Essential Functions

  • Familiarity with typical aircraft structures and systems architecture.
  • Proficiency with mechanical design practices.
  • Have good knowledge of Catia v5 and Enovia, as well as common work packages.
  • Manage a group of engineers with work distribution, communications, equipment, development.
  • Participate in resource planning activities and budgetary preparations.
  • Be able to analyze complex problems, devise new or modified approaches, drive towards improved conclusions.
  • Makes decisions and recommendations on technical issues autonomously and sets priorities on a mid to long term range.
  • Demonstrates specific skills in coordinating resources and deliverables in a cross functional environment amongst business units.
  • Be able to explain difficult concepts and persuade others to adopt a point of view.
  • Provide technical leadership, coaching, mentoring, training on a regular basis to direct reports.

Additional Functions

  • Actively works to improve daily processes and ensures all work meets customer requirements.
  • Maintains a current knowledge of developments in the field of specialty and/or other related aircraft fields to recommend innovations to improve quality and effectiveness of company product.
  • Performs other duties such as Internal Audit Support, Airworthiness containment activities and corrective action implementation.

*
Education & Professional Qualifications*

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering - Aerospace or Mechanical Engineering.
  • 10 years or more in a technical and leadership environment in the aircraft industry.

*
Experience*

  • Licensed or eligible for licensing as a Professional Engineer.

*
Skills*

  • Strong leadership, problem solving, flexibility and project management skills.
  • Team player with a strong sense of initiative, responsibility, and good judgment.
  • Excellent communication skills (written and spoken) in English.

_
De Havilland Canada is an equal opportunity employer and encourages women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities, and members of visible minorities to apply. As per the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), De Havilland will accommodate the needs of applicants with disabilities throughout all stages of the selection process. If you need accommodation during the recruitment process, please advise your Talent Acquisition representative. Information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially._

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
About Us:

At Anaram Power, our main focus is on new VTOL (Vertical Take-off and Landing) aircrafts to enable the delivery of goods to all Canadians. Anarampower is designing a new technology of VTOL aircraft to enhance long range flight. Our focus is to increase flight time by inventing new systems in conjunction of existing technologies for optimum performance.

We have an amazing group of individuals with different skill level and backgrounds who share the same vision in achieving our goal of becoming Canada 's largest VTOL provider for product delivery. We care about our employee’s happiness and growth in and out of the workplace. We take special care in making sure everyone receives the training and assistance they need to be successful at our company and a well-rounded engineer.

Job Type: Full-time / Permanent Position

Salary: $26.00 / hour Hours – 40hrs / Week

Location: Port Coquitlam - British Columbia

Education: Bachelor's degree

Job Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Produce plans and specifications
  • Ensure the technical monitoring of projects in collaboration with other designers and project managers.
  • Act as technical support for the maintenance team.
  • Provide feedback (post-mortem) on the project to main stakeholders
  • Participate in the improvement of the existing processes
  • Knowledge of automation and robotics to improve processes and the bottom line.
  • Knowledge of 2 stroke and 4 stroke engines and mechanical component and ability to repair and maintain the engines
  • Knowledge of Generators, brushless dc motors and alternator wiring.
  • Knowledge composite materials and ability to conduct a design and work with composite materials
  • Make recommendations and give considerations when estimating/quoting new products to customers or company leaders to have the best use of production timelines and equipment.
  • Ability to effectively present information to top management, public group, and/or customers
  • Plan and design layouts.
  • Study new machinery and facilities and recommend or select efficient combinations,
  • Design, develop and conduct time studies and work simplification programs,
  • Develop performance standards, evaluation systems and wage and incentive programs,
  • Conduct studies of the reliability and performance of plant facilities and production or administrative systems,

Skills and Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Mechanical engineering, with coursework in the manufacturing process
  • 5+ years working experience in a similar role in a high-tech manufacturing environment.
  • Experience with manufacturing processes involving high precision mechanical, electrical, electronics, or elector-mechanical assembly.
  • Familiar with MS Excel and Word
  • Proficiency in 3D CAD software, reading of mechanical drawings.
  • Experience in developing manufacturing floor plan layouts
  • Experience in designing and working with CNC MILL and lathe machine and fixtures an asset
  • Competent in reading engineering drawings with the ability to discern the merit of the drawings
  • An expert in following disciplines:
  • Precision composite manufacturing (fiber carbon – Fiber Kevlar – Fiber Glass)
  • Identify and assist in throughput improvements, including designing and improving processes, assembly jigs, tools, and fixtures.
  • Ability to provide feedback both orally and in writing
  • You are bilingual with good abilities for oral and written communication.
  • Ability to work independently and/or within a collaborative team structure.
  • Positive, self-motivated individual with high level of enthusiasm and willingness to learn and incorporate coaching and instructions into daily tasks and assignments.
  • Highly organized with critical attention to details

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule:

  • 8-hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Anyone who can legally work in Canada can apply for this job. If you are not currently authorized to work in Canada, unfortunately we cannot consider your application at this time.

All applicants must include a cover letter, resume, and at least two references.

Applications are reviewed in the order they are received. All applications are appreciated; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Please do not contact via phone.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $26.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Port Coquitlam, BC V3C 4K8: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

title: Tool Designer
description:
SUMMARY:

Reporting to the Engineering Manager, as the Tool Designer, you will be responsible designing high quality tooling, gauges, and fixtures according to customer requests.

Shift : 4/10 Day Shift Monday-Thursday (6am-4pm)

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Design fixtures, gages, and tooling per customer requests
  • Ensure all designs are high in quality and accuracy
  • Assist staff in project development and investigations related to tooling issues
  • Utilize CAD software, specifically Catia V5 to prepare tooling designs and blueprints
  • Interact directly with customers on design changes or specifications to ensure effective product design and implementation
  • Interact directly with suppliers to insure timely delivery of purchased items
  • Maintain continuous process improvement with safe work practices to reduce cost, improve quality and increase throughput for new and existing processes.
  • Maintain product and computer reputation by complying with EH&S and government regulations, manufacturing information and records.
  • Provide shop floor support and assist with the Root Cause Corrective Action (RCCA) process.
  • Support and/or participate in Continuous Improvement (CI) events and ACE activities.
  • Monitor and support work off shifts
  • Perform other duties as assigned

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in a technical discipline and minimum 5 years of relevant experience or an Advance degree in the appropriate discipline and minimum 3 years of experience. In the absence of a degree, 9 years of relevant experience.
  • Licensed General Machinist or Tool and Die maker is preferred
  • Minimum 5 years of Tool Design experience in the Aerospace Industry
  • Proficient in the use of Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing.
  • Comprehensive knowledge and experience in aircraft tool design and fabrication, to include drilling, machining, welding, assembly and inspection.
  • Prior experience in manufacturing and machining.
  • Strong ability to read, analyze and interpret engineering drawings, general business, professional journals, technical procedures or governmental regulations.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office applications.
  • Excellent team player with demonstrated problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
  • Strong ability to effectively communicate, present information and respond to questions from managers, clients and customers.
  • Previous experience with continuous improvement tools, including the ability to analyze and improve processes to reduce cost and improve quality would be an asset.
  • Successful candidates must meet and be cleared under all requirements relating to ITAR and CGD.

Collins Aerospace, a Raytheon Technologies company, is a leader in technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for the global aerospace and defense industry. Collins Aerospace has the capabilities, comprehensive portfolio and expertise to solve customers’ toughest challenges and to meet the demands of a rapidly evolving global market.


The high quality products we design, test and produce in our Mechanical Systems help millions of passengers reach their destinations safely – every day! From landing systems and actuation to propellers, flight controls and hoist and winch – the products we manufacture work together behind the scenes to enhance the overall flight experience. We delight our customers with superior products and best-in-class service. Our global team is committed to continuous improvement – we work hard to make our solutions lighter-weight, stronger and more technically advanced, so that plane travel can be safer, more affordable and more sustainable in the years to come. We are looking for the best and brightest to fly and land with us!


Diversity drives innovation; inclusion drives success. We believe a multitude of approaches and ideas enable us to deliver the best results for our workforce, workplace, and customers. We are committed to fostering a culture where all employees can share their passions and ideas so we can tackle the toughest challenges in our industry and pave new paths to limitless possibility.


WE ARE REDEFINING AEROSPACE.

title: newManufacturing Associate
description:
We Are Tresco

A leading designer and manufacturer of control room consoles and industrial furniture. We have engineered, built, and installed consoles into over 5000+ facilities around the planet. Our consoles can be found in mission-critical environments in every US state and Canadian province; in Europe, Central and South America; Africa, India, China, all throughout the Middle East; the Caribbean, and the list goes on and on. Tresco conducts all design and fabrication work in-house at our Calgary global headquarters, with every project being engineered-to-order based on the end user’s spatial, equipment, and personnel requirements.

What's a Console?

Consoles are those cool control desks frequently depicted in military and science fiction movies. They can be found in any facility utilizing distributed control systems (DCS) or supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) in order to monitor specific industrial or military processes... Think aerospace mission control, air traffic control towers, the naval bridges/command decks of warships and aircraft carriers; incident command and emergency dispatch centers; global network operation centers, oil refineries, and nuclear power plants... That’s precisely what we engineer, build, ship, and install for Fortune1000 companies and governments all over the world.

Day 30: Required Capabilities & How You Can Make a Difference

After your initial training and competencies have been demonstrated, you will be asked to help assemble the consoles. Think of consoles like a large Lego® or Meccano® set that screws together and is composed of steel, aluminum, wood, and plastic laminate.

By Day 30, the ideal candidate will be able to conduct the following work without mentorship or supervision:

  • Understand, organize, erect, and level steel frame sections to form complete consoles.
  • Ability to attach exterior panels and worksurface to console frames.
  • Identify all sub-assemblies, accessories, and components with the ability to integrate them into consoles.
  • Possess a comprehensive understanding of Tresco’s products and processes.

If you have the skills you may also be asked to help with the following aspects of production:

  • Wiring the consoles’ electromechanical lifting mechanisms and control boxes.
  • Building custom crates to ensure consoles arrive safely at site.
  • Receiving orders of raw precursor materials and preparing finished product for shipment.

Day 365 and Beyond

Once advanced technical abilities and strong desire to learn has been demonstrated for a period of one year, you may be eligible to receive training to run our C.N.C. equipment, learn programming, lead a production group, and/or travel to do installs on client site around the world.

What We Offer:

  • A clean, safe work environment
  • Competitive wages
  • Advancement opportunities
  • Health and dental benefits
  • Respect and camaraderie

At Tresco, we value hard work and those dedicated to their own success. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We appreciate all applications, only those selected will be contacted for an interview.

You can learn more about Tresco Consoles online at www.trescoconsoles.com

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $18.00-$25.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Tresco follows Alberta Health Guidelines

Experience:

  • Production & Assembly Occupations: 1 year (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-20

title: Electrical Designer
description:
Equivalent Experience

Description:
  • Apply knowledge of embedded systems and avionics for aerospace (i.e. define, design, develop, simulate, test, validate/verify);
  • Ensure the adequacy between the established technical requirements and the proposed engineering solutions;
  • Ensure the technical compliance of products and services in accordance with the needs of internal and external customers;
  • Apply and monitor internal company processes and policies (engineering, materials and processes, airworthiness, project management, quality, etc.);
  • Apply aeronautical regulations, standards, and procedures (FAR, CAR, JAR, RAC, TAM, etc.) in order to support a certification file;
  • Participate in technical reviews and problem solving activities;
  • Prepare analyzes and technical reports;
  • Perform electrical load analyzes;
  • Analyze or modify circuit diagrams and electrical cables;
  • Prepare or modify electrical schematic drawings using computer-aided design and manufacturing (CAD/CAM) tools and/or computer-aided drawing (CAD) tools, in accordance with company and customer standards;
  • Support technical activities and the customer during the production of prototypes. Required
Skills:
Aerospace, Electrical engineering, Avionics electrical, System integration, Systems engineering, Catia

Additional Skills & Qualifications:
Min 2 years Electrical Design on aircraft

title: newReliability and Maintainability Engineer
description:
The Organization
De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Ltd. (‘DHC’) is a proudly Canadian aerospace company currently transitioning its corporate headquarters to Calgary, AB. DHC is undertaking a consolidation of its underlying subsidiary companies under a single brand currently offering engineering, aftermarket, new aircraft manufacturing, modifications, parts manufacturing and flight training. DHC currently has approximately 1,200 employees based in BC, AB and ON as well as in markets and distribution hubs world-wide. Our strong entrepreneurial spirit, together with a culture of empowerment, quality and innovation create opportunities to grow and succeed in an organization with a proud heritage and bright future.

*
Location*
This position is located on-site in Calgary, AB, Toronto, ON, or Victoria, BC.

*
Duties & Responsibilities*

  • Demonstrate compliance with safety requirements via review and/ or preparation of System Safety Analysis certification reports, including FEMA, Fault Tree, and common cause analyses.
  • Prepare qualitative & quantitative RMAS related analyses deliverables.
  • Support development of Instructions for Continued Airworthiness and Master Minimum Equipment List (MMEL).
  • Be responsible for the successful execution of R&M deliverables for new development projects while supporting the needs of aircraft fleet in service and aircraft production.
  • Participate in design reviews, customer meetings, technical and business-related workshops.
  • Champion the performance and development of junior engineers, designers, project managers.
  • Drive continuous improvement and demonstrate exemplary technical leadership.

*
Education & Professional Qualification*s

  • Bachelor's degree in mechanical or aerospace engineering.
  • +8 years of relevant Aerospace RM&S experience.

*
Experience*

  • Familiarity with Reliability, Safety, and Maintainability design, analysis, and testing concepts.
  • Familiarity with aircraft systems (with experience in Electrical and Avionics Systems preferred) and operational documentation.

*
Skills*

  • Knowledge of relevant Part 25 regulations and industry guidance material.
  • Knowledge of MSG-3 scheduled maintenance program development and MMEL requirements.
  • Proficient with software tools such as MS Office, CAFTA, FaultrEASE.
  • You communicate effectively and confidently in all professional situations.
  • You are excited and motivated by the challenges of design, manicure, and support of aircraft.
  • Travel may be required.

_
At De Havilland Canada, we aim to be inclusive and diverse and provide equal opportunity for employment. All qualified applicants, regardless of gender, age, race, religion, sexual orientation and disability, are encouraged to apply._

title: Hardware Designer
description:
RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Analyzing and specifying hardware development environment (HDE), verification environment, debugging and profiling tools
  • Developing, deploying and supporting DO-254 processes, reviews (SOI), development plans and review checklists
  • Analyzing user’s requirements and creating a detailed hardware architecture and formal structured design
  • Performing electronics, hardware FPGA design and mechanical engineering design
  • Designing electronic CC electronics from detailed designs to meet EMC/EMI requirements and performance
  • Preparing material costs and timing estimates, reports and design descriptions for electronic systems and equipment
  • Performing circuit analysis and traceability from user’s requirements to formal design and implementation
  • Supporting and inspecting the installation, modification, testing and operation of electronic components, systems and equipment
  • Debugging and troubleshooting hardware circuits
  • Integrating CC components into embedded system environment, including test bench and on aircraft at customer sites
  • Working with product development teams – product/systems and/or Software Engineers and engineering support in a leadership role
  • Participating and supporting program risk assessment and mitigation
  • Supervising the work of junior designers and/or other engineering employees

QUALIFICATIONS:

What we are looking for:
  • Minimum 5 years of analog and digital experience in circuit design and analysis;
  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of training and experience;
  • Experience in control systems (Engine Control, Landing and Steering Controls an asset), Avionics, Aerospace, Automotive, Medical Devices, or other high reliability products.
  • Technical and hardware qualifications (DO-254) experience would be an asset but is not necessary;
  • Proven experience working with standards, processes and work procedures in a structured design environment;
  • Familiarity with RTCA, Inc. certification standards;

title: Mechanical Technician Designer
description:
LIFE AT BRP

We create innovative ways to move – on snow, water, asphalt. In the air, on the ground and everywhere in between.

Built on a 75-year tradition of ingenuity and intensive customer focus, BRP is headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec and operates manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, and Austria. We have a total workforce of more than 14 500 driven, resourceful people.

Our portfolio of industry-leading and distinctive products includes Ski-Doo and Lynx snowmobiles, Sea-Doo watercraft, Can-Am on- and off-road vehicles, Alumacraft, Manitou, Quintrex, Stacer and Savage boats, Evinrude and Rotax marine propulsion systems as well as Rotax engines for karts, motorcycles and recreational aircraft. We support our lines of product with a dedicated parts, accessories and clothing business to fully enhance your riding experience.

Because it’s not about the destination. It’s about the journey. Yours.

We are passionate and qualified; by joining BRP, you will evolve within an experienced team that will welcome you with open arms.

www.brp.com.

WHY JOIN OUR TEAM?

To be part of a team that’s driving BRP’s transition to electrification of its products and explore new products;

To work in the creative field of recreation vehicle development;

To take the opportunity to innovate and influence technical guidelines in the motorsports sector.

IN THIS ROLE, YOUR MAIN DUTIES WILL BE:
Producing 2D technical drawings and their 3D models;

Working to support component design;

Taking part in component development and tracking prototype fabrication;

Helping team designers and engineers work through the problem-solving process;

Using internal systems to follow up on your projects and move them forward.

YOU’RE PERFECT FOR THIS ROLE IF YOU:
Hold a D.C.S. (D.E.C.) in mechanical engineering, Design option, or relevant design experience;

Have a real aptitude for mechanics as well as good 3D visualization skills;

Know how to use software like Catia V5 or Solidworks;

Are resourceful and can work independently;

Are known for your optimism and adaptable attitude;

Are good at finding creative solutions to problems you encounter;

Are an outstanding collaborator and team player;

Are a fan of BRP recreational products.

WE’RE ALWAYS RECRUITING! Not sure if you have what it takes? Let us be the judge – apply today!

title: newStructures and Systems Installation Engineer
description:
The Organization
De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Ltd. (‘DHC’) is a proudly Canadian aerospace company currently transitioning its corporate headquarters to Calgary, AB. DHC is undertaking a consolidation of its underlying subsidiary companies under a single brand currently offering engineering, aftermarket, new aircraft manufacturing, modifications, parts manufacturing and flight training. DHC currently has approximately 1,200 employees based in BC, AB and ON as well as in markets and distribution hubs world-wide. Our strong entrepreneurial spirit, together with a culture of empowerment, quality and innovation create opportunities to grow and succeed in an organization with a proud heritage and bright future.

*
Profile*
The* Structures and Systems Installation Designer *will be responsible for producing clean and efficient aircraft structure and systems installation designs within the framework of a new development program, that meet all appropriate industry regulations.

*
Location*
This position will be located on-site in Toronto, ON, Calgary, AB or Victoria, BC.

*
Duties & Responsibilities*
Essential Functions

  • Create both solid models, instanced with a PLM environment, and 2D drawings that meet all appropriate ANSI and industry standards.
  • Be proficient with GD&T standards.
  • Be proficient with mechanical design practices.
  • Be familiar with typical aircraft structures and systems architecture.
  • Be an Intermediate or Expert user of Catia v5 and Enovia, as well as common work packages, such as Generative Sheet Metal Design.
  • Be able to optimize between competing design criteria.
  • Efficiently reviewing certification data of existing designs and using that data to evolve or optimize that design.
  • Work cordially and effectively with other support groups, end users, and consumers of your designs.
  • Be able to explain your design decisions clearly and succinctly
  • Be comfortable asking for input from senior members of the engineering department.
  • Be able to work effectively as part of the Design Team, but also as a member of the larger Engineering Department.

Additional Functions

  • Actively works to improve daily processes and ensures all work meets customer requirements.
  • Maintains a current knowledge of developments in the field of specialty and/or other related aircraft fields to recommend innovations to improve quality and effectiveness of company product.
  • Performs other duties such as Internal Audit Support, Airworthiness containment activities and corrective action implementation.

*
Education & Professional Qualifications*

  • Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Engineering, a related curriculum, or equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential functions of the job.
  • 5 years in the specific technical discipline or 10 years broad engineering experience in several technical disciplines with Bachelors, or 3 years in the specific technical discipline with Masters, or 1 year in the specific technical discipline with PhD.

*
Experience*

  • Experience in Aerospace and preferably Aftermarket would be considered an asset.

*
Skills*

  • Team player with a strong sense of initiative, responsibility, and good judgment.
  • Able to manage several concurrent projects and meet tight deadlines.
  • Able to think quickly and creatively in a fast-moving and changing business context.
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.

_
De Havilland Canada is an equal opportunity employer and encourages women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities, and members of visible minorities to apply. As per the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), De Havilland will accommodate the needs of applicants with disabilities throughout all stages of the selection process. If you need accommodation during the recruitment process, please advise your Talent Acquisition representative. Information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially._

title: Human Factors Expert, UX Operator Interface and GUI Designer
description:
Project/Program Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems-Canada (GDMS-C) is Canada’s premiere defence company where innovation happens on a daily basis. Our development team are committed professionals and passionate about drone mission, and making the best product possible.
Our Centre of excellence is centered towards aerospace with a specialization in Remotely Piloted Aircraft System (RPAS) technologies. The team is currently working on an exciting opportunity on the LX300, one of the best unmanned helicopters in the world. You will be working with leading edge technology and versatile tools designed to offer unprecedented levels of performance! You’ll also be part of a team of enthusiastic and keen colleagues.
Our colleagues are passionate about developing drone mission, using modern development techniques to create new and enhance capabilities, and improve the way we develop and deliver solutions to our customer. As this group is growing, we need your expertise and passion to be a dedicated member of our team!
This role will be a combination of working remotely and onsite at our Sherbrooke office. We have a number of measures in place for onsite working – our top priority remains the health and safety of our colleagues
Job Description:
GDMS-C is seeking an experienced UX Designer who would join the Remotely Piloted Airborne Systems Centre of Excellence in Sherbrooke. You will be instrumental in architecting and designing a user interface through an iterative user-centred design process. You will be a part of and report into a team of UX and Human Factors experts while working day-to-day amongst a group of diverse and cross-functional developers and engineers. You will define and distill the problem space and end user needs while advocating and communicating those needs to the engineering and development communities. Based on Human Factors and Design principles, research and usability testing methods for military systems, you will make decisions with the team to ensure the end-user has the tools to be effective.
The responsibilities and range of activities will vary, but in general will include:
  • Participate in an interdisciplinary integrated project team environment.
  • Work closely with software and engineering to develop specialized Graphical User Interface (GUI) on military embedded hardware devices or software designs for complex applications using an Agile development process.
  • As this is a cross-discipline role bridging a GUI design role with engineering and software development to ensure a positive end user experience in our products, you may be asked to support these other roles in cross-functional capacities as priorities evolve sprint-to-sprint.
  • Identify and create software user interface requirements and analysis of implementation.
  • Prepare and review design documents.
  • Document the analysis, design and test activities in accordance with development standards.
Basic Qualifications:
Our Ideal candidate has:
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Human Computer Interaction, Engineering, Industrial Design or applicable scientific discipline is required.
  • 5+ years of experience in human Factor, RPAS specific one is an asset.
  • Experience designing front end user interfaces for software and firmware in an iterative manner from low to high fidelity design.
  • Visible and expressive passion and experience with Graphical User Interface design, UX and/or Human Computer Interaction.
  • Experience using GUI prototyping tools such as Axure, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, etc.
  • Able capture end user and to translate, and coordinate a GUI experience to the development team, including the creation of assets to facilitate development.
  • Experience working in a cross-functional engineering development team.
  • Experience supporting engineering development with SW/testing/systems experience.
  • Detailed oriented in the creation and communication of front end user interface design.
  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Proficiency in French and English (Both written and verbal).
  • Strong problem solving and analysis skills.
  • Enthusiastic contributor, willing to learn new skills and takes on ownership of work.
  • Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team environment, with minimum supervision.
  • Interest in working with the Canada’s biggest Drone (LX300) in a constant evolving field with the latest technologies.
  • Must be able to obtain and maintain Canadian Security Clearance and a positive Controlled Goods Assessment. Eligibility to work in Canada either as a Canadian Citizen or Permanent Resident.

As part of our commitment to diversity, inclusion and belonging, we encourage applications from women, members of the LGBTQ2+ community, diverse cultural backgrounds and persons with disabilities.
Company Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. We believe in maintaining a diverse workplace – inclusive of beliefs, cultural background, job experiences, thoughts and ideas. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we welcome you to join our inclusive team! We will work with you around any workplace accommodation required during our application process. If you require accommodation or have questions, please contact Human Resources via recruitment@gd-ms.ca

Our Company Benefits
We pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose, offering impressive benefits:
  • A compressed nine-day fortnight and compressed hours – which means every other Friday off
  • A personalized career development plan, alongside regular progress reviews - supporting and valuing your progression within the Company
  • A flexible working environment where your contributions are recognized and rewarded with flexible benefits
