title: Electrical Designer - Experimental Engineering - BAEX
description:
Electrical Designer - Experimental Engineering - BAEX -MON18924

Description
BOMBARDIER
Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy, efficiency, reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.
In your role, you will:
  • Design electrical installations to perform the various systems & structural tests required for new aircraft development or in-service issues as well as electrical installations for experimental flight test vehicle systems.
  • Program PLCs, human-machine interfaces and data acquisition systems
  • Be responsible for the design of data acquisition, power, controls/automation and instrumentation systems as well as writing technical requirements and reports
  • Interpret technical specifications necessary related to aerospace domain to develop solution to meet the design requirements that will be entrusted to you
  • Perform preliminary load and power analyses of your design
  • Be responsible for planning of both short- and medium-term design work packages
  • Plan and adhere to project schedule deadlines while respecting allocated budgets
  • Collaborate with experienced, dynamic and efficient multidisciplinary teams dedicated to projects in order to obtain results
  • Work in collaboration with the experimental instrumentation technicians’ team
  • Be involved in the concrete accomplishment of your designs by supporting as designer the phases of manufacturing, assembly, installation and validation of your achievements.
  • Play a vital role within Bombardier Experimental department, participate in and contribute to the success and achievement of a multitude of unique and challenging projects

Qualifications
As our ideal candidate,
  • You have a degree in Electrical Engineering with eight (8) or more years of experience in a similar position
  • You have excellent knowledge of AutoCad software.
  • You have Knowledge of Rockwell PLCs and controllers, data acquisition, industrial controls and power distribution of 600Vac or less
  • You are familiar with the CSA C22.2 No.14 standard. Knowledge of SAE AS50881, IPC / WHMA-A-620B and IPC / EIA J-STD-001C aeronautical standards is an asset
  • You have practical experience in equipment design in an aeronautical and industrial context
  • You have experience in test engineering, instrumentation, control panel design and instrumentation assemblies.
  • You have a strong sense of responsibilities, good practical and technical judgment and a high level of flexibility
  • You demonstrate dynamism, good listening and a strong interest in teamwork
  • You have the ability to manage priorities in a context of parallel, multiple and complex deliveries
  • You have the ability to work under pressure to meet design deadlines
  • You are familiar with Microsoft Office software such as PowerPoint and Excel
  • You have great relational and editorial skills in English and French
  • You are eligible for registration in the Canadian Controlled Goods Directive (CGD) Program
  • You are member of the Ordre des Ingénieurs du Québec (OIQ)
Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigration status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.
Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities
Your ideas move people.

Job Electrical/Electronics Engineering
Primary Location CA-QC-Montreal St. Laurent
Organization Aerospace
Schedule Full-time
Employee Status Regular

Job Posting 15.03.2022, 2:57:05 PM

Unposting Date Ongoing

title: Sr. Specialist, Avionics and Electrical
description:
General Duties:

Provide technical/airworthiness expertise, conceptual and detailed design documentation for aircraft avionics and electrical systems modifications.

Essential Job Functions:

· Provide technical guidance and mentorship to designers to develop designs that meet contract requirements and airworthiness requirements.

· Provide technical guidance to develop cost effective and schedule conscious designs.

· Develop wiring diagrams to support the installation and integration of avionics and electrical systems.

· Perform analysis and testing of avionics and electrical system designs.

· Prepare engineering documents such as System Safety Analysis, Functional Hazard Assessment, Ground and Flight Functional Test Plans/Reports, EMI/RFI Test Plans/Reports, Maintenance/Flight Manual Supplements, Electrical Load Analysis, Modification Instructions, etc.

· Review documentation for contract and airworthiness compliance.

· Liaise with Operations.

· Provide technical and airworthiness assistance to Business Development.

· Manage project deliverables and schedules.

· Prepare engineering design feasibility studies and reports.

Skills and Experience:

· Expert in avionics and electrical systems design for aerospace applications

· TCCA delegation for Avionics and Electrical Systems

· Minimum of (15) year’s progressive aerospace engineering or design experience.

· Design and certification of federated and integrated cockpit avionics systems, cockpit displays, communication and navigation radio, autopilot, flight management systems, GPS, TCAS, TAWS, ADS-B, satellite communication, aircraft cabin systems and equipment installations.

· Familiarity with: HIRF/Lightning compliance, Electrical Wiring Interconnection Systems (EWIS) compliance, DO-160 Environmental Qualification, airworthiness compliance ground and flight testing, CAR521/FAR Part 21 Changed Product Rule.

Competencies:

· Integrity

· Excellence

· Accountability

· Innovation

· Collaboration and Team Work

· Communicating in Writing

· Communicating Orally

· Adaptability

· Initiative

· Organization and Planning

· Project Management

· Customer Service Focus

· Decision Making

· Exercising Self-Control and Being Resilient

· Interpersonal Skills

· Compliance Issues

Education:

· Post-Secondary Aviation or Aerospace Technical Education or Degree and or equivalent experience as determined by the VP, Engineering

· Transport Canada Aircraft Certification Specialty Course or equivalent

· FAR 23/25.1309 Commercial Aircraft Safety Assessment and 1309 Design Analysis course or equivalent

Reports To:

Lead Engineer

Physical Requirements:

The physical demands described herein are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms.

Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time. The employee is occasionally required to climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee may occasionally lift and move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and move objects up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Education:

title: AIRBUS CANADA - Ingénieur concepteur de réparation / Repair...
description:
**ENGLISH POSTING FOLLOWS**

Airbus est un pionnier international de l'industrie aérospatiale. Nous sommes un leader dans la conception, la fabrication et la livraison de produits, services et solutions aérospatiaux à des clients à l'échelle mondiale. Nous visons un monde mieux connecté, plus sûr et plus prospère.

Constructeur d'avions commerciaux, avec des divisions Espace et Défense ainsi que des Hélicoptères, Airbus est la plus grande entreprise aéronautique et spatiale en Europe et un leader mondial.

Chez Airbus Canada, nos collaborateurs travaillent ensemble à faire évoluer la mobilité partout dans le monde, une bonne idée après l'autre. Si vous avez une bonne idée, nous avons l'environnement pour qu'elle devienne un produit unique ou une expérience client exceptionnelle. Vos idées sont notre énergie.

Dans votre rôle, vous

  • Soutenir activement l'équipe d'ingénierie en service des structures et de la cabine de l'A220 pour s'assurer que les attentes des clients sont satisfaites ;
  • Concevoir des réparations spécifiques pour les dommages métalliques et composites dépassant les limites de la publication Aircraft Structural Repair (ASRP) ;
  • Concevoir des réparations génériques pour les structures métalliques et composites;
  • Offrir un support technique aux opérateurs en ce qui concerne la réparabilité de leur flotte d'A220 ;
  • Effectuer une enquête sur les problèmes structurels en service affectant la fiabilité, la disponibilité et la réparabilité ;
  • Participer à la conception et au soutien des modifications structurelles;
  • Représenter le soutien à la clientèle A220 dans les comités internes et externes ;
  • Participer aux initiatives d'amélioration continue de l'organisation de soutien à la clientèle.

Qualifications

En tant que candidat idéal,

  • Vous détenez un baccalauréat en génie mécanique ou aérospatial avec une expérience pertinente d'au moins dix (10) ans dans l'industrie aérospatiale;
  • Vous avez une connaissance approfondie de CATIA V5 (de préférence R19) et d'Enovia ;
  • Vous êtes à l'aise pour interroger la réparation de structures d'aéronefs ;
  • Vous avez une connaissance des logiciels MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc);
  • Vous êtes une personne dynamique avec de l'initiative, un sens aigu des responsabilités, orienté client et un bon jugement;
  • Vous êtes organisé, capable de gérer votre temps et de prioriser les tâches efficacement, tout en travaillant dans des délais serrés;
  • Vous avez de solides compétences en communication écrite et orale en anglais.
  • Avoir une connaissance des systèmes d'ingénierie, de dessin et de contrôle de configuration A220 est un atout;
  • Avoir une connaissance détaillée de l'exploitation, de l'ingénierie et de la maintenance des compagnies aériennes est un atout.

Veuillez télécharger votre curriculum vitae en français et en anglais.

L'utilisation du genre masculin a été adoptée afin de faciliter la lecture et n'a aucune intention discriminatoire.

Airbus Canada souscrit au principe d'équité en matière d'emploi et encourage les femmes, les autochtones, les personnes handicapées et les membres des minorités visibles à soumettre leurs candidatures.

*************************************************************************************************

Airbus is an international pioneer in the aerospace industry. We are a leader in the design, manufacture and delivery of aerospace products, services and solutions to customers worldwide. We aim for a better connected, safer and more prosperous world.

Manufacturer of commercial aircraft, with Space and Defense divisions as well as Helicopters, Airbus is the largest aeronautics and Space Company in Europe and a world leader.

At Airbus Canada, our people work together to make mobility evolve around the world, one good idea after another. If you have a great idea, we have the environment for it to become a unique product or a great customer experience. Your ideas are our energy.

In your role, you will

  • Actively support the A220 In-Service Engineering Structures & Cabin team to ensure customer expectations are met;
  • Design specific repairs for metallic and composite damages exceeding Aircraft Structural Repair Publication (ASRP) limitations;
  • Design generic repairs for metallic and composite structures;
  • Offer technical support to operators with regards to repairability of their A220 fleet;
  • Perform investigation on in-service structural issues affecting reliability, dispatchability and repairability;
  • Participate in the design and support of structural modifications;
  • Represent A220 Customer Support in internal and external committees;
  • Participate in the continuous improvement initiatives of the Customer Support organization.

Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,

  • You hold a bachelor's degree in Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering with a relevant experience of minimum of ten (10) years in the aerospace industry;
  • You have detailed knowledge of CATIA V5 (preferably R19) and Enovia;
  • You are comfortable in interrogating aircraft structure repair;
  • You have knowledge of MS Office software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.);
  • You are a dynamic person with initiative, a strong sense of responsibility, customer oriented and good judgment;
  • You are organized, able to manage your time and prioritize tasks effectively, while working toward tight deadlines;
  • You have strong, written and spoken, communication skills in English. French is an asset;
  • Having knowledge of A220 engineering, drawing and configuration control systems is an asset;
  • Having detailed knowledge of airline operation, engineering and maintenance is an asset.

Please upload your resume in French and English.

The use of the masculine gender has been adopted for ease of reading and has no discriminatory intent.

Airbus Canada subscribes to the principle of employment equity and encourages women, aboriginals, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities to apply.

title: Designer/Integrator CMS, Aircraft Completion - Electrical En...
description:
Designer/Integrator CMS, Aircraft Completion - Electrical Engineer -MON18835

Description
BOMBARDIER
Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy, efficiency, reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.
In your role, you will:
  • Participate in the development and certification phases of a Cabin management System (CMS)
  • Coordinate the integration of the Cabin Management System with other electrical systems such as light system, entertainment system, satellite television and hi-speed internet.
  • Generate wiring diagrams, testing procedure and certification documents to obtain the STC.
  • Responsible for supporting investigation for in production and in service, performing root cause analysis related to the cabin electrical systems.
  • Provide answers to Request for Change (RFC) by reviewing the drawings.

Qualifications
As our ideal candidate,
  • You hold a bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering with a minimum of 5 years’ experience
  • You have strong experience in development, integration and certification of a Cabin Management System, including supplier technical coordination and governance.
  • You have experience in aircraft architecture / software involving Video distribution and system controls
  • You are familiar with Electrical wiring & harnesses
  • Knowledge of Mentor Graphics / Autocad is an asset.
  • You know the basic functionalities of MS Office and the knowledge of SAP would be an asset,
  • You master written and spoken French and English.
  • You have the ability to work in a team environment, but also individually and you are able to produce quality results under pressure
  • You have a pro-active attitude, you are autonomous and enthusiastic, you like to invest yourself, have responsibilities and able to manage multiple priorities.
Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigration status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.
Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities
Your ideas move people.

title: Customer Project Mgmt representative(avionic specialist)
description:
Customer Project Mgmt representative(avionic specialist) -MON18988

Description
BOMBARDIER
Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy, efficiency, reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.
In your role, you will:
  • Support our Customers, their Pilots and Maintenance crews with regards to initial completion specification, Delivery, and Entry into service of their aircraft.
  • Advise customers on avionics subscription services for the Global aircraft and provide feedback on their selections to internal business groups
  • Interact with CPM’s, Designers, Production, and Product Planning team by acquiring and providing technical information and customer feedback.
  • Support Sales meetings and calls to provide technical expertise on cabin and cockpit avionics systems

Qualifications
As our ideal candidate,
  • You possess a good understanding of the business aircraft market segment as well as the standard equipment and options on the various Global aircraft models.
  • You are able to read and interpret complex engineering drawings and concepts and be able to translate this information into simple, concise usable information for internal and external customers.
  • You have good knowledge of Microsoft Office programs necessary.
  • You are able to interface effectively with all levels of management, customers, and team members.
  • You are fluent in both English and French. Fluency in additional languages would be an asset.
  • You have a minimum of 5 years relevant experience.
  • You are able to gather inputs from multiple sources and respond in a timely and professional manner.
  • You are able to organize and prioritize multiple projects with dynamic due dates.
  • You are actively engaged in optimizing processes and workflow to ensure solutions and contributes effectively to resolving technical and creative issues.
  • You are efficient, both alone and in a team setting, with minimal supervision.
  • You hold an Engineering degree or DEC with 3 to 5 years relevant experience, or a technical aerospace Excellent oral and written skills. Must be able to convey ideas and concepts both verbally and visually.
Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigration status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.
Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities
Your ideas move people.

title: newElectrical Designer (Remote)
description:
Equivalent Experience

**Candidate must be eligible to work in Canada**
All qualified candidates, please send your updated CV or refer a friend to esouki@actalentservices.com
Job Description
Electrical Design Engineers responsible for integration of new components in existing in-service fighter jets and other military aircraft for Canadian Air Force.

Apply knowledge of embedded systems and avionics for aerospace (i.e. define, design, develop, simulate, test, validate/verify);
Ensure the adequacy between the established technical requirements and the proposed engineering solutions;
Ensure the technical compliance of products and services in accordance with the needs of internal and external customers;
Apply and monitor internal company processes and policies (engineering, materials and processes, airworthiness, project management, quality, etc.);
Apply aeronautical regulations, standards, and procedures (FAR, CAR, JAR, RAC, TAM, etc.) in order to support a certification file;
Participate in technical reviews and problem solving activities;
Prepare analyzes and technical reports;
Perform electrical load analyzes;
Analyze or modify circuit diagrams and electrical cables;
Prepare or modify electrical schematic drawings using computer-aided design and manufacturing (CAD/CAM) tools and/or computer-aided drawing (CAD) tools, in accordance with company and customer standards;
Support technical activities and the customer during the production of prototypes.
Required Skills & Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Technical or Engineering field (Electrical, Avionics, Electrical, Aerospace, etc)
Minimum 2 years of Electrical Design experience on aircraft

À propos d'Actalent:
Actalent relie la passion à la mission. Nos solutions de candidats talentueux et la performance de nos services produisent la valeur et les résultats, tout en apportant la compétence qui permet à nos clients de réaliser plus. Nos experts situés dans le monde entier inspirent au quotidien. Nous soutenons les initiatives essentielles en ingénierie et en sciences, par les expériences qui favorisent un développement continu. La différence, c’est nos gens. Actalent est une société d’exploitation d’Allegis Group, leader mondial des solutions de candidats talentueux.

L’entreprise souscrit au principe d’égalité d’accès à l’emploi et prendra en compte toutes les candidatures sans distinction de race, sexe, âge, couleur, religion, nationalité, statut de vétéran, handicap, orientation sexuelle, identité sexuelle, information génétique ou toute autre distinction protégée par la loi.

About Actalent:
Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions.

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Concepteur de logiciel des systèmes de contrôle / Control Sy...
description:
english version will follow

Qui nous sommes

Chez Pratt & Whitney, nous croyons que le vol motorisé a transformé, et continuera de transformer, le monde. C'est pourquoi nous travaillons avec un coeur d'explorateur et un acharnement de perfectionniste à concevoir, produire et entretenir les moteurs d'avion les plus avancés et les plus fiables du monde. Notre portefeuille diversifié - composé de moteurs commerciaux et militaires ainsi que de moteurs destinés à l'aviation d'affaires, générale et régionale, et aux hélicoptères – nous permet, ainsi qu’à nos clients, de passer du possible au réel. C'est ainsi que, chez Pratt & Whitney, nous abordons notre travail et ce qui nous inspire à nous dépasser.

Quelles sont nos attentes?

L’ingénieur de développement de logiciels pour Systèmes de Contrôle fera partie d’une équipe responsable du développement du logiciel embarqué pour le système de contrôle d’une turbine à gaz. Comme ingénieur de développement de logiciels vous développerez les requis et l’implémentation logiciel (en utilisant l’outil SCADE ou Simulink). Le candidat doit avoir une connaissance de l’opération du moteur, de ces capteurs et actuateurs et de son interaction avec les différents systèmes de l’aéronef (Inverseurs de poussée, contrôle et annonciations dans la cabine de pilotage, systèmes d’extraction d’air, etc.). Le développement logiciel sera fait suivant les recommandations de la RTCA DO-178C en vue du support pour la certification de type du moteur. Elle ou il travaillera étroitement avec les fournisseurs de vérification (tests) de logiciel and du système de contrôles afin supporter les essaies fait sur nos simulateurs, le moteur ou l’aéronef.

À quoi ressemblera votre quotidien?

  • Créer les requis logiciel et développer l’implantation de logiciel embarqué du système de contrôle du moteur tout en travaillant étroitement avec les clients internes et externes.
  • Travailler de près avec le groupe de systèmes afin de s’assurer de la bonne implantation du logiciel.
  • Supporter le département de test moteurs et des simulateurs pour faciliter l’exécution des tests de vérifications.
  • Supporter les activités d’essais en vol du client.
  • Analyser les enregistrements produits durant les tests de vérification.
  • Fournir des améliorations continues pour les processus de l’organisation basés sur les apprentissages lors de l’implantation.

Ce dont vous avez besoin pour réussir

Le candidat doit avoir une formation en ingénierie (Mécanique, Électrique, Informatique ou Aérospatiale) combiné avec de 5 à 15 ans d’expérience pertinente dans le contrôle des turbines à gaz, les avions ou l’industrie automobile. Une connaissance de FADEC à double canaux et la familiarisation avec le RTCA DO-178C et/ou DO-254 serait un atout.

  • Expériences: Simulation et Modelage (MatLab ou SCADE), théorie des contrôleurs, capacités analytiques dans la dynamique des systèmes (domaine du temps et fréquence), turbine à gaz et son contrôle, leadership.
  • Qualités désirables: Bonne communication, travail d’équipe, axé sur les résultats et bonne capacités d’analyses.
  • Expérience dans multiples disciplines d’ingénierie (Systèmes de contrôle, Électrique, Opérabilité, Logiciels et Ingénieur de tests).

Ce que nous offrons

  • Programme de congé à rémunération différée
  • Garderie pour jeunes enfants
  • Programmes d’avancement professionnel et de scolarisation
  • Horaires flexibles
  • Programmes et formations sur le leadership
  • Gamme d’avantages sociaux, régime d’épargne et régime de retraite
  • Programme d’aide de financement pour les congés parentaux
  • Programme de reconnaissance et de récompense

Diversité, Équité et Inclusion

Le générique masculin est utilisé sans discrimination et uniquement dans le but d'alléger le texte. P&WC souscrit au principe de l’équité en matière d’emploi et est déterminé à encourager la diversité et l’inclusion. Nous sommes heureux d’étudier la demande d’emploi de tous les candidats qualifiés, sans égard à leur race, couleur, religion, orientation sexuelle, genre, nationalité d’origine, âge, handicap, statut d’ancien combattant ou tout autre statut protégé par la loi.

////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

Who we are

At Pratt & Whitney, we believe that powered flight has transformed – and will continue to transform – the world. That’s why we work with an explorer’s heart and a perfectionist’s grit to design, build, and service the world’s most advanced aircraft engines. We do this across a diverse portfolio – including Commercial Engines, Military Engines, Business Aviation, General Aviation, Regional Aviation, and Helicopter Aviation – and as a way of turning possibilities into realities for our customers. This is how we at Pratt & Whitney approach our work, and this is why we are inspired to go beyond.

What are our expectations?

The Controls Software Design Engineer will be responsible for developing control system software for gas turbine engines. As a Controls Software Design Engineer, the successful incumbent will develop the software requirements and the corresponding design (using Simulink or SCADE tool). The successful incumbent will understand the power plant operation, power plant sensors and actuators and power plant interacting aircraft systems (Thrust Reversers, Cockpit Controls and Engine Indications, Bleed systems, etc.). Software development will be performed following RTCA DO-178C guidelines to support the engine type certification. He/she will also work closely with suppliers to verify the software, and support control system tests performed on simulators, engines and aircrafts.

What your day to day will look like

  • Create software requirements and develop the engine controls embedded software design by working closely with internal and external customers.
  • Work closely with PWC control system department and other software suppliers for proper software implementation.
  • Support engine tests department and suppliers’ closed-loop bench test facilities to ensure smooth execution of system tests and software verification activities.
  • Support customer flight test activity.
  • Review and interpret test data produced during validation testing.
  • Provide continuous improvement to organizational processes based on lessons learned through implementation.


The tools you need to be successful

The ideal candidates must have a degree in engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, Computer Science or Aerospace); combined with 5 to 15 years of experience in controls systems engineering or working with gas turbine engines, depending on the position. Relevant experience in gas turbine, aircraft or automotive control systems as well as knowledge of dual channel FADEC would be considered an asset. An understanding of aerospace software DO-178C is required, and knowledge of DO-254 firmware is considered desirable.

  • Expertise: Simulation and modeling (MatLab or SCADE), Controls Theory, dynamic system analytical capabilities (time and frequency domain), gas turbine controls, leadership.
  • Desirable Qualities: good communication and teamwork skills, focus on results, strong analytical thinking skills, systems thinking.
  • Background in multiple engineering disciplines (Control systems, Operability, Performance, Software engineering, Test engineering)


What we offer

  • Long-term deferred compensation programs
  • Daycare for young children
  • Advancement programs to enhance education skills
  • Flexible work schedules
  • Leadership and training programs
  • Comprehensive benefits, savings and pension plans
  • Financial support for parental leave
  • Reward programs for outstanding work


Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

The masculine pronoun is used without discrimination and solely for the purpose of making the text easier to read. P&WC is an equal opportunities employer, seeking to promote diversity and inclusion. We will consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by law.

title: Design Engineer
description:
Are you an Electrical/Electronic Engineer with strong experience working with Firmware/or Hardware for Power electronics domain ? Our high-profile Vancouver client is seeking to hire few Design Engineers on a permanent basis. Apply to this amazing Design Engineer opportunity today!

We are looking for very versatile and multi-disciplinary engineers with power electronics background developing and sustaining power inverters.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills with demonstrated collaborative teamwork capabilities beside expertise level knowledge of power electronics for inverters or motor drives and ability to analyze and troubleshoot power electronics hardware.

What’s in it for you!

New position
Team player (ability to work in a small team of 3-5)
Multi functionals role
Trouble shooting is mandatory
Having good Intuition
Know how to connect different technology together
Detailed and process oriented
Power electronics background

If you love technology and have power electronics background, then the Design Engineer role with our Vancouver client could be the perfect opportunity for you!

Please contact Paul Klimau with your resume at: paul.klimau@randstad.ca

Advantages

• Leading salary compensation in 100% remote role
• 3 weeks vacation
• Benefits and Bonus structure



Responsibilities
New position
Team player (ability to work in a small team of 3-5)
Multi functionals role
Trouble shooting is mandatory
Having good Intuition
Know how to connect different technology together
Detailed and process oriented
Power electronics background

Qualifications
Strong communication and interpersonal skills with demonstrated collaborative teamwork capabilities beside expertise level knowledge of power electronics for inverters or motor drives and ability to analyze and troubleshoot power electronics hardware.


Summary
If you love technology and have power electronics background, then the Design Engineer role with our Vancouver client could be the perfect opportunity for you!

Please contact Paul Klimau with your resume at: paul.klimau@randstad.ca

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Technologist Specialist, Engineering - Projects: Aircraft Design and Development
description:
Job Description

BOMBARDIER
Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy, efficiency,reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.

The role of Project Management is to control the scope, schedule, and budget, of the activities within the Aircraft Design and Product Development team. Your daily tasks will include proactive leadership in problem resolution, establishment of scope, schedule and budget for multiple projects, and execution of the related deliverables. You will also be coordinating internal and external activities between multiple technical functions, including Program and Suppliers.

If you enjoy working in a flexible environment as part of a dynamic and autonomous team with visibility and interaction with senior management, this job is for you!

In your role, you will:
  • Manage large complex projects, and activities related to major milestones for one of many existing and/or new platforms.
  • Manage cross-functional teams in the establishment of scope, schedule and budget of large complex projects.
  • Participate in establishment of the platform overall strategic milestones
  • Participate in the review and approval of moderately complex projects
  • Assume group leadership when necessary, being able to drive critical priorities within the team
  • Act as technical coach & mentor for all aspect of Project & Change management within the team
  • Actively participate in the Project Knowledge Domain and possess deep understanding of Bombardier Manuals, promote integrity and consistency in technical activities on the platform
  • Lead process and team improvement initiatives, including support to data analytics deployment
  • Lead and coordinate Engineering Change planning, ensuring completeness and harmonization with stakeholders;
  • Work closely with technical experts, business leaders, suppliers, and customer representatives to ensure adherence and compliance of projects scope, schedule, and budget;
  • Manage priorities between projects and activities, complete strategic schedule analysis, and communicate and harmonize these priorities;
  • Identify and report on risks and lead risk mitigation planning and execution;
  • Participate and/or coordinate within the internal safety and security processes to assess, contain, and correct potential product deficiencies with cross-functional stakeholders.
  • Prepare and provide visibility of budget requirement / resource allocation;
  • Prepare and present visibility reports for the various levels of the organization;
  • Coordinate Integrated Product Development Team (IPDT) cross-functional reviews, including the platform IPDT;
  • Coordinate multi-site activities and remote participation as necessary;
  • Coordinate formal document release (Drawings, ModSums, Compliance Documents, Service Bulletins etc..);

Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,
  • You have an Business degree or equivalent, and/or a PMI certification.
  • You have 10-12 years of experience in project management in aerospace;
  • You have advanced knowledge of Project Management processes and principles;
  • You have sound overall aircraft technical experience;
  • You have experience in structural and / or systems development;
  • You demonstrate a professional attitude and superior communication skills;
  • You have excellent organizational, time management skills, foresight, accuracy, attention to detail and commitment to objectives and responsibilities;
  • You have a natural leadership and pro-active attitude with the ability to manage multiple priorities;
  • You are self-motivated, autonomous, flexible, enthusiastic and results oriented;
  • You are technically curious;
  • You demonstrate ability to work willingly and independently in a fast paced, challenging environment;
  • You have effective problem-solving skills with ability to make good decisions to move projects along to meet or exceed the targets;
  • You have good computing skills; proficient in MS Office, specifically with MS Project & Excel
Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigration status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.
Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities
Your ideas move people.

title: Airworthiness Engineer
description:
The Organization

De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Ltd. (‘DHC’) is a proudly Canadian aerospace company currently transitioning its corporate headquarters to Calgary, AB. DHC is undertaking a consolidation of its underlying subsidiary companies under a single brand currently offering engineering, aftermarket, new aircraft manufacturing, modifications, parts manufacturing and flight training. DHC currently has approximately 1,200 employees based in BC, AB and ON as well as in markets and distribution hubs world-wide. Our strong entrepreneurial spirit, together with a culture of empowerment, quality and innovation create opportunities to grow and succeed in an organization with a proud heritage and bright future.

 

Profile

The Airworthiness Engineer reports to the Airworthiness Manager and works closely with the Design Engineering group, Technical Publications group and the Technical Support group. 

 

Location

This position is located on-site in Calgary, AB, Toronto, ON, or Victoria, BC.

 

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Coordinate with engineering to obtain design approval of changes to the Type Design, including design modifications, repairs, flight manual changes, and Airworthiness Limitation changes.
  • Support the investigation and establishment of corrective actions for issues affecting the design compliance and/or safety of the aircraft as a whole or for any component, system or structural assembly.
  • Facilitate discussions and agreements with Authorities on certification and product integrity activities, developing appropriate strategies and direction with Engineering and other technical groups.
  • Support the company in fulfilling responsibilities of the Design Approval Organization and Design Approval Document Holder.
  • Research through Service Difficulties Reports, accident/incident information, engineering substantiation reports, manufacturing information, historical sales/warranty/other, and operator's report.
  • Complete safety risk assessments, in conjunction with engineering and technical support groups, to record the technical information and potential risk of safety related events.
  • Initiate and oversea corrective action plans that require a design change and support the Design lead.
  • Maintain adherence to engineering and Design Approval Organization practices when executing design changes.
  • Work with the Maintenance Program Group and Technical Publications to develop changes to the Approved Manuals and ICAs.
  • Development and completion of Changed Product Rule assessments.
  • Preparation and management of certification plans and compliance programs.
  • Act as a focal for all communication relating to aircraft certification between the company and the Airworthiness Authorities.
  • Coordination of Airworthiness Authority involvement and acceptance of certification documents and activities.
  • Develop, lead, and maintain adherence to certification action plans.
  • Identify certification risk and develop appropriate responses.
  • Provide advice and strategies to management and specialists on regulatory matters.

 

Education & Professional Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in aerospace or mechanical engineering, or a combination of equivalent education and experience, or;
  • Graduation from a recognized college with mechanical engineering or aeronautics diploma with at least two-years' experience in either maintenance, safety data analysis, or equivalent experience relevant to design certification.

 

Experience

  • Minimum 10 years' experience in the aeronautical industry is an asset.
  • Previous work experience with Transport Canada Civil Aviation, Aircraft Certification Branch is an asset.
  • Previous work experience within a DAO, or equivalent, is an asset.

 

Skills

 

  • Excellent working knowledge of regulatory requirements and certification practices related to aircraft design approval
  • Ability to read engineering technical information, including technical drawings and production documentation.
  • Excellent written communication skills.
  • Excellent organizational skills, high ability to multitask, and work independently with minimum direct supervision.
  • Strong analytical skills and business acumen.
  • Team player with a strong sense of initiative, responsibility, and good judgment.
  • Able to manage several concurrent projects and meet tight deadlines.
  • Able to think quickly and creatively in a fast-moving and changing business context.
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.

 

At De Havilland Canada, we aim to be inclusive and diverse and provide equal opportunity for employment. All qualified applicants, regardless of gender, age, race, religion, sexual orientation and disability, are encouraged to apply.

title: Manufacturing Engineer - Aerospace
description:
The Opportunity | Manufacturing Engineer - Aerospace


Under general direction, the Manufacturing Engineer performs various analyses, design and/or assembly related to manufacturing or industrial engineering projects. Develops, implements, maintains methods, operation sequence, and processes in the manufacture or fabrication of parts, electrical components, electromechanical sub-assemblies and final assemblies. Interfaces with design engineering in coordinating the release of new products. Estimates manufacturing cost, determines time standards and makes recommendations for tooling, electrical testing and process requirements of new or existing product lines. Maintains records and reporting systems for coordination of manufacturing operations.


Your Challenge


+ Establishes Manufacturing process flow and work instruction. Create and update manufacturing standard procedure, which defines specific manufacturing processes

+ Assess electrical characteristics of product performance issues and determine Root Cause and Corrective Actions

+ Operate and maintain/calibrate electrical equipment used within the facility

+ Performs various operational or methods analyses related to labor standards and reviews product/project flow data, equipment and labor requirements for use in conducting manufacturing operations, increasing productivity and reducing production unit cost

+ Assists in the evaluation of engineering changes and/or other specifications requirements and performs as technical liaison with other engineering personnel such as program management, finance, design, quality, procurement, inspection, and production

+ May interface with design engineering in coordinating the release of new products and conduct review of engineering drawings prior to release

+ Solid modelling and drawing creation - Solidworks

+ Perform product troubleshooting and root cause and corrective action investigations

+ Perform assembly and test work as required to support production


Your Expertise


+ Bachelor's Degree, Electrical Engineering or Manufacturing/Industrial Engineering or equivalent

+ 3 years' experience in a electrical and mechanical assembly environment

+ Knowledge of basic electrical and mechanical assembly principles

+ Ability to setup and use electrical test equipment such as power supplies, meters, oscilloscopes etc.

+ Solidworks tool design and familiarity is desired

+ Ability to read and understand drawings and specification, and MS Office suite or products


This position may require exposure to export-controlled information and subject to additional security screening. In the event information provided during the security screening reveals ineligibility to access export-controlled information, any offer of employment may be reconsidered or withdrawn.


Curtiss-Wright values diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact Talent Acquisition (TA_COE@curtisswright.com) and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.


#IND #LI-SB1

title: Field Service Engineer
description:
ADB SAFEGATE leads the world in smart solutions that help airports handle more aircraft, safely and efficiently, from approach to departure. Our products and services can lift any airport's performance from approach, runway and taxiway lighting; to tower-based traffic control systems; to intelligent gate and docking automation.

We are looking for talented and enthusiastic people with the passion to support our vision and help to change the future of aviation. We are now offering a fascinating position as Field Service Engineer to join our team.

Position Summary

  • Provides field start-up and commissioning support for either standard products and/or advanced products
  • Assists customers, both internal and external, in isolating defects in the field
  • Performs Preventative Maintenance (PM) tasks per contract and Service Level Agreement (SLA)
  • Generates and support all technical documentation including trip reports, training documentation as needed, and review of product manuals
  • Performs technical training classes for standard products to internal and external customers
  • Develops customer relationships in order to help improve customer satisfaction
  • Responsible for becoming familiar with Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) airport policies, procedures and products
  • Responsible for becoming familiar with FAA Advisory Circulars and understand the airfield lighting industry and product lines.
  • Responsible for communicating and promoting company image to the airport lighting industry during system installation and training
  • Responsible for travel nationally to visit airport sites

Essential Functions

Site Project Support

  • Coordinates on site electrical contractor installation requirements
  • Coordinates on site schedule and itinerary with contractors
  • On site system power up of equipment
  • Systems readiness check of most system equipment
  • Performs and assist in Systems Acceptance Testing (SAT) and formal customer walk through

Training and Presenting

  • Utilizes training standards and processes to produce internal and customer training programs
  • Performs technical training internally or for customers

Administrative

  • Creates timely expense reports, trip reports, and preventive maintenance results documentation as required

Technical Telephone Support

  • Provides professional, technical customer service over the phone, email, etc., to troubleshoot, diagnose and assist airfield employees and contractors find solutions to hardware and software issues (Only if required due to call volumes)
  • On a rotational basis, provides 24 hour, 7 days a week emergency telephone support
  • On a rotational basis, provides emergency and non-emergency telephone support during business hours.

Position Requirements

      Airfield Lighting Industry

      • Maintains working knowledge of Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) airport policies, procedures and products
      • Remains current on FAA Advisory Circulars and understand the airfield lighting industry and product lines
      • Maintains working knowledge International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) Advisory Circulars as required for international projects
      • Maintains working knowledge of relevant international and national standards (FAA, ICAO) and CE/EMC/IEC requirements

      Electrical, Electronics and Computers

      • Well versed in basic electronics including low voltage and high voltage
      • Able to review electrical wiring diagrams and 1-line diagrams
      • Able to troubleshoot electrical systems using wiring diagrams
      • Basic to moderate understanding of computers, computer networks and network communications
      • Basic skills in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel)

        Teamwork and Communication

        • Accountable to recognize and escalate to supervision, roadblocks or constraints to any work assignment
        • Excellent inter-personal skills to interact with all project stakeholders
        • Able to work as a member of a diverse team
        • Able to work under pressure in order to meet deadlines
        • Able to prioritize work according to relevance and importance to project and management
        • Listens to others and values opinions, helps to meet goals, welcomes newcomers and promotes a team atmosphere.

        Knowledge & Experience

        • 2+ years related experience or the equivalent combination of experience and education
        • Fluent English (oral and written communication skills)
        • Fluent Spanish (oral and written communication skills) nice to have

        Formal Education & Certification

        • Bachelor Degree in Electrical Engineering (EE) or Associate's in Electrical Engineering Technology (EET), equivalent degree, or equivalent experience
        • Must pass any required BCI and FBI Background Check
        • Possession of a valid driver’s license
        • Must maintain an insurable driving record

        About ADB SAFEGATE

        Our diverse team, spanning 45+ nationalities across 37 offices, shares one purpose: helping airports achieve new levels of safety, sustainability and efficiency in airside operations. If you are people-centric, and a team player who’s driven and passionate about developing and delivering products, solutions and projects that improve apron operations and make air travel safer and better, come join our crew.

        Ready for take-off? Check-in now! 

        ADB SAFEFATE is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

title: Field Service Engineer
description:
ADB SAFEGATE leads the world in smart solutions that help airports handle more aircraft, safely and efficiently, from approach to departure. Our products and services can lift any airport's performance from approach, runway and taxiway lighting; to tower-based traffic control systems; to intelligent gate and docking automation.

We are looking for talented and enthusiastic people with the passion to support our vision and help to change the future of aviation. We are now offering a fascinating position as Field Service Engineer to join our team.

Position Summary

  • Provides field start-up and commissioning support for either standard products and/or advanced products
  • Assists customers, both internal and external, in isolating defects in the field
  • Performs Preventative Maintenance (PM) tasks per contract and Service Level Agreement (SLA)
  • Generates and support all technical documentation including trip reports, training documentation as needed, and review of product manuals
  • Performs technical training classes for standard products to internal and external customers
  • Develops customer relationships in order to help improve customer satisfaction
  • Responsible for becoming familiar with Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) airport policies, procedures and products
  • Responsible for becoming familiar with FAA Advisory Circulars and understand the airfield lighting industry and product lines.
  • Responsible for communicating and promoting company image to the airport lighting industry during system installation and training
  • Responsible for travel nationally to visit airport sites

Essential Functions

Site Project Support

  • Coordinates on site electrical contractor installation requirements
  • Coordinates on site schedule and itinerary with contractors
  • On site system power up of equipment
  • Systems readiness check of most system equipment
  • Performs and assist in Systems Acceptance Testing (SAT) and formal customer walk through

Training and Presenting

  • Utilizes training standards and processes to produce internal and customer training programs
  • Performs technical training internally or for customers

Administrative

  • Creates timely expense reports, trip reports, and preventive maintenance results documentation as required

Technical Telephone Support

  • Provides professional, technical customer service over the phone, email, etc., to troubleshoot, diagnose and assist airfield employees and contractors find solutions to hardware and software issues (Only if required due to call volumes)
  • On a rotational basis, provides 24 hour, 7 days a week emergency telephone support
  • On a rotational basis, provides emergency and non-emergency telephone support during business hours.

Position Requirements

      Airfield Lighting Industry

      • Maintains working knowledge of Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) airport policies, procedures and products
      • Remains current on FAA Advisory Circulars and understand the airfield lighting industry and product lines
      • Maintains working knowledge International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) Advisory Circulars as required for international projects
      • Maintains working knowledge of relevant international and national standards (FAA, ICAO) and CE/EMC/IEC requirements

      Electrical, Electronics and Computers

      • Well versed in basic electronics including low voltage and high voltage
      • Able to review electrical wiring diagrams and 1-line diagrams
      • Able to troubleshoot electrical systems using wiring diagrams
      • Basic to moderate understanding of computers, computer networks and network communications
      • Basic skills in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel)

        Teamwork and Communication

        • Accountable to recognize and escalate to supervision, roadblocks or constraints to any work assignment
        • Excellent inter-personal skills to interact with all project stakeholders
        • Able to work as a member of a diverse team
        • Able to work under pressure in order to meet deadlines
        • Able to prioritize work according to relevance and importance to project and management
        • Listens to others and values opinions, helps to meet goals, welcomes newcomers and promotes a team atmosphere.

        Knowledge & Experience

        • 2+ years related experience or the equivalent combination of experience and education
        • Fluent English (oral and written communication skills)
        • Fluent Spanish (oral and written communication skills) nice to have

        Formal Education & Certification

        • Bachelor Degree in Electrical Engineering (EE) or Associate's in Electrical Engineering Technology (EET), equivalent degree, or equivalent experience
        • Must pass any required BCI and FBI Background Check
        • Possession of a valid driver s license
        • Must maintain an insurable driving record

        About ADB SAFEGATE

        Our diverse team, spanning 45+ nationalities across 37 offices, shares one purpose: helping airports achieve new levels of safety, sustainability and efficiency in airside operations. If you are people-centric, and a team player who s driven and passionate about developing and delivering products, solutions and projects that improve apron operations and make air travel safer and better, come join our crew.

        Ready for take-off? Check-in now! 

        ADB SAFEFATE is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

title: Design Engineer Aerospace (m/f/d)
description:
More than 3,7 million produced vehicles, experience in automotive manufacturing for more than 120 years and a comprehensive range of services make Magna Steyr a world leading and brand-independent manufacturing and engineering partner for car makers. As part of Magna International, an international operating company with almost 450 sites worldwide, we provide a diversified working environment with global development opportunities. 

 

THE JOB WITH THE BEST STANDARD EQUIPMENT

 

Magna Steyr Aerospace is an independent division of Magna Steyr Fahrzeugtechnik AG & Co KG with a focus on piping systems, lightweight structures and high-pressure and cryogenic storage systems for the aerospace sector. Technological spin-offs in the automotive sector form another important focus of our division.

 

To strengthen our development team in Graz we are looking for a Design Engineer Aerospace (m/f/d).

 

Your Tasks

 

  • Design and development of cryogenic piping and systems for aerospace applications
  • Coordination of product design with customers and suppliers
  • Support for system development, testing and verification
  • Technical documentation and support for manufacturing and quality assurance
  • Work closely with specialists in a multidisciplinary team

 

Your Profile

    

  • University degree in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace, Materials Science, or similar
  • Experience or knowledge of Cryogenics and Cryogenic applications advantageous
  • Experienced in using CAD tools (CATIA V5)
  • Ability to link theoretical analysis results to practical design decisions
  • Teamwork, self-employment, and the ability to form and manage multidisciplinary teams at the project level
  • High level of commitment and flexibility
  • Organizing ability as well as high sense of responsibility
  • Very good knowledge of spoken and written English
     

Our Offer

 

With it’s my-life-program Magna Steyr Graz offers an extensive variety of attractive benefits and services such as child care, health programs, sports and leisure activities, discounts and reductions in everyday life as well as a profit participation program.

 

For this position the monthly gross salary is starting at € 3.500,-- depending on specific work experience an overpayment is applicable.

 

 

If you are interested in taking this opportunity and being part in a motivated team within an interesting work environment, we are looking forward to your online application. Please submit a covering letter, your CV and relevant certificates.

 

Contact:
Staud Katharina MSc
HR Management Engineering
Magna Steyr Fahrzeugtechnik AG & Co KG
+43/664/8840 2018

title: Aviation Aircraft Maintenance Engineer (AME) - M1 and/or M2 Calgary Based
description:
Company Description

Kenn Borek Air (KBA) is a diversified worldwide aircraft charter and leasing operation.  Looking for a position where your abilities, your passion, and your sense of adventure are all important; then we are interested in hearing from you. KBA is looking for professional, highly skilled, experienced individuals to join our team. If you are a hard-working, career-minded individual who enjoys the outdoors, travel and adventure, this is the ultimate opportunity for you.

Job Description

The KBA Maintenance team is currently seeking experienced M1 and/or M2 Licensed Engineers to support our fleet of DC-3’s, Twin Otters and Beechcraft 200/1900D at our Calgary, AB facility.Aircraft Type: DC-3T, DHC-6, Beechcraft 200/1900D

Reporting to the Production Control Manager - Heavy your role includes:

  • Planning and performing aircraft maintenance in accordance with published procedures
  • Ensuring that all replacement parts are inspected and properly certified prior to installation
  • Assuring compliance with all regulatory and company policies and procedures
  • Organizing and housekeeping of work area and hangar facility
  • Performing related duties as assigned by supervisor
Qualifications

  • Must hold a valid Transport Canada M1 and/or M2 AME license
  • Current experience on aircraft type preferred; equivalent aircraft types will be considered, and appropriate training provided to those with similar experience
  • Customer focus with a proven ability to work alone and as part of a team
  • Manage workloads and work within fixed deadlines
  • Good communication skills and positive attitude
  • Able to obtain Transport Canada security clearances


Additional Information

Kenn Borek Air offers a comprehensive employment package containing competitive wages, excellent company funded benefits program, a wellness flexible spending account and a RRSP matching program. And sometimes it is the little gestures such as receiving paid time off to enjoy your birthday!

Pre-employment Drug and Alcohol screening, resulting in a negative test result, is a condition of employment. Screening is provided at KBA expense and will be conducted, where possible, on the first day of employment.

Mandatory full immunization against Covid-19 is a condition of employment.

title: Aerospace Supplier Quality Engineer
description:
For over 15 years, SMS has remained the industry leader with a â€œboots on the groundâ€ approach to drive systematic changes that improve quality while sustaining on-time delivery performance. Working as an extension of its customers, SMSâ€™ unique, Fully Integrated Service Solution offers Supplier Management, Supplier Development, and Quality Management Services throughout the Commercial & Defense Aerospace Industries. Currently, SMS is providing support to the largest Primes, Tier-1s, and Tier 2s while expanding its service portfolio to include quality management services since the acquisition by TRIGO GROUP, INC. in January 2019.

Please visit our website at www.SMSSolutionsInc.com

The Supplier Quality Engineer will be responsible for executing and expanding on key initiatives inside of the supplier quality organization. The Supplier Quality Engineer will be responsible for executing various supplier quality engineering related activities such as Compliance, Process, and Product Audits, MRB, FAI Witnessing, Review and Sign off, Problem Solving, Corrective and Preventive Actions, Supplier Performance Reporting and other Quality Improvement Activities.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Assess suppliers manufacturing and quality processes through performing supplier audits following various standards depending on the type of audit. Audits may include but not limited to the following: AS9100 Compliance Audits, special processes, APQP audits, process, and product audits.
  • Lead and/or support MRB activities to achieve optimal disposition of non-conforming material and ensure that adequate corrective actions are implemented.
  • Perform on-site supplier visits for root cause analysis and verification of corrective actions of supplier quality issues
  • Promote and facilitate the use of customer preferred techniques for continuous improvement such as Lean, Six-Sigma, Poka-Yoke, and Process Failure Mode and Effects Analysis (PFMEA)
  • Facilitate the escalation of unresolved supplier quality issues within assigned projects and suppliers.
  • Support suppliers in the evaluation of existing manufacturing or business processes, identification of opportunities for improvement, and development of solutions to optimize supplier performance using various problem-solving techniques.
  • Provide technical guidance and assistance to suppliers to solve process and product quality issues and improve internal and outgoing quality performance.
  • Develop and maintain detailed and accurate reporting of supplier performance and quality improvement progress. Report weekly and monthly on supplier progress to meet customer expectations.
  • Undertake special projects as required
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders to ensure optimal performance.
  • Communicate efficiently and effectively with all stakeholders to ensure timely and effective responsiveness to abnormalities.

 

Required Skills

  • 8 years of hands-on experience as a Quality Engineer in an Aerospace Manufacturing Environment
  • 5-8 years of FAI experience with AS9102 (FAI) standards at a quality engineering level.
  • Strong understanding of various Engineering Processes, Standard Drawings Conventions, Interpreting Drawing, Specifications, and GD&T
  • 5-8 years' experience hands-on experience with the ISO9100 and AS9100 Quality Management Systems Processes, especially in Production, Quality, and logistics
  • Knowledge of, (or hands-on experience preferred), with FAA, EAR, and ITAR standards and regulations
  • Experience leading customer audits
  • Strong verbal, written and communication skills
  • Project management, time management, problem solving and organization
  • Ability to work as an effective team member and lead other team members

Additional Desired Skills:

  • Prior practical experience and implementation of Quality Engineering tools and systems such as: DOE, FMEA, SPC, RCCA, APQP, PPAP, controls plans, material control, process control, systems performance, product evaluation, MSA, metrology, automated measurement, and software is preferred.

General Requirements

  • Ability to pass background and drug screen
  • Vision exam is required prior to hire. Requirements are as follows:â€¢The General Vision Acuity Test shall be performed by an Oculist, Optometrist or other professionally recognized person. The following requirements shall apply.
  • Near Vision â€“ Eyes meets Orthorater 8 (95% or Jaeger #2 at 12 inches)
  • Far vision â€“ Eyes meets Orthorater 4 (76%) or Snellen Chart 20/50
  • Color Perception â€“ 6 of 9 Orthorater plates
  • Canadian citizenship required

Additional Qualifications (Preferred):

  • Bachelor's degree from an accredited college in a technical discipline, (i.e., Industrial Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Quality Management, etc.)
  • ASQ or equivalent professional certifications such as CQE, CQT, CQA, CMQ, CSQP â€¦etc.
  • Six Sigma Green Belt or Black Belt Certification.

 

Company Overview:


About SMS, a TRIGO company,

Supplier Management Solutions, LLC (SMS) is the leader in the Commercial and Defense Aerospace Industry providing global supplier management, development and quality services through â€œboots on the groundâ€ on-site management to drive systemic changes that improve quality and sustain on-time delivery and overall supplier performance.

With SMSâ€™ Headquarters located in Temecula, CA, SMS' Executives, Management and teams come with over forty (40) years of industry experience. Together, SMS understands the current dynamics and urgent need for a more efficient and cost-effective supply chain management solution. SMS' management team and field resources, Delivery Assurance Specialists (DAS'), Supplier Development Specialists (SDS'), Quality Assurance Specialists (QAS') and Supplier Quality Engineers (SQE's), perform their role working as an extension of their customers, with a domestic presence in over 40 states and 24 countries internationally. SMSâ€™ business model provides a customized, fully integrated service solution along the customer's value stream which results in quality parts arriving â€œon-time, every time.â€

As of January 2019, TRIGO Group, with a headquarters in Paris-France, acquired Supplier Management Solutions. This transaction was a major step in TRIGOâ€™s development strategy into the value added global Aerospace supply chain and quality management services market, while expanded TRIGOâ€™s U.S. footprint by leveraging SMSâ€™ relationships and domestic presence. It has strengthened SMSâ€™ position as a quality partner in the Aerospace supply chain by providing global coverage in addition to an extended service offering into quality inspection and conformity management. The integration of the two companies has provided our current and future customers with a unique combined full service solution for both On-Time-Delivery and On-Quality-Delivery performance for the Aerospace supply chain.


Supplier Management Solutions, LLC (SMS) is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disabled and veterans. 

NOTICE OF AFFIRMATIVE ACTION PLAN FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, DISABLED VETERANS AND OTHER  PROTECTED VETERANS

It is the policy of this Company to seek and employ qualified individuals at all locations and facilities, and to provide equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees in recruiting, hiring, placement, training, compensation, insurance, benefits, promotion, transfer, and termination. To achieve this, we are dedicated to taking affirmative action to employ and advance in employment qualified individuals with disabilities, disabled veterans, and other protected veterans.


The objective in adopting the Affirmative Action Programs is to place qualified individuals with disabilities, disabled veterans and other protected veterans in all job classifications. These Affirmative Action Programs are available for inspection by any applicant or employee by contacting the Company's EEO Coordinator, in the Human Resources office, Monday through Friday, 8am to 5pm.

title: Lead - Design Engineer
company: The Wohl Group - Recruitment Made Easy!
description:
Scope of Position

Reporting to the Manager – Product Definition, the Lead – Design is responsible for leading all design activities from start to finish (from request to release). Includes design, research, prototyping, engineering documentation, estimating and process improvement.

• Coordinate communication between Customers, vendors and Head office.
• Production support with drawing interpretation, investigations, design analysis.
• Coordinate, monitor and track design packages through entire change process
• Review and approve design change documents and drawing.
• Provide mechanical and structural design, development and changes in the aerospace industry.
• Perform in team environment with engineers belonging to other disciplines.
• Resolve problems and improve manufacturability and serviceability of products working with manufacturing and service personnel.
• Develop and recommend changes if any for manufacturing processes.
• Reduce product cost and improve design performance working with other groups on value engineering initiatives.
• Assist moderately complex to complex engineering assignments.
• Prepare engineering drawings.
• Upgrade product and reduce service failures and reduce cost.
• Provide technical guidance to management if required.
• Support, investigate, develop and implement new process technologies of major scope.
• Develops and maintains relations with individuals and business units within or outside his/her organization.

Skills and Qualifications

• Extensive knowledge of CATIA (V4/V5) 3D CAD software.
• Extensive knowledge of metal fabrication processes.
• Thorough understanding on Engineering configuration management.
• Proven ability to complete engineering estimations on work packages.
• Ability to produce Conceptual layouts.
• Understanding of current cutting tool technology.
• Impeccable attention to detail.
• Ability to plan, schedule, coordinate and problem solve effectively.

Experience

• 10+ years experience (Bombardier programs preferred)
• Relevant Project management experience (PMP an asset)

Education

• Bachelor’s Degree in Aerospace Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or related field.

Salary Range: $75-95k

***Only qualified candidates who meet all of the requirements will be contacted for interview. Thank you and good luck with your search.

title: Project Engineer, Aerospace
description:
Project Engineer, AerospaceTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB's Measurement & Analytics division is among the world's leading manufacturers and suppliers of smart instrumentation and analyzers. With thousands of experts around the world and high-performance digital technology, ABB's team is dedicated to making measurement easy for its industrial and energy customers to let them operate more efficiently and profitably.The quality and innovation of the engineering of our products, systems, and services keep our customers at the forefront. Developing solutions for our clients all over the world and working on our market-leading technologies will stimulate and enrich your work and mind. The ABB Measurement & Analytics plant in Québec is the world leader in spectroscopy. Our contract engineering department is Canada's largest supplier of space optical sensors used for greenhouse gas emissions monitoring and weather forecasting worldwide, among other things. Our plant is known for its expertise in the development and manufacture of various products that enable us to meet several industrial analyses needs on a daily basis. By joining one of the largest engineering departments in Québec (Canada), you will contribute to our projects as well as to the research and development of our technology. You will join a dynamic and stimulating multidisciplinary team within the Measurement and Analytics business unit. You will oversee and guide the development of analyzers and remote sensors that will be used in defense & security and aerospace missions. You must ensure their successful and on-time delivery, within budget and in compliance with quality and safety guidelines. The engineer we seek has a strong sense of reasoning, is autonomous, can work within a multidisciplinary team and has experience with research and development for system conception and analysis in aerospace.
This position reports to
Superviseure planification des projets
Your responsibilities

  • Interact directly with project managers and clients to fully understand their respective needs and iterate over their requirements.
  • Do the technical coordination of a multidisciplinary project team with Agile methodology.
  • Follow up on technical actions and plan short-term schedules.
  • Define the effort required to meet the current objectives and follow-up on these estimates.
  • Assist the project manager in strategic and execution planning, as well as project costs follow-up.
  • Manage system requirements; oversee system design and conformity, monitor system performances, manage technical risks.
  • Regularly make presentations, in French as well as in English, to clients and members of the technical team during design reviews and other project milestones.
  • Develop and continuously improve our systems engineering tools, including Model-based Systems Engineering

Your background
  • Bachelor's degree in science or engineering, or the equivalent with 8 years of experience as a system leader or system engineer senior.
  • Solid experience for infrared optical instrumentation development for aerospace or remote sensing.
  • Experience managing multidisciplinary teams and exceptional interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong analytic, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
  • Proven ability in delivering clear and concise project documentation and in configuration management for documents and product.
  • Proven ability to work within standard procedures and methodologies for operational space and provide inputs for space 2.0.
  • Master the following tools: Magic Draw, JIRA, Windchill, MS-Project, Office suite.
  • Bilingual English-French (spoken and written)

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
Named to Forbes 2020 list of top 15 employers in Canada, ABB values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and believes in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.
