title: Design Engineer
description: <section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Posting End Date: May 10, 2022 Employee Type: Regular-Full time Union/Non: This is a non-union position Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccine or Testing COVID-19 Measures: Throughout the pandemic, Enbridge has had to make important decisions that impact our team members, and we have done so by keeping the safety of our workforce our first priority. All employees must comply with the Company’s COVID-19 Vaccine and Testing Policy which requires employees to provide proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 or undergo COVID-19 testing per Company direction. In this role, you will complete and/or coordinate the pipeline and facility design throughout the planning, design, procurement, construction and start-up stages of the project lifecycle. By using a broad understanding of the field of engineering, you will ensure designs are fit for purpose and follow the Company standards, specifications and industry standards. If you are a Design Engineer who enjoys coordinating aspects of a design for projects, come join our Projects organization today! We offer opportunities for growth, a competitive benefits and pension plan, and generous time off. Apply today, we'd love to hear from you! What you will do: Work in collaboration with Project Development Engineers and internal partners to develop optimized scope of work, high level preliminary facilities design with consideration given to operational and capital cost estimate. Provide oversight for Engineering Service Providers (ESP) including all design work, reviews, construction support, cost, schedule and scope management. Lead collaboration with key project partners including SMEs to ensure that engineering design details and design parameters are addressed in a thorough manner. Accountable to verify engineering designs, drawings and bill of materials to match the design intent while adhering to all internal and external standards, procedures, specifications, and regulatory requirements. Review, clarify and approve design deviations and change orders for contractors through Request For Information (RFI) process to support construction team. Who you are: Engineering degree in an applicable field. Professional Engineering designation. Four or more years of progressively responsible experience in engineering design and project management related to facility design in the oil and gas industry. Effective interpersonal skills and be capable of working within a team or autonomously. Problem-solve issues through use of standards, modification of standards and/or previous experience. Demonstrated ability to be innovative, initiate and manage change. Preference would be for someone with pipeline station or facilities design experience. As well as knowledge of liquid and gas pipeline hydraulic modeling and design experience. Role requires a valid driver’s license, which will be verified with a motor vehicle check prior to hire. Working Conditions: Office environment. 10-15% travel, short overnight business and/or field trips. Travel to field worksite locations, may require Personal Protective Equipment (PPE). Enbridge provides competitive workplace programs that differentiate us and offer flexibility to our team members. Enbridge’s FlexWork (Hybrid Work Model) offers eligible employees the opportunity to work variable daily schedules with a flexible start and end time, to opt for a compressed workweek schedule, and the option to work from home on Wednesdays and Fridays. Role requirements determine your eligibility for each option or combination of options. Diversity and inclusion are important to us. Enbridge is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We are committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified individuals, without regard to age, race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, family status, veteran status, Indigenous/Native American status, or disability. Applicants with disabilities can request accessible formats, communication supports, or other accessibility assistance by contacting careers@enbridge.com. Information For Applicants: Applications can be submitted via our online recruiting system only. We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Final candidates for this position may be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check. To learn more about us, visit www.enbridge.com</section>

title: Product Engineer in Training
description:
Department: Research & Development

Employment Type: Permanent, Full Time

Location: Winnipeg, Manitoba

Posting Date: April 26, 2022

Who Are We?

Founded in 1944 by A.A. DeFehr in Winnipeg, Palliser has grown into one of North Americaâ€™s leading furniture manufacturers. We value our clients, our communities, our natural environment and providing the best customer experience possible. At Palliser, we produce quality and strive for excellence.

What Would You Do?

Reporting to the Product Development Operations Manager, the Product Engineer-In-Training (EIT) is responsible for creating, analyzing and maintaining Palliserâ€™s Bill of Materials, Labor Routings and Specifications using Palliserâ€™s ERP system.

The key duties and responsibilities of this position would include:

  • BOM and Specification Management
    • Creation and maintenance of bills of materials and specifications for new and existing product lines
    • Querying Palliserâ€™s ERP system to extract and manipulate data in order to facilitate BOM updates
    • Using offline load and mass maintenance tools to perform BOM updates
  • Labor Routing Management
    • Creation and Maintenance of labor routings for new and existing product lines using
  • Product Dimensions
    • Physical measurement of new products according to established standards and processes
    • Input of product dimensions into ERP system
    • Maintenance, analysis and troubleshooting dimensional information
  • Investigation and Issue Resolution
    • Working with internal business partners to investigate BOM and routing concerns, determine root cause in order to propose and implement solutions
    • Tracking of investigated and resolved issues, and their root causes
  • Product Costing
    • Perform new product costing, or analysis as requested
  • Audits and Analysis
    • Performing BOM, routings and cost audits for newly introduced and existing product
    • Tracking, Reporting and communication of audit results
  • Continuous Improvement Projects
    • Lead or participate in projects intended to reduce cost, improve BOM structure, improve BOM accuracy
  • Other Duties as assigned

What Do You Bring?

  • Degree or diploma in engineering or engineering technologist â€“ preferably mechanical engineering
  • Experience working in a multi-level ERP system
  • Project management experience with emphasis on meeting deadlines
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Strong team-work skills
  • Strong knowledge of materials, processes and standards used in the manufacturing process
  • Experience with technical software
  • Strong analytical and decision-making skills
  • Strong communication skills
  • Ability to perform ODBC queries in access or as400
  • Advanced excel skills including Vlookup and offline load
  • Demonstrated time management and organizational skills

Why Work with Us?

As Palliser grows, we recognize the importance of investing in our people, as well as the people who will bring us to the next level in the furniture industry.

Palliser is committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. We are dedicated to creating a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and an environment where every employee has the opportunity to excel.

We offer plenty of benefits to the people who made us what we are today.

  • Employee Family Assistance Program
  • Comprehensive benefits package, including life, health, dental, disability
  • Potential RRSP Match Program
  • Employee Furniture Purchase Program
  • Professional Development Opportunities
  • Free Parking

What Next?

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
Geek+ is an advanced robotics and AI Technologies Company specialized in Ai powered logistic solutions. With offices around the world, GeekPlus was founded in 2015 in Beijing China and has quickly risen to become the largest independent logistics robotics company in the world. The North American headquarters in Carlsbad, California will continue to power our growth in Canada, United States and Mexico.

To meet the demand for its solutions we are looking to add a talented and driven Project Engineer to our Carlsbad team.

Life at GeekPlus

Plain and simple, we're a team of geeks who love technology and teamwork. We work together to meet any customer needs; we celebrate our wins and learn from our misses. The only thing better than seeing customer operations improved by our technology, is seeing it happen at scale! We are biased to action, getting it done and thinking differently about how we apply technology. We support each other and we're empowered to win. Our strength comes from our different backgrounds and perspectives.

The Job

As Logistic Solution Manager at GeekPlus, you'll be the primary point of contact with our partners and clients who range from Startups to Fortune 500 players. You'll interact regularly to maintain a strong communication with the customers and provide solution design for warehouse automation and manufacturing logistics tailored to our customers' business needs. You'll team up with WMS/MES software Engineers and robotic implementation engineers to ensure successful deployment of our robot-driven warehouse & manufacturing logistics solutions at customer sites. If you're excited about robots and rolling out a complex system, we want you to talk to us!

Responsibilities:

  • Analyze customer's requirements and align expectations for logistics robotic solutions

  • Provide scope definition for implementation with warehouse/manufacturing site layout design and flow of operations

  • Align robot-driven logistic design with general contractors and/or subcontractors in project whose design interacts with robotic solutions and may impact overall warehouse/manufacturing logistics operations

  • Lead solution presentation to customer and maintain solid relationship with subject matter experts at customer

  • Collaborate with WMS/MES software engineer to map processes to Warehouse Execution System or Manufacturing Execution System

  • Oversee robotics implementations ensuring final delivery be in line with scope definition

  • Provide automation roadmap to customer based on business growth and transformation plan

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Supply Chain Management/Logistics, Industrial Engineering, or related discipline

  • 5 years' experience of warehouse automation design, preferably in robot-driven technologies

  • AutoCAD 2D layout proficiency is required

  • Good command of spoken and written English,

  • Chinese/Mandarin is preferred

  • Online collaboration tools proficiency is required

  • MS office suite proficiency is required

  • Mainstream WMS/WES/MES integration experience is a plus but not required

  • Ability to facilitate and drive cross-department collaboration and communication

  • Travel flexibility

GeekPlus is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation

title: Field Engineer III
description:
Overview:

Weatherford is a leading global energy services company. Our world-class experts partner with customers to optimize their resources and realize the full potential of their assets. Across our operating locations, including manufacturing, research and development, service, and training facilities, operators choose us for strategic solutions that add efficiency, flexibility, and responsibility to any energy operation.

We are focused on technology development, digital solutions, and defining our footprint in the new energy space. Our ability to provide integrated solutions across our segments will be critical to growth in our core operations and the energy transition.

Energy producers face unique challenges every day, so it is our job to create solutions that enhance safety, streamline operations, and sustain uptime to meet or exceed their targets. We operate across the global energy landscape employing some of the best diverse talent in the industry. At Weatherford, we understand the value each individual brings to the table. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and are immensely proud of our workforce. We invite you to join our passionate, talented, word-class team.

When you join Weatherford, you instantly feel connected to something bigger â€“ a community that is grounded by our core values and driven to create innovative solutions for our customers. We celebrate each otherâ€™s successes, grow together, and learn from each other constantly. Individually, we are impressive. Together, we are unstoppable. We are One Weatherford.

Weatherford offers competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits program and provide you a challenging and enriching career path, with a healthy balance of structure and flexibility to chart your own course.

 

Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Job Requirements:

To provide installation, repairs and routine servicing of remedial service packers, completion tools and other rental equipment in the shop and in the field. Help generate business to increase revenues through sales of Weatherford products and services. This is the fully qualified level job for Field Engineer, who have a demanding, hands-on job that makes use of the latest technologies to deliver solutions for our clients. Acts to manage field crews whenever necessary but also with a great deal of autonomy and responsibility. They are trained and certified to maintain and run Special Services operations, among others. Provides expert judgment and analysis for the design, development and implementation of technical products and systems. Resolves highly complex technical issues and conducts advanced research. Recommends alterations to development and design to improve quality of products and/or procedures. Familiar with a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures. Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks.

 

Responsibilities and duties:  

  • Must be proficient in calculating basic oil industry volumes, pressures and forces  
  • Have a keen understanding of different facets of field operations including but not limited to completions, remedial work-overs, cementation and fracturing
  • Operation and Management of a Mobile Wireline field unit and crew
  • Operation of proprietary  surface computer system to collect , QC, and analyze complex geological, geophysical, and mechanical readings from subsurface well logging tools
  • Able to work effectively on mast units as well as logging  or service/drilling rigs
  • Perform maintenance and repairs on company equipment requiring mechanical aptitude and ability  to troubleshoot
  • Isolating and solving complex problems on the job sire with assistance of technical support groups
  • Accurate & thorough completion of job reports on a timely basis.  
  • Perform Perforating Operations, Pressure Control, Plug Setting Operations, Ranging Operations
  • Assist in the shop when available  
  • Available on a 24 hours call basis    
  • Know and understand Weatherford Quality Policy and comply with all requirements of the Quality Systems Manual, Operating and Technical Procedures and Workplace Instructions.  
  • Must understand and comply with all safety rules and company policies of Weatherford.  
  • Work assignments carried out to the highest quality level.  
  • Perform various other duties and activities within the physical constraints of the job.
Experience:

REQUIRED

  • Previous experience as a Cased Hole Specialist
  • Ability to obtain NRCAN approval letter, Blasters Permit
  • Valid Class 5 Driver License with clean record
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Suite
  • Mechanical Aptitude and ability to perform necessary  repairs

 

PREFERRED

  • Bachelor's Degree in Engineering/Geology/Earth Sciences
  • Valid class 1 or 3 Driver License
  • General product knowledge  
  • Self-motivator, self-starter  
  • Good oral and written communication skills
  • Able to work closely with fellow employees

title: Field Service Engineer II - Newfoundland
description:
Overview:

Werfen

Werfen, founded in 1966, is a worldwide developer, manufacturer and distributor of specialized diagnostic instruments, related reagents, automation workcells, and data management solutions for use primarily in hospitals and independent clinical laboratories. The Companyâ€™s business lines include Hemostasis, Acute Care, and Autoimmunity diagnostics, as well as Original Equipment Manufacturing.   Our success comes from a specific focus in these rapidly evolving diagnostic areas, our commitment to customers, and our dedication to innovation and quality. Weâ€™re passionate about providing healthcare professionals the most valuable and complete solutions to improve hospital efficiency and enhance patient care.

 

Our North American Commercial Operations, as well as our Headquarters and Technology Center for Hemostasis and Acute Care Diagnostics, are based in Bedford, MA.  Our Headquarters and Technology Center for Autoimmunity Diagnostics is based in San Diego, CA.

 

Position Summary:

Under direction of the Area Service Manager, develops customer satisfaction through technical repair, installation, training, operation, and maintenance of Werfen instruments and systems. Position may have a specific assigned territory or system population or may be a position to cover other assigned territories as needed under the direction of the Area Service Manager

 

Bilingual (French/Engish) candidates are highly desireable for this role, as well as candidates with experience in a lab or clinical setting

Responsibilities:

Key Accountabilities:  

  • Provides highly visible customer support through the performance of on-site installations and necessary diagnoses, troubleshooting, service and repair of complex instruments and system. Performs routine, non-routine and unusual technical repairs of all systems assigned. This includes updates, retrofits, PMs and product enhancements.  
  • Instructs customers in the proper operation, maintenance and trouble-shooting of IL instruments and systems.  
  • Responsible for complying with all appropriate regulatory bodies (FDA, ISO and Health Canada) mandated policies, procedures, work instructions, and records.
  • Serves as a company liaison with customers.    
  • Responsible for routine and consistent interaction with sales counterparts with respect to customer situations, updates, and lead generations.  
  • Assures financial stability and viability of territory by promoting and selling service agreements, PMs, and other services.  
  • Schedules, coordinates, and presents pertinent information at Customer User Group Training Seminars and Marketing Road shows.
  • Assists the Area Service Manager in analyzing the severity of customer complaints and to develop plans to resolve customer complaints as needed
  • Travel into other territories may be needed to assist with duties and responsibilities above.
  • Other duties and responsibilities as assigned by the Area Service Manager

Budget Managed (if applicable) N/A

 

Internal Networking/Key Relationships

  • TBD based on departmental needs  

Skills & Capabilities:

  • Approachability
  • Command Skills
  • Listening
  • Presentation Skills
  • Functional/Technical Skills
Qualifications:

Min Knowledge & Experience required for the position:  

  • Associates Degree in Electronics, Biomedical Engineering, Medical Technology or related industry.  
  • Minimum of three years' experience as an Werfen FSE I in the diagnosis, repair and maintenance of Werfen systems, or equivalent industry experience.  
  • Must have good organizational skills, the ability to multi-task, work under pressure and exercise good judgment.
  • Ability to communicate effectively with customers, peers and management through oral and written presentations I reports.
  • Must have good MS Office Skills (Word, Excel and PowerPoint) including the ability to manipulate data and build presentations.  
  • Travel is required.
  • Minimum 30% by auto in primary assigned territory.
  • Minimum 10% by air for training, business meetings and/or support to customers outside primary or assigned territory.

International Mobility Required: no

 

Travel requirements:  

  • Minimum 30% by auto in primary assigned territory.
  • Minimum 10% by air for training, business meetings and/or support to customers outside primary or assigned territory
If you are interested in constantly learning and being challenged on a daily basis we encourage you to submit your resume or CV.
 

Werfen appreciates and values diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer M/F/D/V

We operate directly in over 30 countries, and in more than 100 territories through distributors. Annual revenue is approximately $2 billion and more than 5,000 employees around the world comprise our Werfen team

 

www.werfen.com

title: Design Engineer (Automation)
description:
Mechanical Design Engineer

Our client, an industry leading automation manufacturer is seeking to add a proven Mechanical Design Engineers to their team for a permanent job opportunity in Milton. Reporting to the Manager of Mechanical Engineering, the successful candidate will be responsible for mechanical design, technical calculations, reviewing with project managers, determining feasibility of design, and much more. This is a great opportunity to join a growing dynamic company, which offers a competitive salary, bonus, profit sharing, flex hours, and career growth advancement opportunities!

The Mechanical Design Engineer required skills may include but are not limited to:

  • Knowledge of machine shop techniques.

  • Thorough knowledge of drafting principles.

  • Proficiency in AutoCAD and SolidWorks.

  • Capable of designing tooling from sketches or verbal concepts.

  • Capable of working as part of a team.

  • Knowledge of the use of pneumatics and hydraulics, and electrical devices

Responsibilities snapshot may include but are not limited to:

  • Perform engineering calculations with respect to strength of materials, speeds, horsepower, temperature, pressure, force, etc

  • Review drawings for accuracy, material selection, proper machining techniques, finishes, hardness, etc.

  • Liaise with customers and in-house technical and engineering staff.

  • Analyze designs and systems for compliance to applicable standards

Qualifications:

  • Diploma or degree in mechanical design, mechanical engineering,   automation   or equivalent.

  • A minimum of 5  years of   automation &   mechanical design experience.

If you are interested in learning more about the  Mechanical Design Engineer  job opportunity and meet the required qualifications, please submit your updated resume. Please note, by applying for this position you are consenting to receive electronic messages related to the consideration of employment through  itec group  and its client. (Indeed)

If you are interested in learning more about the  Mechanical Design Engineer  Job or other Engineering and Advanced Manufacturing opportunities, then please apply online at www.itecgroup.ca or email chris@itecgroup.ca (BullHorn)

We are recruitment industry leaders committed to quality service, integrity, respect and equal opportunity.  Accommodation is available to all applicants upon request throughout our recruitment process. Please contact us at admin@itecgroup.ca or 1-877-682-8889 x223 if you require accommodation.  We will work with all applicants to accommodate their accessibility needs.  By applying for this position you are consenting to receive electronic messages related to the consideration of employment through itec group and its clients.  Should you wish to stop receiving electronic communications at any time, simply let us know at unsubscribe@itecgroup.ca

title: Sr. Field Service Engineer
description:
Position Title: Sr. Field Service Engineer

Harmonic is the worldwide leader in software-based cable access solutions.  We revolutionized cable access networking with the industry’s first virtualized cable access solution, enabling cable operators to more flexibly and efficiently deploy gigabit internet services to consumers’ homes and mobile devices. More information is available at www.harmonicinc.com

Role Description: Sr. Field Service Engineer reporting to Director, Cable Edge Lab & Qualification

What you will be doing:

  • Delivering technical support to Harmonic’s customers, both on-site and remotely.
  • Resolving equipment performance related issues utilizing Harmonic’s technical issue logging/escalation systems as appropriate.
  • Provision of commissioning and customer acceptance testing.
  • Assist with supporting customers in conjunction with Harmonic’s 24/7 Technical Assistance Centre (TAC), as required.
  • Provision of technical and operational training to Harmonic’s customers and partners.
  • Use of Harmonic’s internal customer relationship management and equipment/service databases to ensure accurate logging of relevant details.
  • Work complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires in-depth evaluation of multiple factors.
  • Provide "on-site" and/or “remote” application, operating system, database, and hardware support
  • Investigate, diagnose and resolve customer issues on site within a timely manner and if needed escalate problems for assistance.
  • Promote service added value approach (SLA) and report to Sales account Managers and his Service Manager all opportunities for business expansion.
  • Use independent, professional judgment to avoid errors that would impact customer satisfaction.

Desired Skills & Experience

  • Networking knowledge/experience, including Ethernet, routers, managed switches, TCP/IP, VLANs. 
  • DOCSIS knowledge/experience.
  • Familiarity with Cisco CLI.
  • Ability to deploy Cisco and Arris Cable Modem Termination Systems (CMTSs). This includes software upgrade, configuration, pre-deployment testing, cutover and troubleshooting.
  • Knowledge of a Cable TV HFC plant including topology of Service Groups and Nodes.
  • Ability to work with Cable TV RF and optical headend test equipment to measure and set RF and optical levels.
  • Some pre-sales technical support may also be required to augment pre-sales technical team in the region.
  • Excellent customer relationship skills, an energetic team player, and an ability to maturely and professionally manage complex customer issues with the appropriate level of initiative and independence when required.
What you should have:

Educational Requirements

  • A technical degree in Electrical Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent work experience.
Travel:

This position requires frequent travel of short duration at customer’s place, often at short notice.

Trainings can take place in Harmonic’s sites around the world.

At Harmonic, we believe that building and nurturing a global team with diverse backgrounds and voices is critical to our success. Together, we achieve excellence through creativity and innovation, build relationships based on integrity and mutual respect, and deliver the highest quality in every aspect of our business  for the benefit of our employees, business partners and shareholders.

title: Senior Design Engineer
description:
At Rogers, we are committed to helping Canadians bridge the digital divide and ensure that no one is left behind in accessing reliable connectivity. Through our Service Expansion projects, we are proud to bring our wireless and internet service to homes and businesses across the country to connect them to the people and things that matter most.  Our rapidly growing team is looking for new team members who are committed to making connectivity possible for our neighbours, communities, and local businesses. This team works cross-functionally, collaborating with our Network, Rogers for Business, and Consumer teams to make a lasting impact in underserved or unserved communities for generations to come. 
Come play a key role in building the future of innovation in Canada.
 
Are you up for the challenge and the fun? If so, consider the following opportunity: Plan, manage and have ownership over the capacity and strategy of National Critical Facilities (headends and datacenters). Ensure space and power capacity is not exhausted in any of our critical Facilities. Furthermore, the Senior Design Engineer will be accountable to look at opportunities to reduce operational cost by means of site decommission or New Technology Introduction. The Senior Design Engineer will act as single point of contact in any concept discussion involving Facility expansions (include datacenters) for internal and external customers. The Senior Design Engineer will oversee the yearly capital planning process. What you will do:Provide support for new and expansion site design and construction.Review and provide input to Engineering Preliminary Specification (EPS) and Engineering Design Specifications (EDS)Manage Design and Construction Firms award to each projectMange Jira platform regarding modifications.Audit and drive Jira ticket accuracy and completion.Responsible for the capital planning process.Develop CAsSupport capital planning initiativesDevelop and drive continuous process improvement within Facilities Planning and engineeringImplement and coordinate the activation of the project with the entire Wire line organization and the contractor.Manage the project by tracking the progress of the project and making the necessary corrections with respect to the timetable.Make the daily decisions with the contractor and Headend Operations Team.Develop scope of work and budget as per forecast.Initiate the project and develop project plans; these plans will identify all the elements of the project.Develop construction documents and manage bids and award.Develop a schedule and timelines for the project.Implement the project and coordinate the activation of the project with the entire Engineering organization and the contractor.Manage the project by tracking the progress of the project and making the necessary corrections with respect to the timetable.Monitor and Control all project activities. Track and manage issues and risks. Report project progress to management.Project Administration.Participate in Standards development and guidelineManage vendor and equipment road maps along with end-of-life strategies / replacementsSupport peers and operational tams as requiredDrive Standards development and guidelinesSupport and help train new team members
 What you will bring:P. Eng. or OACETT certified or equivalentA minimum of 10 years of technical and Facility Project Construction Management experience.Knowledge and understanding of IP networks and protocols, routing, switching (OSPF, RIP, RIPV2, BGP, MPLS)Have completed numerous Head End Expansion Projects as well as Power and HVAC Capacity upgrades.Ability to take a leading role on complex engineering projects.Considerable working experience in engineering technology, specifically in the principals of electrical, mechanical, civil, and structural.Knowledge of various relevant legislation: Ontario Building Code, Fire Code, Occupational Health & Safety Act.Ability to evaluate, develop and design plans and criteria for a various engineering products and activities.Previous experience with integrating new sites into company’s network.Ability to develop requirements and design specification for existing applications.Considerable working experience in reviewing project plans to meet company acceptable standards.Ability to apply advance engineering knowledge in planning projects and coordinating difficult assignments.Ability to manage complex projects requiring additional specialized knowledgePrevious experience with assigning work in terms of objectives, relative priorities and critical areas that impinge on work of other units.Previous experience with providing expert advice guided by general policies, department and /or customerPrevious experience with making decisions and recommendation governed by general policiesBasic knowledge of City standards and bylaws, Provincial and Federal legislation as they apply to water resources, water quality, and current environmental issuesDemonstrated a positive attitude towards work safetyAbility to use different computer software programs and can solve problems by creative and logical reasoningAbility to manage tendering process through IvaluaAbility to gather, interpret, and report engineering data in an accurate manner under strict timelinesStrong verbal and written communication skills and ability to interact with a wide range of audience effectively ​As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.
Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine. Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
Work Location: 8200 Dixie Rd (341), Brampton, ON
Travel Requirements: Up to 10%
Posting Category/Function: Technology & Engineering
Requisition ID: 265862
 
Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:Our people are at the heart of our success
Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
We do what’s right, each and every day
We believe in the power of new ideas
We work as one team, with one vision
We give back to our communities and protect our environment
 What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.

title: Design Engineer
description:
Are you an Electrical/Electronic Engineer with strong experience working with Firmware/or Hardware for Power electronics domain ? Our high-profile Vancouver client is seeking to hire few Design Engineers on a permanent basis. Apply to this amazing Design Engineer opportunity today!

We are looking for very versatile and multi-disciplinary engineers with power electronics background developing and sustaining power inverters.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills with demonstrated collaborative teamwork capabilities beside expertise level knowledge of power electronics for inverters or motor drives and ability to analyze and troubleshoot power electronics hardware.

New position
Team player (ability to work in a small team of 3-5)
Multi functionals role
Trouble shooting is mandatory
Having good Intuition
Know how to connect different technology together
Detailed and process oriented
Power electronics background

If you love technology and have power electronics background, then the Design Engineer role with our Vancouver client could be the perfect opportunity for you!

Please contact Paul Klimau with your resume at: paul.klimau@randstad.ca

• Leading salary compensation in 100% remote role

Trouble shooting is mandatory
Having good Intuition
Know how to connect different technology together

Power electronics background

If you love technology and have power electronics background, then the Design Engineer role with our Vancouver client could be the perfect opportunity for you!

Please contact Paul Klimau with your resume at: paul.klimau@randstad.ca

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Design Engineer
description:
Description

Xilinx is now part of Advanced Micro Devices (AMD).

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies ' building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the 'extra mile' to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.

AMD is looking for a talented individual to join the Wired IP and Solutions Group (WISG) in the position of Design Engineer. The successful candidate will join our RTL design team developing ASIC, FPGA and ACAP-based intellectual property (IP) to address the needs of state-of-the-art security for applications in the wired networking space.

It is expected that the candidate will have had exposure to Verilog RTL coding, and front-end design flows. Awareness of test and verification strategies and processes is an asset, as is experience with scripting languages such as Python, Perl and TCL. It is also desirable for applicants to have familiarity with encryption protocols, ASIC and FPGA architecture and design, and EDA design processes.

The successful candidate may have demonstrated their technical skill through prior experience delivering ASIC and/or FPGA solutions, or during academics. Regardless, in this role with our team they will have an opportunity to leverage their experience to design and code innovative, high quality IP products.

In addition to technical abilities, the position requires excellent written and verbal communication skills that will be utilized for multi-location collaboration and for developing design specifications.

We are building the next generation network. AMD already holds a leading position in the wired infrastructure manufacturing industry and is technologically well positioned to drive all areas of advanced networking systems. This job opening presents an opportunity to work with a highly motivated team, best-in-class configurable silicon and software and industry-leading security technologies for wired communications.


Qualifications

Job Qualifications

  • BSEE minimum required.
  • 1-2 years digital design ASIC/FPGA experience
  • Familiarity with ASIC/FPGA design and verification flows.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.


Desired

  • Experience in System Verilog and/or VHDL
  • Experience and knowledge of encryption protocols (such as MACsec and IPsec)
  • Familiarity with security technologies for digital communication systems
  • Experience with AMD/Xilinx tools and flow
skills: ['Excellent written and verbal communication skills.', 'Experience and knowledge of encryption protocols (such as MACsec and IPsec)', '1-2 years digital design ASIC/FPGA experience', 'Experience in System Verilog and/or VHDL', 'Desired', 'Experience with AMD/Xilinx tools and flow']

title: Senior Site Engineer
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood is seeking a Senior Geotechnical Resident Engineer with expertise in quality assurance (QA) inspection and monitoring of the construction of tailings and water retention dam related projects. This is a long-term construction project with a rotational schedule to a Northern Ontario mine site.   The successful candidate will have experience that specializes in QA inspection of foundation materials, engineered fills, HDPE liner and concrete during the construction of tailings storage facilities and water control dams.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead Quality Assurance (QA) inspection team, liaison with construction EPCM team and client site personnel and the designated contractor to facilitate construction of tailings and water retaining structures.
  • Attend meetings, make QA presentations/updates, plan QA inspection requirements for different portions of the project, and provide technical review of QA inspection reports.
  • Monitor day-to day field construction activities and provide technical direction and support to multi-disciplinary Wood QA field staff.
  • Implementation of health and safety, security protocols and supporting Woodâ€™s strong safety culture.
  • Management of RFI requests from the contractor and client which includes the initial review of the RFI request for clarity, and the provision of a timely response to the RFI.
  • Submission and management of field technical directives, site instructions, and non- conformance reports.
  • Preparation of Site Geotechnical Engineering and Construction QA reports (daily & weekly) and workplans using Wood templates and quality standards.
  • Review and sign off on all field reports and other forms that were provided by the contractor;
  • Review of as-built information and provide final acceptance of the structures.
  • Lead by example with active support of internal policies and practices, including risk management, project management, and quality management.
  • Mentor and train junior & intermediate staff to grow their technical capabilities.
  • Updating and managing QA staffing schedule.
Skills / Qualifications:
  • B.Sc. in Civil / Geotechnical Engineering.
  • 10+ years of tailings and water retention dam construction experience, EPCM experience preferred.
  • Licensed Professional Engineer.
  • Previous experience with analytical and geotechnical applications.
  • Understanding of ground control elements, their installation and QA/QC requirements.
  • A clear and effective communicator and presenter, both verbally and written in English.
  • An unwavering commitment to the highest health and safety, environmental and social performance standards.
  • Extensive knowledge of construction standards and specifications.
  • Software MS Office and geotechnical applications.
  • Ability to work a rotational 2:2 assignment for up to 2 years.
Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
Our innovative and growing Industry Managed Solutions team is looking for a Solutions Engineer to improve and innovate our Image and Validation (I&V) operation in Anjou, QC. You will work with inter-disciplinary teams to provide comprehensive process and solution engineering with a goal of reducing operating cost, increasing throughput, and optimizing our service levels and KPI’s. You are a constant learner with a keen interest in exploring new technologies in the market. In this role, you will perform benchmarking throughout the industry and share your results and recommendations with senior leaders. You will provide enterprise-wide oversight and understanding as it relates to business processes and how technology is employed to manage our business processes.   

GS1 Canada is a neutral, not-for-profit organization that develops and maintains global standards for efficient business communication. At GS1 Canada, it is in our DNA to do the right thing. We believe in the power of standards to transform the way we live and work. We believe in the uniqueness, drive, and passion of our people to carry our values and vision forward. We are a team of friendly and passionate people, optimistic about our capabilities. Together with our people-centered culture and innovative solutions, our vision is to become a strategic partner that inspires, leads, and enables best-in-class supply chain standards.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Analyze business processes within all functions in the organization to evaluate, identify and standardize operations to improve overall efficiencies
  • Design high level & low-level design diagram along with various other models
  • Assure new platform design is in adherence with existing company standards
  • Consult various other in-house technology SME’s as needed
  • Work with our subscribers to understand their business and technical needs, and design solutions demonstrating our innovative capabilities
  • Prepare and maintain technical documentation
  • Create comprehensive process maps, documentation and SOP’s and provide recommendations on optimization
  • Conduct POCs and drive the innovative solutions to delivery adding value to our subscribers
  • Research and identify new and emerging techniques and technologies to achieve operational efficiencies, cost reduction and improvement of service levels and lead business planning efforts
  • Build relationships with business partners at all levels within the organization to effectively facilitate continuous improvement initiatives and manage change
  • Develop a full set of KPI’s and metrics to help manage and control the ongoing operation; develop innovative way of mining process data to help drive insights and identify areas of opportunity within the operation

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND EXPERIENCE:

  • Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering
  • Minimum 2 - 3 years of experience in creating UML, DFD, High- & Low-level design diagram
  • Experience in Agile/Scrum methodology
  • Proficiency with at least one of the OOP languages C#, Python, Java
  • Good knowledge of SQL and no-SQL databases
  • Strong knowledge of web development and API’s and microservices
  • Knowledge of event and domain driven design patterns is a definite asset
  • Previous experience leading a comprehensive business process reengineering effort with measurable improvements to the organization
  • Strong communicator and able to interact with Senior Executives when required
  • Grocery retail, Supply Chain and or food distribution experience is a definite asset
  • Quick & Excellent Problem-Solving skills for complex & large-scale problems

GS1 Canada is an equal opportunity employer. If selected for an interview, please advise our Human Resources team at humanresources@gs1ca.org if you require accommodation due to a disability during the interview and assessment process.

title: Product Engineer - ArcGIS Enterprise Portal
description:
Overview

At Esri, our users come first. With thousands of customers and millions of users worldwide, we want your help building the next generation of ArcGIS Enterprise, a suite of products delivering state-of-the-art mapping and analytics capability.

Our team builds cutting-edge, highly scalable, and reliable distributed software for on-premises and the cloud. We make maps, geographic information, and analyses available on any device, anywhere, at any time. As a product engineer on the team, you will work with a diverse cross-functional global team in an innovative and collaborative environment to drive new features and functionality from conception to release. You will be a key member of the development team, active in gathering user requirements, building and testing features, and helping our customers be successful by writing product documentations and blogs.

Responsibilities

  • Gather user requirements; synthesize and translate into new feature and workflow improvements
  • Collaborate with product engineers, product developers, and product management as needed across regions, product areas, and functions
  • Lead testing activities and engagements across cross-functional teams to shape design and product direction
  • Support customers by troubleshooting and triaging reported issues
  • Provide goal-oriented direction in the face of ambiguity

Requirements

  • 1+ years of experience with ArcGIS software and/or other GIS and mapping products
  • Passion for creating products to solve customer problems
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
  • A self-driven and quality focused mindset
  • Excellent teamwork and communication skills, including documentation and testing
  • Bachelor’s or master’s in GIS, computer science, or a related field, depending on position level

Recommended Qualifications

  • Experience with agile software development methodologies
  • Proven ability to define, manage, and deliver quality geospatial solutions
  • Familiarity with manual and automated testing practices for functional, regression and performance
  • Understanding of web technology (REST, JSON, etc.)
  • Familiarity with GitHub for project and issue creation and tracking

The Company

Our passion for improving quality of life through geography is at the heart of everything we do. Esri’s geographic information system (GIS) technology inspires and enables governments, universities, and businesses worldwide to save money, lives, and our environment through a deeper understanding of the changing world around them.Carefully managed growth and zero debt give Esri stability that is uncommon in today's volatile business world. Privately held, we offer exceptional benefits, competitive salaries, 401(k) and profit-sharing programs, opportunities for personal and professional growth, and much more.Esri is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please email askcareers@esri.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this e-mail address.#LI-MB2

description:

Overview:

Keller Foundations Ltd, has built a solid reputation throughout Canada as an industry leader in providing innovative, comprehensive, Ground Engineering solutions.  We take pride in providing the highest possible level of service to our clients. Keller offers a challenging and rewarding business atmosphere to those who value teamwork, integrity, and diversity. We actively encourage our employees to contribute their diverse strengths to the team. We recognize the individual needs of our staff while supporting and assisting them to reach their full potential.

 

Keller Foundations is seeking a self-motivated, knowledgeable and organized Field Engineer to join our Calgary, AB  office.  Field EITs split their time between design and operations and are responsible for quality assurance and quality control on projects. title: Field Engineer
description:
Overview:

Provides technical engineering information to ensure construction work complies with all engineering standards, codes and contract specifications.

What you will be doing:

 

  • Meets daily with project crews to review production schedule and confirm all materials, equipment and resources are readily available for production to continue on schedule and within budget.
  • Collects, coordinates and analysis shop drawings, design specifications, material requirements and project data through the duration of the project to ensure quality and contract specification compliance.
  • Provides technical input for project work plan and scheduling. Identifying risk elements of production, materials, equipment or process that could negatively impact the budget or schedule.
  • Evaluates daily production, schedule and budget projections to accurately track project performance. Documents daily activities in Company approved methods and technologies.
  • Notifies team members and manager of any significant schedule changes and recommends solutions for management consideration.
  • Perform additional assignments per managementâ€™s direction.
  • Remits accurate project quantity input and controls using assigned project cost coding to ensure project financials are accurately reported. Manages cost coding with Company finance and accounting teams regarding employee time, materials, equipment and subcontractor needs.
  • Reviews and approves daily timecards for all Company construction crews. Works with Office Manager, payroll and job construction supervisors to resolve timecard inquiries, as needed.
  • Reviews project specifications for quality assurance at the beginning of work, during the project work and after work completes. Initiates and manages appropriate certificates, inspections and other documentation regarding construction production on the project site.
  • Works with construction crews and engineering leaders to plan field layout on the project site, ensuring appropriate utility and commercial lines are marked before production begins. Initiates and manages any permits needed before work can begin.
  • Conducts required Job Hazard Analysis (JHAs) to ensure a safe and compliance work environment for all construction personnel. Attends weekly safety meetings with field team and project leadership; presents field analysis as needed.
  • Assists the estimating team with project schedules and provides technical input as needed.
  • Assists the development of design drawings and provides technical input, as needed.
  • Coordinates subcontractor work methods, schedule and crews as needed.
  • Reconciles job close-out checklist with owner representative and field crews at the end of the project.
  • Maintains knowledge of Company values and strategic plan.
What we are looking for:
  • Bachelor's Degree in a related field required.
  • 1+ year experience preferred.
  • Construction engineering experience or knowledge required.
  • Beginner knowledge of construction equipment & techniques, drawing & specifications, building materials and required standards applicable to the project.  
  • Ability to assume responsibility, interface and communicate effectively with others.
Why work for us:

Some of the benefits you may be eligible for as an employee are:

  • Comprehensive compensation package and paid time off program
  • Industry leading 401(k)/RRSP
  • Medical/Extended Health Care, Dental, Vison and/or Provincial Medical
  • Wellness benefits & Employee Assistance Program
  • Tuition Reimbursement Program

We are an EEO/AA/ADA/Veterans employer.

title: Product Support Engineer
description:
Brandt is continuing to grow and expand our business and we are looking for hard-working, creative individuals to join our team. We are currently seeking a Product Support Engineer for our Agricultural, Mining, Steel, and Equipment Solutions divisions (based in Regina).

DUTIES &RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Responsible for identifying technical or mechanical problems and standardizing solutions
  • Review technical details from warranty claims and manage the Solutions/Repair Index
  • Investigate product problems, provide analysis of field information and manufacturing processes to identify root causes
  • Works closely with Design, Tooling, Quality, Manufacturing, and Field Support
  • Lead meetings, delegate activities and follow up issues to ensure the appropriate closure
  • Create and implement strategies in order to achieve the goals of Dealer key metrics
  • Write factory audit procedures based on customer issues, participate in quality audits, review results with responsible departments and follow up to ensure correction and prevention
  • Develop bulletins and solutions
  • Available for phone/email support as required
  • Perform other related duties as required
  • Mechanical or Industrial Engineering degree
  • Experience with manufacturing processes
  • Experience with agricultural equipment and/or heavy construction/mining equipment
  • Effective communication skills
  • Knowledge of data gathering and analysis techniques, including statistical analysis and Power BI
  • Knowledge of quality tools such as FMEA (Failure Modes Effect Analysis), SPC (Statical Process Control), Root Cause Analysis, Statistics

title: Senior Field Engineer
description:
About US

In 1977, OSI introduced the first generation electronic chart system for the maritime market and revolutionized navigation. Over the years we have had many firsts.Today, OSI Maritime Systems is a leading provider of integrated navigation and tactical solutions designed for naval and maritime security operations. Among those solutions, the company develops and delivers integrated bridge systems for warships, integrated dived navigation systems for submarines, and C2 systems for small craft. Presently, 23navies totaling more than 600 warships and submarines operate using OSI systems.

Due to the nature of our company, all employees must pass specific security criteria. Only candidates who are Canadian citizens, have PR status or have a citizenship from a NATO country, and who satisfy security clearance criteria, will be considered.

The Job

The Senior Field Engineer provides engineering support for the integration and problem diagnosis of OSI’s navigational system products both, in-house and at customer sites. The incumbent assembles, performs quality testing and diagnostics, installs and configures, services and repairs OSI products and navigational systems for the Company’s clients at world-wide locations.


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Installs/commissions Navigation Systems products at customer sites inside and outside North America.
  • Diagnoses and repairs hardware assembly problems; diagnoses and repairs software configuration, network and integration issues.
  • Assists Systems Engineering and Software Test departments to design, develop and implement system test environments in support of Product Development and project requirements.
  • Assists the Training team in the development and delivery of technical training to customers on system installation, maintenance and problem diagnosis.
  • Will sometimes be required to organize and manage team tasks and activities related to the role.
  • Provides customer helpdesk email and telephone support.
  • Provides Service Engineering support and advice to internal staff in resolving technical problems.
  • Ensures required records are maintained and properly completed in accordance with the Service procedures.
  • Produces and maintains all required documentation in compliance with company requirements and ISO 9001:2015 standards.
  • As per the defined procedures, performs all required testing for relevant products, producing and maintaining the required documents in the Company database.
  • In conjunction with systems engineering department, may create and/or edit as-built drawings and documentation.
  • Ensures tools, equipment, material and any documentation required for each job is in good order.
  • Ensures awareness of and compliance to all applicable employment, environmental, health and WCB safety legislation.
  • Perform additional project associated tasks as required and determined by the Service Supervisor and Supportability Manager.


KNOWLEDGE & QUALIFICATIONS

Education: Degree in Engineering or related field, or Diploma in Electrical/Electronic Engineering.

Experience: Minimum of 7 years of Engineering experience preferably in the military domain; experience in the delivery of complex support solutions to government/military customers is an asset.

Skills: Minimum of 5 years of practical work experience in a Service Engineering environment, preferably in marine electronics; experience in building and troubleshooting computer issues, radar, and electronic sensors is an asset. Experience with navigation products is an asset. Extensive knowledge of Electronic and Windows operating systems; working knowledge of system networks and software scripting; excellent customer relation, prioritization, organizational, multi-tasking and communication skills; detail oriented; ability to work independently as well as part of a team. A working understanding of communication and data transfer standards is essential. Previous experience and willingness to train other internal and customer technicians an asset.

Other: Ability and willingness to travel (must have a valid passport) and continually learn new procedures and techniques; must be eligible to meet and maintain requirements for security clearance as applicable and if required must be able to work additional hours to meet the objectives of the position.

Why OSI?

We have a Professional Development program in place that supports our employees in their career development by providing funds, time, and opportunities to become better at what they do.

At OSI you can make a difference. We are a change willing organization that is always looking for new ideas. We strive to improve what it is we do and how we do it. If you have ideas we would love to hear about them.

OSI fosters an inclusive and diverse culture. We celebrate our diversity and strive to be more inclusive because it makes us a better company.

We also offer great benefits:
  • Extended healthcare
  • Dental care
  • Group Retirement Savings Plan
  • Emergency Travel Assistance
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program

title: Design Engineer
description:
Dynamix Agitators
Design Engineer - Full Time Position
Location: Richmond, British Columbia

About the Job:
Job Title:MECHANICAL ENGINEER, ENGINEERING CONTRACTOR
Employment Type: Full Time position
Department: Engineering
Reports to: Engineering Manager
Direct Reports: Not applicable

Position Overview:
  • Create drawings, documentation, and engineering calculations required for the Product Development Process.
  • Manage product development tasks as requested.
  • Document all results.

Primary Work Activities and Responsibilities:
Engineering:
  • Demonstrate consistent and proficient application of mechanical engineering principles in the design of parts and projects for Dynamix equipment.
  • Create 3D models and prepare manufacturing drawings using design software. Ensure due consideration to mechanics of materials and compliance with accepted practices of geometric dimensioning and tolerancing (GD&T).
  • Provide technical input in the evaluation of mechanical equipment. Prepare and execute test plans as required. Report results.
  • Work with team to complete engineering Projects and address cost, quality, and timing issues
General:
  • Work with a sense of urgency to meet deadlines. Clearly report the status of assigned projects.
  • Is comfortable meeting tight deadlines within a high-paced environment.
Requirements:
  • 4+ years experience in a similar role.
  • CAD capabilities – proficiency in Inventor is preferred.
  • Practical knowledge of Manufacturing processes, with special attention to materials, machining.
  • Experience in Engineering documentation and reporting.
Preferred:
  • Licenced Mechanical or Chemical Engineer. (PEng)
Thank you for your interest in this exciting opportunity. We appreciate all candidates; however, we will contact only those qualified to meet our current needs.

title: Solutions Engineer - Toronto
description:
Job Description:

As the world generates even more volumes of data, from any device or thing, companies are discovering the need to gain immediate insights from their data by studying recurring trends and patterns over time, and staying competitive by implementing predictive actions for their business that will yield positive outcomes.

Cloudera’s CDP Platform enables customers to harness those volumes of increasingly valuable data by securely hosting data lakes and efficiently managing data analytics & computing workloads between public clouds and private cloud solutions in data centers.  

As a Cloudera Solutions Engineer, you will help customers be successful in deploying the CDP platform.  You will utilize your strong technical skills, business competencies and customer service orientation, provide the highest level of solution design, and deliver technical value to sales teams, prospects and customers, to support sales goals.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Create and deliver customer-centric solution designs, proposed architectures and business outcomes to all levels – developers, architects, CTO, and CIO

  • Work with cross-functional teams including Sales, Marketing, Product Management, Services, Support, Training, and Engineering to share Cloudera’s Vision with customers

  • Advise customers on use case patterns through discovery and requirements workshops

  • Transform customer feedback into actionable product roadmap items

  • Work with teammates and management to define technical selling strategy

  • Participate within the Cloudera community, share evangelism activities (blogs, meetups, industry events), and contribute to internal and external knowledge repositories

Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of professional work experience in a similar position, selling solutions to business leaders and technical champions in the enterprise.

  • You have demonstrated problem solving and analytical skills.

  • You have experience in Solution Architecture/Engineering as a field of practice (an ability to listen to customer requirements, whiteboard and propose solution architectures, and be hands-on with the tech) to design, build, and demonstrate real business value

  • You have experience with the Apache Hadoop ecosystem (HDFS, YARN) and related components (Spark, Hive, Impala, Kudu, Solr, etc.) and can talk to the benefits of a centralized architecture for both data management and data access

  • You have experience with public cloud infrastructures (AWS, Azure, GCP, IBM Cloud, etc.)  You have an interest in achieving your public cloud certification.

  • You have experience with the Linux OS and bare metal, VM, and distributed container platforms Kubernetes or OpenShift.  You may have some experience with specific private cloud infrastructures (Server Hardware, Storage, Networking). 

  • You have some experience of the formation of Data Lakes, principles of Data Warehousing, SQL and relational database patterns, and application integration

  • You have some knowledge of differentiators across the competitive landscape

  • You have some basic software development experience in Java, Scala or Python

  • You may have experience with Data Flow, Queues and Stream Processing (Nifi, Kafka, Flink, Spark) in enterprise applications

  • You have an interest in Data Science and understand the difference between Data Engineering and Applied Science

  • You care about your colleagues, and you will get the job done together. You are passionate about what you do and inspire people around you

  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience in a Technical Field

Bonus Skills:

  • You understand the challenges in operations and integration of enterprise platforms for Security and Data Governance in the enterprise

  • Experience with, and interest in, open-source software and development practices

  • NoSQL or Operational-DB experience (HBase, Phoenix, Accumlo, Druid, Cassandra, MongoDB, etc.) Maybe you can even debate one option over another?

  • EDW experience – Teradata, Netezza, GreenPlum, Exadata Data Science and ML experience – (R, Python, Anaconda, Jupyter, Deep Learning Frameworks etc.)

  • Integration Products experience (Talend, DataStage, Informatica BDM, Qlik, Tableau, Zoomdata, Tibco, MuleSoft, IBM, Oracle, Spring Integration, etc.)

The right person in this role has an opportunity to make a huge impact at Cloudera and add value to our future decisions. If this position has piqued your interest and you have what we described - we invite you apply! An adventure in data awaits.

title: Field Service Engineer
description:
Job Title: Field Service Engineer

 

Job Summary: Maintain ScriptPro’s computer-based technology and automation equipment at customer sites, nationally and worldwide. This is a road warrior, heavy travel position. However, you get 5 days off in a row.

ScriptPro develops, sells, and supports state of the art products and services for healthcare system customers including federal agencies such as the Department of Defense, VA, Indian Health Services as well as multiple major hospital systems around the country.  These customers require certain security clearances and health related tests and vaccines in order to gain access to their locations.  To support ScriptPro customers and as a condition of employment, you will be required to gain federal security clearance and/or prove compliance with certain health related tests and vaccines such as but not limited to tuberculosis, annual flu, and the COVID vaccine (requests for a religious or medical exemption will be considered).  Federal security clearance (See the Standard Form 86 link below) can include additional background checks such as but not limited to credit history and drug testing.


Reporting Relationship: Field Service Supervisor

 

Work Schedule: Generally, a rotating 9 days on, 5 days off schedule.  Overtime is typical and paid. Regular and punctual attendance is an essential function of every job at ScriptPro LLC.

 

Scope of the Role:

• Troubleshoot, diagnose, and repair equipment onsite at pharmacies and remotely by phone

• Administer training and support to pharmacy staff when needed

• Diagnose customer workflow issues and optimize ScriptPro system performance

• 80% or more travel is an essential function of this job and is required (equal amounts of long-distance driving and air travel)

• Physical demands of this role require lifting up to 55lbs unassisted, and lifting up to 120lb, push/pull up to 800lbs assisted, climb various ladder types, lifting and stacking servers, mounting monitors, computers, or status screens (including but not limited to 65 inch LCD TVs), as well as stand 6-8 hours per day.

 

Education and Experience Requirements:

• Preferred BS in Electronics or Computer Science, or equivalent work experience

• General knowledge of IT, Windows NT/XP/7/8/10

• Experience with computer systems repair and a strong mechanical aptitude

• Must be able to lift 70+ lbs. daily, including when traveling by auto or air

• It is ScriptPro’s policy to run a comprehensive background check post offer.  And, must be able to obtain Department of Defense security clearance after date of hire. See Standard Form 86 to preview requirements

• Must be available to work as needed and assigned

 

Attributes Desired:

• Maturity and integrity are a must

• Strong organizational and customer service skills

 

Working Conditions:

This position is a combination of office and shop environments. Regularly exposed to dust, odors, oil, fumes and noise.  May be exposed to moving mechanical parts, vibration and electrical shock and exposures to all weather conditions.   This is a very active position and regularly required to stand, walk, sit, stoop, bend and reach.  Ability to push/pull and lift independently is required.   Motor coordination skills and ability to work with tools is also required.  This job includes specific vision ability including close, distance and color. Ability to learn and solve practical problems and interpret a variety of instructions is required.  Focused attention during extended periods of travel time.

  

ScriptPro is not sponsoring any type of visa for this position.

ScriptPro is an Equal Opportunity Employer Committed to a Diverse and Inclusive Workforce.

Please visit www.scriptpro.com to learn more about the mission of our company
