title: Engineering Technician
description:
Overview:IDEMIA is the global leader in identity and security. Our mission is to create a safe and simple future where identity verification is indisputable, and only you can assert your identity. We are a distributed company leveraging the latest technologies to deliver world-class products in the private and public sectors of finance, telecom, identity, security, retail, sports entertainment, commercial, government, and IoT. We use a variety of technologies and approaches to deliver quality product and services to government agencies and technology companies. IDEMIA is a made up of a group of 14,000 diverse people from different nationalities, speaking over 20 different languages. Together, our solutions impact the everyday lives of citizens and nations. In this ever-changing world, protecting your identity is paramount. Join the team that is ensuring one person- one identity.Responsibilities:

Knowledge, skills and abilities:

  • Knowledge of technical support such as managing, maintaining, and repairing IT systems. Solid experience in installing and configuring hardware and software including call handling skills, incident and problem tracking procedures, and quality assurance processes.
  • Good analytical and incident resolution skills
  • Versatile technical knowledge including network, Windows, Wiegand, OSDP...
  • Good organization and time management skills to prioritize workload and manage multiple projects simultaneously
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills in English.
  • Very good team spirit.
  • Professional attitude in dealing with clients.
  • Ability and autonomy to telecommute according to the company's policy.

 

Qualifications:

Qualifications, Education and Experience:

  • Ability to work in a multi-cultural environment
  • Engineer profile with 5 years of experience
  • Preferably with 3 years of experience in the field of technical assistance
  • Writing and speaking French, Spanish or Portuguese is an asset

title: Product Development Engineer
description:
Job description

Product Development Engineer

Summary of Responsibilities: The role of the Product Development Engineer is to
design the purpose, features, visual appearance and components of Ground Service
products. The designs will contribute to standard designs and templates which help the remainder of the design team to produce production drawings efficiently.
Responsibilities include but not limited to:

  • Research the industry trends using value engineering initiatives.
  • Create a portfolio of standard products and standard options for Ground

Services business.

  • Identify standard options for each product line and maintain the database of

options and variants.

  • Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of variables in

situations where only limited information exists. Ability to interpret a variety of
instructions (ie. written, verbal, sketch or basic drawing).

  • Align drawing structures and naming conventions with manufacturing BOMs.
  • Produce and manage template drawings for all applicable parts to assist in the

efficient creation of production drawing for orders.

  • Assist to develop design standards, tools and procedures with revision control.
  • Responsible for Engineering Change process (ECR/ECN).
  • Documentation (Engineering documents, records, and test reports)
  • Able to engage with vendors to resolve issues in design, functionality and

manufacturability.

  • Support purchasing and quality to ensure all received parts meet design

specifications.

  • Manage time to meet goals for product design, standards, sales and

production support.

  • Responsible for the management of vault drawing libraries, configuration and

revision control and apply industry best practices, including upload of all
drawings and/or models to MRP system.

  • Ensure accuracy of production drawing aligns with MRP part numbering

series.

  • Train new hires on Wilcox product and manufacturing process to enable

continuous improvement in design.

  • Stays up to date on
  • Cross train and back up to Project Manager.

ATTRIBUTES: Skills/Abilities:

  • Self-starter and self-motivated
  • Impeccable attention to detail
  • Plans ahead and takes action when appropriate
  • Builds and maintains collaborative and constructive working relationships

(internally and externally)

  • Communicates effectively with all business partners
  • Well-developed communications skills
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Excel, Word)
  • Solid business knowledge relating to the Work Truck Business

Job Knowledge or Work Experience:

  • 5+ years’ experience in manufacturing industry
  • Knowledge of Fabrication processes; sheet metal, laser cutting, CNC Machining,

Powder coating/Wet paint, Aluminum and Steel welding applications.

  • Knowledge of all tools required (e.g. Solidworks, Draftsite, project databases,

CRM’s and other tools that may be required.)

  • Expert knowledge and understanding of all product lines
  • Ability to listen and communicate concisely and effectively

Education:

  • Designations/licence in technical trade an asset
  • Engineering/Engineering Technologist degree preferred
  • CAD training programs/Diploma
  • Solidworks certification (CSWP) preferred.

WORKING CONDITIONS:

  • Wears all required PPE as required
  • Standard working schedule, day shift

ADDITIONAL JOB
REQUIREMENTS:

  • May be required to work outside of normal working days and hours

title: Engineering Technician 1 (Ottawa, ON, CA)
description:
This is a temporary/contract position working through a staffing agency. The person selected in this role will not work directly for Skyworks but will be payrolled through a staffing agency.

Job Description

Engineering Technician

Contract position 3-12 months

Skyworks is looking for a Reliability Engineering Technician to perform qualifications and qualification Readiness on New Product, Package and Process Qualifications. This includes performing electrical testing, High Temperature Operating life jobs running in Burn-In ovens, Temperature and moisture stress tests running in temperature, humidity, and HAST chambers, High Temperature bake jobs/ovens and Convection Reflow jobs/oven. Responsible for making sure devices are stressed in the correct and accurate manner to internal and industry standards. The Technician will have the opportunity to suggest improvements to the processes and infrastructure pertaining to their work.

 

Primary Responsibilities:
• Perform RF ATE testing on PCBs.
• Perform RF ATE testing on loose parts using handlers.
• Perform data analysis after ATE and create trend charts.
• Create and maintain qualification schedules using Excel spreadsheets.
• Update the database with the current status.
•  Qualification and Qualification Readiness consists of:
          o Configuring and loading HTOL boards and ovens.
          o Configuring and loading HAST boards.
          o Loading Temperature Cycle.
          o Loading THB (Temperature/Humidity/Bias).
          o Loading HTS (High Temperature Storage).

 

Secondary Responsibilities:
Supports engineering activities such as design, test, check-out, modification, fabrication and assembly of prototype electro mechanical systems, experimental design circuitry or specialized test equipment. Applications may include analog, digital and/or video circuits, and logic systems. Works from schematics, diagrams, written and verbal descriptions, layouts or defined plans to perform testing, checkout and trouble-shooting functions. Performs operational test and fault isolation on systems and equipment. Assists in determining methods or actions to remedy malfunctions. Assists in the design, construction, test and check-out of test equipment. Uses manufacturing, test, development or diagnostic equipment, including, but not limited to, test programs oscilloscopes, signal generators and specialized test apparatus.

 

Job Requirements
• AA or 2-year Technical School in electrical engineering or physics.
• 1yrs. of experience in Product Reliability or performing HTOL or Burn-in, Temperature cycling, and environmental testing is desired
• 1yrs of experience in RF testing using Spectrum Analyzes, Network Analyzers, and Power Meters is required.
• Excellent written communication skills and organizational skills are essential.
• Experience with Microsoft Excel is required.

 

Skyworks does not pay referral fees for temporary/contract positions.

title: Engineering Technician – Project Engineering – Configuration/Nomenclature Management
description:
Job Description

BOMBARDIER
Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy, efficiency,reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.
In your role, you will:
  • Release and audit engineering packages for the Challenger platform
  • Generate and ensure proper aircraft configuration throughout aircraft build & certification cycle for the Challenger platform
  • Generate configuration documents in SAP for the Challenger platform
  • Track engineering packages in signature cycle for the Challenger platform
  • Actively track the Request for Changes (RFCs) all the way through to their disposition for the Challenger platform
  • Actively track the Notice of Changes (NOCs) all the way through to their disposition for the Challenger platform

Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,
  • You have a College degree/diploma or equivalent with a minimum of 5 years experience in configuration/Nomenclature management;
  • You have configuration/Nomenclature management experience (asset);
  • You have SAP & Teamcenter knowledge (asset)
  • You have knowledge in basic IT tool development (Excel/VBA, Access) to support analysis and compiling of data.
  • You demonstrate a professional attitude and superior communication skills (essential);
  • You have excellent organizational, time management skills, foresight, accuracy, attention to detail and commitment to objectives and responsibilities;
  • You have a pro-active attitude and ability to manage multiple priorities;
  • You have a strategic mind and an attention to details, supporting your interest for taking over responsibilities;
  • You are self-motivated, autonomous and enthusiastic;
  • You demonstrate ability to work willingly and independently in a fast paced, challenging environment;
  • You have effective problem solving skills with ability to make good decisions to move projects along to meet or exceed the targets;
  • You have good computing skills; proficient in MS Office and experience with MS Access/Project is an asset.
Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigration status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.
Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities
Your ideas move people.

title: Engineering Technician
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood Applied Intelligence -Automation and Controls is currently recruiting for a SeniorElectrical Controls Technologist (3) in Burlington, ON.  with the ability  to create PLC programs and prepare electrical schematics in the Automotive Electrical Controls industry.

 

This is an excellent opportunity to work with a strong collaborative senior team, to work directly with customers, to define the requirements of the projects, and to implement solutions. As a member of the team, you will receive onboard training, learn how to handle commissioning responsibilities, and play a key role in the growth of this business. For individuals with a strong IT background and interest, there is an opportunity to develop your skills integrating controls systems with computer systems. This position will report to the Branch Manager. This is a hands-on job that requires field work in Canada, USA, and Mexico.  

 

Responsibilities

  • Be involved in the design, installation, and configuration of new and existing equipment automation together with equipment/process personnel
  • Design and integrate control systems on new and existing equipment.
  • Provide technical expertise and support on equipment, processes and methods aimed at sustaining or increasing output
  • Design, test, and validate systems (individually or as a member of a team)
  • Be involved in new and existing production line expansion installation and support
  • Research new technology or CIM applications to provide feedback to team for new enhancement
  • Review the project scope, proposals, job specification and resolve differences, providing constructive feedback to the person giving direction in a respective manner to achieve the best solution possible
  • Apply standard practices and techniques in specific situations, adjust and correlate data, recognize discrepancies in results and follow through with a series of related detailed steps or processes
  • Provide hardware and software enhancement ideas or request to improve productivity or quality
  • Contribute to multiple technical projects targeting continuous improvement results in the areas of safety, quality, efficiency, delivery and cost
  • Work independently and with a team of Engineers/Technologists to assist in software development aspects of larger projects; work with other team members and IT personnel on system launches and upgrades
  • Provide support for Customer Integrated Manufacturing (CIM) Projects from project design, implementation, production launch, to project closure
  • Provide daily CIM operation support to end users to ensure system availability
  • Manage the scope of the project to deliver the customers requirements in the customer specified format
  • Deliver projects on time and with least cost for the defined scope and highest quality to our customers
  • Provide daily status notes on launch and during projects
  • Lead in the development and implementation of applications

 

Skills / Qualifications:

Skills & Qualifications:

  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Engineering (or Applied Science), or a Technologist Certification. Applicants are expected to have a minimum of five years PLC programming experience in the automation industry along with a history of increasing project responsibility
  • Proficient in PC operating systems and high level of ability in MS Office products
  • Knowledge of PLC controllers and programming languages (ideally Rockwell or Siemens) is mandatory
  • Knowledge of networks, JAVA, C, HTML, and IT systems is an asset
  • Multiple language knowledge would be highly desired
  • Excellent controls system troubleshooting  skills are expected
  • A strong understanding and interest in machine integration, equipment monitoring system and tracking solutions
  • Excellent communication skills, written  and verbal
  • A self-starter who is dynamic and flexible  with high adaptability  to changes is preferred
  • Local and international travel may be required; Travel is typically 25%
  • Authorization to work legally in Canada without sponsorship from Wood is required

CEC Controls is a Wood Automation and Controls company

 

Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement:

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Senior Product Development Engineer
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW

Knoll, Inc. is a constellation of design-driven brands and people, working together with our clients in person and digitally to create inspired modern interiors. Our internationally recognized portfolio includes furniture, textiles, leathers, lighting, accessories, and architectural and acoustical elements. Our brands — Knoll Office, KnollStudio, KnollTextiles, KnollExtra, Spinneybeck | FilzFelt, Edelman Leather, HOLLY HUNT, DatesWeiser, Muuto, and Fully — reflect our commitment to modern design that meets the diverse requirements of high-performance workplaces, work from home settings and luxury residential interiors. A recipient of the National Design Award for Corporate and Institutional Achievement from the Smithsonian's Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum, we can help organizations achieve Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED), Living Building Challenge and WELL Building workplace certifications. To learn more about our initiatives to support more inclusive and diverse communities, visitKnoll.com/Community.

POSITION PROFILE

The Senior Product Development Engineer is responsible for:

  • Generating new product designs for manufacturing (DFM) using the latest tools and engineering processes.
  • Prototyping & testing of current & new designs, ensuring all procedures & guidelines are followed and met.
  • Preparing Design Handoffs to facilitate and ensure proper set-up of new product launches.
  • Providing support to Customer Service, Database, & Production
  • Continuous improvement utilizing VAVE, DOE and other related best practices.

This position also requires the individual to participate in the design innovation process and requires the key ability to apply the design needs of Knoll, the customer, suppliers, and the appropriate regulating bodies to all job tasks.



Required Skills
  • Knowledge of materials and their proper application in systems furniture product design.
  • Solid understanding of ANSI\BIFMA & UL standards as related to the furniture industry.
  • Solve engineering problems using (But not limited to) FEA, FMA, DFMEA, etc.
  • Ability to Build & Prototype Designs for Design Reviews & Testing
  • Lead teams or subsets of teams in activities, projects and product launches appropriate to be led by Product Development.
  • Working understanding of Lean Manufacturing Principles
  • Mechanical aptitude with a commitment to quality.
  • Understanding of manufacturing materials and processes, including but not limited to . . .
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills (English).
  • Work flexible hours, including the odd weekend.
  • Working understanding of MS Office (Excel, Word, Outlook, etc.).
  • Verification\Validation of designs through tolerance analysis, engineering calculations, prototypes, product testing, etc.
  • Work with manufacturing to resolve product design issues based on manufacturing constraints.
  • Ability to multi-task & to work on multiple projects at the same time.
  • Validate\Review Bills of Materials (BOM’s) for errors.
  • Ability to participate and\or lead design review and brainstorm meetings to ensure design goals are met.
  • Ability to work with customers and suppliers.
  • Follow Knoll’s safety expectations to maintain a clean and safe work environment.
  • Must be willing to travel to Knoll sister sites, customer locations and supply bases. Including occasional international travel with associated work assignments.
    • CNC Machining & Programming
    • Aluminum Extrusions
    • Metal Forming & Stamping
    • Die Casting and Injection Molding
    • Wood Furniture Fabrication
    • Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T)
    • Engineering Change Systems (ECS)
    • Manufacturing Information Systems (MIS)
    • ISO 9001 & 14001 Standards


Required Experience
  • Bachelor of Science in Industrial/Mechanical Engineering or Equivalent
  • At least 5 years of product design, mechanical engineering and\or manufacturing engineering work experience.
  • Minimum of 3 years of Furniture Experience
  • Minimum of 3 years of 3D CAD experience developing models and drawing layouts, preferably using Creo & Windchill.

Knoll is an Equal Employment opportunity employer. Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to a reasonable accommodation under the Ontarians with Disabilities Act and/or other applicable laws. description:

Description

We are currently seeking a Engineering Technician for a contract role with one of our clients in Kitchener, ON. Please apply you would be interested and available for it.

Comfortable working in a cleanroom lab environment
Aptitude working with lab metrology equipment such as microscopes, interferometers, machine vision cameras

title: Senior Product Development Engineer
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW

Knoll, Inc. is a constellation of design-driven brands and people, working together with our clients in person and digitally to create inspired modern interiors. Our internationally recognized portfolio includes furniture, textiles, leathers, lighting, accessories, and architectural and acoustical elements. Our brands — Knoll Office, KnollStudio, KnollTextiles, KnollExtra, Spinneybeck | FilzFelt, Edelman Leather, HOLLY HUNT, DatesWeiser, Muuto, and Fully — reflect our commitment to modern design that meets the diverse requirements of high-performance workplaces, work from home settings and luxury residential interiors. A recipient of the National Design Award for Corporate and Institutional Achievement from the Smithsonian's Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum, we can help organizations achieve Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED), Living Building Challenge and WELL Building workplace certifications. To learn more about our initiatives to support more inclusive and diverse communities, visitKnoll.com/Community.

POSITION PROFILE

The Senior Product Development Engineer is responsible for:

  • Generating new product designs for manufacturing (DFM) using the latest tools and engineering processes.
  • Prototyping & testing of current & new designs, ensuring all procedures & guidelines are followed and met.
  • Preparing Design Handoffs to facilitate and ensure proper set-up of new product launches.
  • Providing support to Customer Service, Database, & Production
  • Continuous improvement utilizing VAVE, DOE and other related best practices.

This position also requires the individual to participate in the design innovation process and requires the key ability to apply the design needs of Knoll, the customer, suppliers, and the appropriate regulating bodies to all job tasks.

  • Knowledge of materials and their proper application in systems furniture product design.
  • Solid understanding of ANSI\BIFMA & UL standards as related to the furniture industry.
  • Solve engineering problems using (But not limited to) FEA, FMA, DFMEA, etc.
  • Ability to Build & Prototype Designs for Design Reviews & Testing
  • Lead teams or subsets of teams in activities, projects and product launches appropriate to be led by Product Development.
  • Working understanding of Lean Manufacturing Principles
  • Mechanical aptitude with a commitment to quality.
  • Understanding of manufacturing materials and processes, including but not limited to . . .
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills (English).
  • Work flexible hours, including the odd weekend.
  • Working understanding of MS Office (Excel, Word, Outlook, etc.).
  • Verification\Validation of designs through tolerance analysis, engineering calculations, prototypes, product testing, etc.
  • Work with manufacturing to resolve product design issues based on manufacturing constraints.
  • Ability to multi-task & to work on multiple projects at the same time.
  • Validate\Review Bills of Materials (BOM’s) for errors.
  • Ability to participate and\or lead design review and brainstorm meetings to ensure design goals are met.
  • Ability to work with customers and suppliers.
  • Follow Knoll’s safety expectations to maintain a clean and safe work environment.
  • Must be willing to travel to Knoll sister sites, customer locations and supply bases. Including occasional international travel with associated work assignments.
    • CNC Machining & Programming
    • Aluminum Extrusions
    • Metal Forming & Stamping
    • Die Casting and Injection Molding
    • Wood Furniture Fabrication
    • Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T)
    • Engineering Change Systems (ECS)
    • Manufacturing Information Systems (MIS)
    • ISO 9001 & 14001 Standards
  • Bachelor of Science in Industrial/Mechanical Engineering or Equivalent
  • At least 5 years of product design, mechanical engineering and\or manufacturing engineering work experience.
  • Minimum of 3 years of Furniture Experience
  • Minimum of 3 years of 3D CAD experience developing models and drawing layouts, preferably using Creo & Windchill.

Knoll is an Equal Employment opportunity employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to race, color, sex, religion, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, genetic information, veteran status or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law. Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to a reasonable accommodation under the Ontarians with Disabilities Act and/or other applicable laws. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the application or interview process, please contact Talent Acquisition atrecruiting@knoll.com.

title: Engineering Technician Intern
description:
Overview

OSI Systems companies have a long history of developing innovative solutions to bring a better quality of life to the world. Our OSI Electronics (OSIE) division is a diversified manufacturer of electronic devices and value-added manufacturing services.

 

We provide our customers with the manufacturing capabilities and purchasing power of a global Electronics Manufacturing Services provider. By delivering regional and personalized support best provided by a smaller company, we strive to build lasting relationships and create close and valued partnerships with our customers. Our singular focus is to help security experts, clinical professionals and high-tech developers solve real-world problems and issues.

 

PFC Flexible Circuits, a division of OSI Optoelectronics, has summer opportunities for college students pursuing a diploma/degree in electronics or a related field.  The selected candidates will have a solid academic background, effective communication and interpersonal skills, and be able to work in a fast-paced and dynamic industry.


Responsibilities

With the guidance and support of our PFC team, the Engineering Technician Intern will assist with gathering and formatting data for the company's newly implemented ERP system. The selected individual will need to have a basic understanding of manufacturing processes and will have the opportunity to learn how to create engineering forms, generate job travelers/flow sheets and learn about different steps in PCB manufacturing industry.

 

In addition to being familiar with manufacturing environments, the selected candidate must also:

  • Be detail oriented
  • Able to work independently and as part of a team
  • Uphold the company’s core values of Integrity, Innovation, Accountability, and Teamwork
  • Demonstrate behavior consistent with the company’s Code of Ethics and Conduct
  • It is the responsibility of every employee to report to their manager or a member of senior management any quality problems or defects in order for corrective action to be implemented and to avoid recurrence of the problem
  • Duties may be modified or assigned at any time to meet the needs of the business

Qualifications

Qualifying individuals must be enrolled in college during the 2022 academic school year and be in good standing and pursuing a degree in engineering or a related field. 

 

 

 

OSI Systems, Inc. has three operating divisions: (a) Security, providing security and inspection systems, turnkey security screening solutions and related services; (b) Healthcare, providing patient monitoring, diagnostic cardiology and anesthesia systems; and (c) Optoelectronics and Manufacturing, providing specialized electronic components and electronic manufacturing services for original equipment manufacturers with applications in the defense, aerospace, medical and industrial markets, among others.

title: Aircraft Design and Development - Professional Senior, Engineering, Project
description:
Job Description

BOMBARDIER
Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy, efficiency,reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.
In your role, you will:
  • Develop work package (WP) Statement of Work, in line with the technical requirement of the program.
  • Harmonize WP schedule and rally the technical teams behind meeting the schedule including supplier
  • Ensure measures are in place to organize and control the tasks, the priorities & budget control, with appropriate levels of visibility to issues and risks and associated mitigation plan.
  • Organize and chair Integrated Development Team (IPDT) meeting, and the periodical reviews while following the BES development phases
  • Prepare visibility on the work package and associated project deliverables, in line with the A/C level requirement
  • Participate in program, supplier and technical review providing support and visibility to the team and management
  • Ensure Project Management process oversight and adherence to Technical Risk Level (TRL) requirements, Maturity & Exit Gate Criteria, and budget control.
  • Coordinate with other project organization (Bombardier Flight Test Center, Completions, …)
  • Assist for generic tools deployment with the platforms and prepare Bombardier Project Management policies
  • Deploy process for Lessons Learned and Best Project Practices onto the platform
  • Provide platform support to the PMO change harmonization process and lead the planning and execution of the required technical changes.


Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,
  • You have a Bachelor degree in Engineering or equivalent. Master degree and/or PMI certification is an asset
  • You have Bombardier experience and good working knowledge of BES (Bombardier Engineering System) favored
    • In absence of BA knowledge, be able to describe in detail how previous work experience has prepared the candidate to lead the definition, implementation and execution of a complex engineering project
  • You have 10 year or more of relevant experience with multidisciplinary team in a specific aerospace engineering field
  • You have experience on at least 1 or more development programs, through the various stages of the lifecycle
  • You have excellent multi-tasking, communication skills with the ability to influence without authority
  • You have advanced knowledge in a specific field and a breadth of knowledge of many aircraft systems
  • You have superior skills in MS Office including MS Project, PowerPoint and Excel
  • This position requires an organized person with leadership skills and able to work with a minimum of supervision. Logical and flexible mindsets, shows initiatives and demonstrate overview/detailed approaches.
Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigration status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.
Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities
Your ideas move people.

title: Aircraft Performance Engineer
description:
The Organization

De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Ltd. (‘DHC’) is a proudly Canadian aerospace company currently transitioning its corporate headquarters to Calgary, AB. DHC is undertaking a consolidation of its underlying subsidiary companies under a single brand currently offering engineering, aftermarket, new aircraft manufacturing, modifications, parts manufacturing and flight training. DHC currently has approximately 1,200 employees based in BC, AB and ON as well as in markets and distribution hubs world-wide. Our strong entrepreneurial spirit, together with a culture of empowerment, quality and innovation create opportunities to grow and succeed in an organization with a proud heritage and bright future.

 

Profile

The Aircraft Performance Engineer will function as a technical resource for analysis, testing and documentation in the aircraft performance area. Working within a team, this role is primarily responsible for performance software and tool development. You will also support new aircraft development, performance flight test, performance data expansion, certification, support to marketing and sales, production, and fleet support of the Longview aircraft portfolio.

 

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Develop, document, maintain and implement innovative techniques, algorithms, tools, and processes.
  • Develop, test, utilize, and maintain in-house performance software, tools, and methods.
  • Conduct different aircraft performance analyses, both preliminary and final, using in-house and commercial software.
  • Write technical reports, including internal supporting documentation (work statements, cost estimates, test plans etc.) as well as reports for Airworthiness Authorities.
  • Provide support to production and production flight-test for performance related issues and non-conformances.
  • Provide support to performance flight testing: validate and document flight test requirements, review flight test plans, define necessary instrumentation, analyze performance data, summarize flight test results, and write supporting documentation.
  • Interface with other internal disciplines and external partners/suppliers to ensure efficient dataflow and decision-making.
  • Provide preliminary and final performance data (guarantees) to Marketing and Sales, support Customer Engineering, Airworthiness, Technical Help Desk, In-service Engineering, and other Engineering groups.
  • Carry out (and report on) several aircraft performance analyses, within the time/cost constraints imposed by certification, production, and marketing & sales schedules.
  • Interpretation of aircraft performance data and support to Marketing and Sales related issues (performance guarantees, missionized profiles) performed under significant time constraints.

 

Education & Professional Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Aerospace or Mechanical Engineering from an accredited university.

 

Experience

  • Excellent programming skills (FORTRAN, C and/or C++). Knowledge of the UNIX operating system, PV-Wave, Frame Maker, Windows environment.

 

Skills

  • Good understanding of aircraft performance and airworthiness regulations is desirable.
  • Proficiency in preparing technical reports and presentations via office-software is a pre-requisite.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills is required.

 

At De Havilland Canada, we aim to be inclusive and diverse and provide equal opportunity for employment. All qualified applicants, regardless of gender, age, race, religion, sexual orientation and disability, are encouraged to apply.

title: Development Engineer Aerospace (m/f/d)
description:
More than 3,7 million produced vehicles, experience in automotive manufacturing for more than 120 years and a comprehensive range of services make Magna Steyr a world leading and brand-independent manufacturing and engineering partner for car makers. As part of Magna International, an international operating company with almost 450 sites worldwide, we provide a diversified working environment with global development opportunities. 

 

THE JOB WITH THE BEST STANDARD EQUIPMENT

 

Magna Steyr Aerospace is an independent division of Magna Steyr Fahrzeugtechnik AG & Co KG with a focus on piping systems, lightweight structures and high-pressure and cryogenic storage systems for the aerospace sector. Technological spin-offs in the automotive sector form another important focus of our division.

 

To strengthen our development team in Graz we are looking for a Development Engineer Aerospace (m/f/d).

 

Your Tasks

 

  • Development of cryogenic fluid lines, storage systems and components
  • System components development like safety and control valves, heat exchanger, insulation systems and structural parts
  • Support for system development, testing and verification
  • Technical documentation and support for manufacturing and quality assurance
  • Work closely with specialists in a multidisciplinary team

 

Your Profile

    

  • University degree in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace, Materials Science, or similar.
  • Professional experience, knowledge of Cryogenics and valve technology is advantageous
  • Experienced in using CAD tools (CATIA V5) is advantageous
  • Ability to link theoretical analysis results to practical design decisions
  • Teamwork, self-employment, and the ability to form and manage multidisciplinary teams at the project level
  • High level of commitment and flexibility
  • Organizing ability as well as high sense of responsibility
  • Very good knowledge of spoken and written English

Our Offer

 

With it’s my-life-program Magna Steyr Graz offers an extensive variety of attractive benefits and services such as child care, health programs, sports and leisure activities, discounts and reductions in everyday life as well as a profit participation program.

 

For this position the monthly gross salary is starting at € 3.500,-- depending on specific work experience an overpayment is applicable.

 

If you are interested in taking this opportunity and being part in a motivated team within an interesting work environment, we are looking forward to your online application. Please submit a covering letter, your CV and relevant certificates.

 

Contact:
Staud Katharina MSc
HR Management Engineering
Magna Steyr Fahrzeugtechnik AG & Co KG
+43/664/8840 2018

Technological spin-offs in the automotive sector form another important focus of our division.', 'Work closely with specialists in a multidisciplinary team', 'Experienced in using CAD tools (CATIA V5) is advantageous', 'Organizing ability as well as high sense of responsibility', 'For this position the monthly gross salary is starting at € 3.500,-- depending on specific work experience an overpayment is applicable.', 'More than 3,7 million produced vehicles, experience in automotive manufacturing for more than 120 years and a comprehensive range of services make\xa0Magna Steyr\xa0a world leading and brand-independent manufacturing and engineering partner for car makers.\xa0As part of Magna International, an international operating company with almost 450 sites worldwide, we provide a diversified working environment with global development opportunities.', 'University degree in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace, Materials Science, or similar.', 'Professional experience, knowledge of Cryogenics and valve technology is advantageous', 'Technical documentation and support for manufacturing and quality assurance', 'Very good knowledge of spoken and written English']

title: System Engineer, Aerospace
description:
System Engineer, AerospaceTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

The quality and innovation of the engineering of our products, systems, and services keep our customers at the forefront. Developing solutions for our clients all over the world and working on our market-leading technologies will stimulate and enrich your work and mind. The ABB Measurement & Analytics plant in Québec is the world leader in spectroscopy. Our contract engineering department is Canada's largest supplier of space optical sensors used for greenhouse gas emissions monitoring and weather forecasting worldwide, among other things. Our plant is known for its expertise in the development and manufacture of various products that enable us to meet several industrial analyses needs on a daily basis. By joining one of the largest engineering departments in Québec (Canada), you will contribute to our projects as well as to the research and development of our technology. You will join a dynamic and stimulating multidisciplinary team within the Measurement and Analytics business unit. You will oversee and guide the development of analyzers and remote sensors that will be used in defense & security and aerospace missions. You must ensure their successful and on-time delivery, within budget and in compliance with quality and safety guidelines. The engineer we seek has a strong sense of reasoning, is autonomous, can work within a multidisciplinary team and has experience with research and development for system conception and analysis in aerospace.ABB's Measurement & Analytics division is among the world's leading manufacturers and suppliers of smart instrumentation and analyzers. With thousands of experts around the world and high-performance digital technology, ABB's team is dedicated to making measurement easy for its industrial and energy customers to let them operate more efficiently and profitably.
This position reports to
Superviseure planification des projets
Your responsibilities

  • Interact directly with project managers and clients to fully understand their respective needs and iterate over their requirements.
  • Act as the technical point of contact for the client and maintain with him a trust relationship throughout the various phases of the project.
  • Set and manage system and subsystem requirements, model systems, establish technical budgets and margins and oversee system conformity and manage technical risks.
  • Work with the project manager and project engineer to follow up on technical actions, plan short-term schedules, and hold weekly project meetings with the technical team with Agile methodology.
  • Collaborate with the Test and Integration team in developing and defining test plans as well as audit and validation strategies.
  • Contribute to multidisciplinary peer reviews and give masterful presentations to our clients at critical milestones, in French as well as in English.
  • Establish the level of effort required to meet goals and to plan new projects.
  • Develop and continuously improve our systems engineering tools, including Model-based Systems Engineering.

Your background
  • Bachelor's degree in science or engineering, or the equivalent with 5 to 10 years of experience in System Engineering for infrared optical instrumentation development for aerospace or remote sensing.
  • Results-, teamwork-, and client-oriented.
  • Strong analytic, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
  • Proven ability in delivering clear and concise project documentation.
  • Proven ability to work within standard procedures and methodologies for operational space and provide inputs for space 2.0.
  • Master the following tools: Magic Draw (Model-based Systems Engineering), Windchill (product and documentation trees, management, BOM), Primavera Client (schedules and short-term task management), SAP (order management, etc.), Office suite, Matlab or Python.
  • Good knowledge of INCOSE, CMMI, MIL-STD, ISO and other standards.
  • Bilingual (spoken and written).

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
Named to Forbes 2020 list of top 15 employers in Canada, ABB values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and believes in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.

title: Product Engineer II
description:
Galvion’s head systems are best in class. Protection must be reliable and strong; but agility, mobility, flexibility and integration are game changers. Our highly skilled, cross-functional team of industry specialists, engineers and product designers work with advanced materials and cutting edge tools to drive our protective solutions and ensure that they meet our singular objective: to enhance survivability.

Every single member of our Armor team plays a critical role in making sure that the helmets and armor that we create for military and tactical users worldwide are manufactured flawlessly and delivered to those that need them. This is product design, development and production that really matters. Join our dedicated and dynamic team, and work on the cutting edge of advanced protective and integrated systems that save lives.

PRIMARY EMPLOYMENT OBJECTIVES

The Product Engineer II is the vital link between Industrial Design, Tooling, Manufacturing, Quality, and Galvion’s suppliers. Working throughout the organization, this position will be responsible for project managing the creation and development of new armor products as well as improving existing ones. The Product Engineer II will lead product development project teams to deliver world-class armor products for military markets ensuring compliance to specification, integration into existing systems, and validation of the product design. The Product Engineer II will also focus “upstream” in the supply chain ensuring its optimization, assessing and developing the capabilities of the suppliers, and developing and implementing supply chain strategies and tactics, which will support growth.

SPECIFIC ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Product Development

  • Act as first-line technical resource for all enquiries coming from internal Customers in matters related to Galvion products for the Armor Business Unit;
  • Influence and own product roadmap implementation for at least one product line, develop priorities for pre-planned improvements in conjunction with Product Management;
  • Develop & Maintain Product Configuration
  • Participate in the implementation of tools and process to maintain integrity of product configuration
  • Update and Release Technical Data Packages
  • Participate in the Development of process for the Update and Release of Technical Data Packages
  • Primary interface with Marketing for the development of sales collateral and Customer Support for the implementation of field support processes
  • Support for the implementation of field support processes;
  • Recommend concepts to meet functional, military/commercial applications, and customer needs;
  • Update and Maintain the Product Life Cycle (PLC) process to design, develop, and prototype new products and manage them from “cradle-to-grave”;
  • Formulate detailed plans, develop timelines and cost estimates for development tasks and inform management of performance against plan as part of the Product Stage Gate Process;
  • Contribute to the estimation process to develop plans as part of the Product Stage Gate Process
  • Evaluate, document, and implement potential design and process changes to improve product performance, manufacturability, safety or cost consistent with company Product Stage Gate Process requirements;
  • In concert with Supply Chain, obtain components/supplies/equipment to support prototype assembly, and conduct preliminary vendor assessment/selection;
  • Assess reliability, safety, performance and technical risk;
  • Coordinate and communicate development schedules or design issues throughout the technical team continuously;
  • Oversee Junior Product Engineers.
  • Create product specifications in alignment with Customer Requirements;
  • Lead the technical team that ensures that all technical and Customer documentation meet requirements;
  • Work with the technical team, Supply Chain and other stakeholders to ensure progress against plan.
  • Identify, develop and implement pre-production assembly methods and equipment; coordinate with vendor activities relative to communication of specifications, development schedules, and system compatibility.
  • Create the Bill of Materials and manage the complete BOM through product development, including the cost analysis interaction with Finance and transfer to manufacturing.
  • Create and Review, fully dimensioned drawings and Technical Data Packages, (TDP), to be provided to suppliers for sourcing new product components.
  • Create and Review test & validation plans for new products to validate conformance to specifications
  • Ensure that proper Design-For-“X” (Dfx) analysis and guidance is provided to the development team.
  • Identify and ensure that Intellectual Property is captured.

Technical Project Management

  • Serve as the point of contact for internal/external customers on all technical matters on project;
  • Communicate on technical points between the project team and the Customer;
  • Determine and Follow-up engineering actions between progress review meetings;
  • Handle administrative engineering management tasks;
  • Lead the implementation of Design-To-Cost (DTC) and support choice of suppliers and overall commercial strategy for your project;
  • Implement the Design-For-Manufacturability (DFM).
  • Lead design reviews meetings with the Customer.
  • Lead technical tender.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILL & EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelor of Science in Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience. Mechanical, Material, or Industrial Engineering preferred;
  • 5+ years’ experience working in a product development environment or related engineering role required;
  • License to practice as a Professional Engineer, a plus;
  • Experience and understanding of at least one of the following areas is considered essential: product development cycle in a defence, transport or aerospace environment, injection molding or associated manufacturing processes, quality assurance protocols, design-to-cost methodology, military standards, proof-of-compliance and safety testing of equipment;
  • Strong interpersonal relationship and leadership skills;
  • Must be able to read and interpret technical drawings and specifications / technical requirements;
  • Strong knowledge of QMS, ISO, industry standards, military standards and associated procedures;
  • Demonstrated knowledge of project management principles;
  • Ability to work independently on assigned scope
  • Highly motivated problem solver with meticulous attention to detail;
  • Experience with industry standard CAD, CAM, and PLM software
  • Responsiveness to external and internal customers and a can-do, positive attitude are a must;
  • Strong English language, verbal communication and writing skills required.
  • Knowledge of and experience of working with Military and Personal Protective Equipment Standards, a plus.

BEHAVIORAL COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS

Action oriented

Command skills

Managing diversity

Organizing

Planning

Time management

WORK ENVIRONMENT (include physical requirements)

  • Office base environment.
  • Approximately 20% travel between Montreal and Vermont to visit Galvion facilities and supplier locations is required. May include additional travel overseas.

About Galvion:

At Galvion, we believe in human-centered innovation. Everything that we do starts with the end-user - the warfighter, the law enforcement officer, the first responder. We work proactively to identify and solve the problems left unsolved by others. We continuously strive to exceed expectation and imagination, whether in a partnership that we facilitate, a solution we provide or a product that we deliver.

Our Armor, Active Systems and Focused Solutions divisions work independently as well as collaboratively to design, develop and deliver best-in-class, purpose-built, advanced solutions that enhance the agility and survivability of the world’s most demanding military and tactical end-users. We exist to empower their missions: we protect the people who protect us. We are thinkers. Doers. Pioneers. We are passionate about what we do. Always looking to the future. Always one step ahead. And with almost 400 people working across design, manufacturing, sales, testing, research, and administration, we’re able to create integrated solutions that genuinely challenge perceptions about what’s possible.

This is your opportunity to build more than just a career. This is your opportunity to play a central role in our life-saving, life-changing work. Join our team and our mission today.

Galvion provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. Galvion complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

title: Product Engineer
description:
One team. Global challenges. Infinite opportunities. At Viasat, we’re on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. For more than 35 years, Viasat has helped shape how consumers, businesses, governments and militaries around the globe communicate. We’re looking for people who think big, act fearlessly, and create an inclusive environment that drives positive impact to join our team.

We’re growing rapidly and looking for passionate, innovative professionals to join our team and connect the world to more. You’ll work in a collaborative and inclusive environment that values diverse perspectives and continuous learning, and provides industry-leading benefits with unmatched opportunities for career growth. Our team is fearless in pursuit of new ideas and uncompromising in our quest to become the world’s first truly global Internet Service Provider. Interested in joining our mission? Take a look at career opportunities at Viasat today. 


Job Responsibilities 

Viasat is in the business to connect the world. As a global broadband services and technology company, we are connecting international communities to the internet by offering residential internet service; enabling passengers and operations crews to stream high-bandwidth media, applications, and content when traveling globally on commercial, business or government aircraft and maritime vessels.  The Engineering Organization in Commercial Mobility helps to deliver and maintain Viasat's best-in-class in-flight wifi services to our global Commercial Airline customers. 

You will be an engineering leader on a multi-disciplinary Software Product Engineering team working within a multi-regional, cross-functional software product organization. The Product Engineering team provides engineering guidance for new features that deliver value to our commercial airline customers. You will be responsible for working with the Product Management team and airline customers to generate and translate business needs into feature specifications and a development plan, and will support the Engineering teams as they execute throughout the product lifecycle. The solutions you design will interact with a complex and dynamic satellite networking system and cloud enabled ground segment, requiring a broad multidisciplinary understanding and approach to problems. 

In this role, you will: 

  • Work with Product Management to understand product feature needs and perform technical translation 
  • Turn customer requirements into software acceptance criteria 
  • Drive the planning and estimations of initiatives through collaboration with the DevOps teams 
  • Analyze protocol specifications and assist in software understanding and decomposition 
  • Work with DevOps leads to define Epics that independently add business value but preserve the system architecture 
  • Work with DevOps leads to turn Epic status into program level status 
  • Work with DevOps to define and in some cases document interfaces 
  • Mediate technical conversations between the engineering organization and the customer 
  • Assist with the definition of system test plans and procedures 
  • Partner with product owners and team leads on delivery roadmap and product features 
  • Represent architectural perspective of product boundaries to the team 
  • Work with the other members of the Product Engineering team to incorporate features into a technical roadmap that feeds into the overall product portfolio roadmap for the business

Requirements  

  • 5+ years experience as a technical leader within a cross functional engineering organization 
  • Ability to bridge the desires of the customer with the capabilities of the product by carrying technical expertise into strategic conversation about products 
  • Experience with Linux, iptables firewall and internet networking protocols 
  • Experience with defining and maintaining interface specifications 
  • Ability to influence and drive software engineering teams to help meet business needs through technical guidance 
  • Systematic problem-solving approach, coupled with a strong sense of ownership and drive 
  • Experience with leading systems level analysis and design by quickly understanding new technologies and domains, capturing use cases, and translating this into work to be done by cross functional software development teams 
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills to drive interaction with product managers, customers, and developers 
  • Write both technical and non-technical documentation that is clear, concise, and speaks to a wide audience 
  • Problem solver with excellent leadership skills who can motivate others to reach company objectives 
  • BS in EE, CS or related field 
  • Up to 10% Travel 

Preferences 

  • Technical and software engineering background in the areas of cloud computing, enterprise computing, servers, networking, and virtualization technology and products 
  • Expertise in designing, analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems 
  • Familiarity and experience working within a scaled agile software development organization that practices Scrum 
  • Exposure to front end business development and process 

If the Federal Executive Order for Government Contractors becomes effective, this role may require vaccination.  In such instance, absent an approved accommodation based on a religious or medical reason, employees in this role will be required to be fully vaccinated no later than applicable deadlines, which are unknown at this point.  Viasat will strive to give individuals as much notice as practicable if a vaccine mandate becomes applicable to this role.



To learn more about this site and other office locations, please click here!

title: Design Engineer
description:
The Opportunity | Design Engineer


Your Challenge


+ Provide analytical expertise during development of the product.

+ Design to customer specification

+ Provide product performance analysis

+ Provide structural analysis

+ Provide dynamic analysis

+ Provide life and reliability analysis

+ Solid Modelling and drawing creation - Solidworks

+ Meeting schedule requirements and deadlines

+ Providing training on new products and processes

+ Supporting failure analysis

+ Interface with internal and external personnel via telecons, presentations, etc.

+ Support formal design reviews

+ Conduct a wide range of tests on electro-mechanical products

+ Work closely with other departments, particularly Manufacturing & Production Engineering, Manufacturing, Quality, and Production Control


Accountabilities:


+ Producing analysis within schedule targets. Effectiveness is measured in terms of adherence to technical, schedule, and cost baselines and customer satisfaction.

+ Maintaining a productive, efficient, and professional work ethic under minimal supervision.

+ Working within the quality system and associated procedures.

+ Actively pursuing continuous improvement opportunities.

+ Continuously updating level of knowledge and skill.


Your Expertise


+ Graduate of technical program with a University degree in mechanical or mechatronics engineering.

+ Excellent interpersonal, written and oral skills.

+ Knowledge of aerospace and defense industry requirements and demands.

+ Ability to work effectively under pressure of schedule and technical constraints.

+ Ability to motivate co-workers and team members.

+ Ability to travel internationally.

+ Knowledge of mechanical engineering principles and theory

+ Knowledge of machine design, motor principles of operation

+ Knowledge of stress analysis

+ Experience testing and writing test reports


This position may require exposure to export-controlled information and subject to additional security screening. In the event information provided during the security screening reveals ineligibility to access export-controlled information, any offer of employment may be reconsidered or withdrawn.


Curtiss-Wright values diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact Talent Acquisition (TA_COE@curtisswright.com) and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

title: Field Engineer III
description:
Overview:

Weatherford is a leading global energy services company. Our world-class experts partner with customers to optimize their resources and realize the full potential of their assets. Across our operating locations, including manufacturing, research and development, service, and training facilities, operators choose us for strategic solutions that add efficiency, flexibility, and responsibility to any energy operation.

We are focused on technology development, digital solutions, and defining our footprint in the new energy space. Our ability to provide integrated solutions across our segments will be critical to growth in our core operations and the energy transition.

Energy producers face unique challenges every day, so it is our job to create solutions that enhance safety, streamline operations, and sustain uptime to meet or exceed their targets. We operate across the global energy landscape employing some of the best diverse talent in the industry. At Weatherford, we understand the value each individual brings to the table. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and are immensely proud of our workforce. We invite you to join our passionate, talented, word-class team.

When you join Weatherford, you instantly feel connected to something bigger â€“ a community that is grounded by our core values and driven to create innovative solutions for our customers. We celebrate each otherâ€™s successes, grow together, and learn from each other constantly. Individually, we are impressive. Together, we are unstoppable. We are One Weatherford.

Weatherford offers competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits program and provide you a challenging and enriching career path, with a healthy balance of structure and flexibility to chart your own course.

 

Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Responsibilities:

To provide installation, repairs and routine servicing of remedial service packers, completion tools and other rental equipment in the shop and in the field. Help generate business to increase revenues through sales of Weatherford products and services. This is the fully qualified level job for Field Engineer, who have a demanding, hands-on job that makes use of the latest technologies to deliver solutions for our clients. Acts to manage field crews whenever necessary but also with a great deal of autonomy and responsibility. They are trained and certified to maintain and run Special Services operations, among others. Provides expert judgment and analysis for the design, development and implementation of technical products and systems. Resolves highly complex technical issues and conducts advanced research. Recommends alterations to development and design to improve quality of products and/or procedures. Familiar with a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures. Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks.

 

Responsibilities and duties:  

  • Must be proficient in calculating basic oil industry volumes, pressures and forces  
  • Have a keen understanding of different facets of field operations including but not limited to completions, remedial work-overs, cementation and fracturing
  • Operation and Management of a Mobile Wireline field unit and crew
  • Operation of proprietary  surface computer system to collect , QC, and analyze complex geological, geophysical, and mechanical readings from subsurface well logging tools
  • Able to work effectively on mast units as well as logging  or service/drilling rigs
  • Perform maintenance and repairs on company equipment requiring mechanical aptitude and ability  to troubleshoot
  • Isolating and solving complex problems on the job sire with assistance of technical support groups
  • Accurate & thorough completion of job reports on a timely basis.  
  • Perform Perforating Operations, Pressure Control, Plug Setting Operations, Ranging Operations
  • Assist in the shop when available  
  • Available on a 24 hours call basis    
  • Know and understand Weatherford Quality Policy and comply with all requirements of the Quality Systems Manual, Operating and Technical Procedures and Workplace Instructions.  
  • Must understand and comply with all safety rules and company policies of Weatherford.  
  • Work assignments carried out to the highest quality level.  
  • Perform various other duties and activities within the physical constraints of the job.
Qualifications:

REQUIRED

  • Previous experience as a Cased Hole Specialist
  • Ability to obtain NRCAN approval letter, Blasters Permit
  • Valid Class 5 Driver License with clean record
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Suite
  • Mechanical Aptitude and ability to perform necessary  repairs

 

PREFERRED

  • Bachelor's Degree in Engineering/Geology/Earth Sciences
  • Valid class 1 or 3 Driver License
  • General product knowledge  
  • Self-motivator, self-starter  
  • Good oral and written communication skills
  • Able to work closely with fellow employees

title: Design Engineer
description:
itec group Inc. is currently recruiting for a Design Engineer. The successful incumbent will be tasked to provide design and technical support for production. This is a great opportunity to work for a company that provides a great opportunity to improve technical and practical skills to prepare for future career growth. At itec group, we provide candidates with a seamless experience to transition into suitable roles as professionals in their desired fields.

Key Qualifications include but are not limited to:
  • Degree in Civil Engineering; registered Professional Engineer or Engineering Intern
  • Strong working knowledge and experience in AutoCAD, SolidWorks, and Microsoft Office
  • Strong analytical, project management, organization, and communication skills

Key Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Create and maintain designs, drawings, and models for shop production
  • Maintain documentation, software, and records of projects
  • Ensure that drawings, designs, and processes adhere to appropriate regulations and standards

If you are interested in learning more about the Design Engineer opportunity and meet the required qualifications, please submit your updated resume directly to craig@itecgroup.ca.

We are recruitment industry leaders committed to quality service, integrity, respect and equal opportunity. Accommodation is available to all applicants upon request throughout our recruitment process. Please contact us at admin@itecgroup.ca or 1-877-682-8889 x223 if you
require accommodation. We will work with all applicants to accommodate their accessibility needs. By applying for this position you are consenting to receive electronic messages related to the consideration of employment through itec group and its clients.

Should you wish to stop receiving electronic communications at any time, simply let us know at unsubscribe@itecgroup.ca

title: Field Service Engineer II - Alberta
description:
Overview:

Werfen

Werfen, founded in 1966, is a worldwide developer, manufacturer and distributor of specialized diagnostic instruments, related reagents, automation workcells, and data management solutions for use primarily in hospitals and independent clinical laboratories. The Companyâ€™s business lines include Hemostasis, Acute Care, and Autoimmunity diagnostics, as well as Original Equipment Manufacturing.   Our success comes from a specific focus in these rapidly evolving diagnostic areas, our commitment to customers, and our dedication to innovation and quality. Weâ€™re passionate about providing healthcare professionals the most valuable and complete solutions to improve hospital efficiency and enhance patient care.

 

Our North American Commercial Operations, as well as our Headquarters and Technology Center for Hemostasis and Acute Care Diagnostics, are based in Bedford, MA.  Our Headquarters and Technology Center for Autoimmunity Diagnostics is based in San Diego, CA.

 

Position Summary:

Under direction of the Area Service Manager, develops customer satisfaction through technical repair, installation, training, operation, and maintenance of Werfen instruments and systems. Position may have a specific assigned territory or system population or may be a position to cover other assigned territories as needed under the direction of the Area Service Manager

 

Bilingual (French/Engish) candidates are highly desireable for this role, as well as candidates with experience in a lab or clinical setting

Responsibilities:

Key Accountabilities:  

  • Provides highly visible customer support through the performance of on-site installations and necessary diagnoses, troubleshooting, service and repair of complex instruments and system. Performs routine, non-routine and unusual technical repairs of all systems assigned. This includes updates, retrofits, PMs and product enhancements.  
  • Instructs customers in the proper operation, maintenance and trouble-shooting of IL instruments and systems.  
  • Responsible for complying with all appropriate regulatory bodies (FDA, ISO and Health Canada) mandated policies, procedures, work instructions, and records.
  • Serves as a company liaison with customers.    
  • Responsible for routine and consistent interaction with sales counterparts with respect to customer situations, updates, and lead generations.  
  • Assures financial stability and viability of territory by promoting and selling service agreements, PMs, and other services.  
  • Schedules, coordinates, and presents pertinent information at Customer User Group Training Seminars and Marketing Road shows.
  • Assists the Area Service Manager in analyzing the severity of customer complaints and to develop plans to resolve customer complaints as needed
  • Travel into other territories may be needed to assist with duties and responsibilities above.
  • Other duties and responsibilities as assigned by the Area Service Manager

Budget Managed (if applicable) N/A

 

Internal Networking/Key Relationships

  • TBD based on departmental needs  

Skills & Capabilities:

  • Approachability
  • Command Skills
  • Listening
  • Presentation Skills
  • Functional/Technical Skills
Qualifications:

Min Knowledge & Experience required for the position:  

  • Associates Degree in Electronics, Biomedical Engineering, Medical Technology or related industry.  
  • Minimum of three years' experience as an Werfen FSE I in the diagnosis, repair and maintenance of Werfen systems, or equivalent industry experience.  
  • Must have good organizational skills, the ability to multi-task, work under pressure and exercise good judgment.
  • Ability to communicate effectively with customers, peers and management through oral and written presentations I reports.
  • Must have good MS Office Skills (Word, Excel and PowerPoint) including the ability to manipulate data and build presentations.  
  • Travel is required.
  • Minimum 30% by auto in primary assigned territory.
