title: Design Engineer - 16175
description:
The Design Engineer is a fully qualified and accredited engineering professional who applies theoretical and practical knowledge to provide engineering design, estimating, planning, and quality management services for low to medium complexity projects and/or operations safely, with quality, within budget, and on time.

This is a full.-time, 12-month contract position located in Burnaby, BC.

Advantages
Opportunity working for one of B.C.’s Top Employers and one of Canada’s Best Diversity Employers for four years in a row.

Responsibilities
• Develop safe engineering solutions by using initiative and judgement to perform activities such as developing designs, analyzing and resolving problems, and interpreting engineering specifications on low to medium complexity assignments for projects and/or operations.
• Assist project or operations management to meet safety, cost, quality, and time objectives by performing activities such as proposing changes in plans and estimated costs, recommending payment for work completed by contractors, preparing progress reports, coordinating work schedules and other similar tasks.
• Participate in the engineering practice by conducting independent studies and analysis, exercising judgment in selecting and interpreting information, recommending safe engineering designs, and making typical decisions related to standard methods and designs so that the engineering standards are maintained.
• Perform periodic tasks independently which may include on-site construction quality control and monitoring to ensure design compliance.
• Engage with the senior engineering team where engineering problems are difficult, complex, or unusual to support the management of engineering risk.


Qualifications
• A minimum four (4) years of in a relevant engineering field or equivalent.
• University graduate in applied science or engineering
• Registered Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) or Professional Geoscientist (P.Geo.) with Engineers & Geoscientists BC or with another jurisdiction and eligible for registration as such with Engineers & Geoscientists BC
• Familiarity with CAD systems and drawing standards
• Ability to use standard industry design/analysis software
• Intermediate MS Office skills (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)
• Intermediate English skills for professional environment, written and spoken

Summary
If you would like to be considered for this engineer opportunity in BC, please forward your resume via email to Dora Pang, dora.pang@randstad.ca or call 236-334-4381.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Senior Site Engineer
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood is seeking a Senior Geotechnical Resident Engineer with expertise in quality assurance (QA) inspection and monitoring of the construction of tailings and water retention dam related projects. This is a long-term construction project with a rotational schedule to a Northern Ontario mine site.  The successful candidate will have experience that specializes in QA inspection of foundation materials, engineered fills, HDPE liner and concrete during the construction of tailings storage facilities and water control dams.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead Quality Assurance (QA) inspection team, liaison with construction EPCM team and client site personnel and the designated contractor to facilitate construction of tailings and water retaining structures.
  • Attend meetings, make QA presentations/updates, plan QA inspection requirements for different portions of the project, and provide technical review of QA inspection reports.
  • Monitor day-to day field construction activities and provide technical direction and support to multi-disciplinary Wood QA field staff.
  • Implementation of health and safety, security protocols and supporting Wood’s strong safety culture.
  • Management of RFI requests from the contractor and client which includes the initial review of the RFI request for clarity, and the provision of a timely response to the RFI.
  • Submission and management of field technical directives, site instructions, and non- conformance reports.
  • Preparation of Site Geotechnical Engineering and Construction QA reports (daily & weekly) and workplans using Wood templates and quality standards.
  • Review and sign off on all field reports and other forms that were provided by the contractor;
  • Review of as-built information and provide final acceptance of the structures.
  • Lead by example with active support of internal policies and practices, including risk management, project management, and quality management.
  • Mentor and train junior & intermediate staff to grow their technical capabilities.
  • Updating and managing QA staffing schedule.

Skills / Qualifications

  • B.Sc. in Civil / Geotechnical Engineering.
  • 10+ years of tailings and water retention dam construction experience, EPCM experience preferred.
  • Licensed Professional Engineer.
  • Previous experience with analytical and geotechnical applications.
  • Understanding of ground control elements, their installation and QA/QC requirements.
  • A clear and effective communicator and presenter, both verbally and written in English.
  • An unwavering commitment to the highest health and safety, environmental and social performance standards.
  • Extensive knowledge of construction standards and specifications.
  • Software MS Office and geotechnical applications.
  • Ability to work a rotational 2:2 assignment for up to 2 years.

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

description:

Keller Foundations Ltd, has built a solid reputation throughout Canada as an industry leader in providing innovative, comprehensive, Ground Engineering solutions.  We take pride in providing the highest possible level of service to our clients. Keller offers a challenging and rewarding business atmosphere to those who value teamwork, integrity, and diversity. title: Senior Field Engineer
description:
About US

In 1977, OSI introduced the first generation electronic chart system for the maritime market and revolutionized navigation. Over the years we have had many firsts.  Today, OSI Maritime Systems is a leading provider of integrated navigation and tactical solutions designed for naval and maritime security operations. Among those solutions, the company develops and delivers integrated bridge systems for warships, integrated dived navigation systems for submarines, and C2 systems for small craft. Presently, 23 navies totaling more than 600 warships and submarines operate using OSI systems.

Due to the nature of our company, all employees must pass specific security criteria. Only candidates who are Canadian citizens, have PR status or have a citizenship from a NATO country, and who satisfy security clearance criteria, will be considered.

 

The Job

The Senior Field Engineer provides engineering support for the integration and problem diagnosis of OSI’s navigational system products both, in-house and at customer sites.  The incumbent assembles, performs quality testing and diagnostics, installs and configures, services and repairs OSI products and navigational systems for the Company’s clients at world-wide locations.


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Installs/commissions Navigation Systems products at customer sites inside and outside North America.
  • Diagnoses and repairs hardware assembly problems; diagnoses and repairs software configuration, network and integration issues.
  • Assists Systems Engineering and Software Test departments to design, develop and implement system test environments in support of Product Development and project requirements.
  • Assists the Training team in the development and delivery of technical training to customers on system installation, maintenance and problem diagnosis.
  • Will sometimes be required to organize and manage team tasks and activities related to the role.
  • Provides customer helpdesk email and telephone support.
  • Provides Service Engineering support and advice to internal staff in resolving technical problems.
  • Ensures required records are maintained and properly completed in accordance with the Service procedures.
  • Produces and maintains all required documentation in compliance with company requirements and ISO 9001:2015 standards.
  • As per the defined procedures, performs all required testing for relevant products, producing and maintaining the required documents in the Company database.
  • In conjunction with systems engineering department, may create and/or edit as-built drawings and documentation.
  • Ensures tools, equipment, material and any documentation required for each job is in good order.
  • Ensures awareness of and compliance to all applicable employment, environmental, health and WCB safety legislation.
  • Perform additional project associated tasks as required and determined by the Service Supervisor and Supportability Manager.


KNOWLEDGE & QUALIFICATIONS

Education:  Degree in Engineering or related field, or Diploma in Electrical/Electronic Engineering.

Experience:  Minimum of 7 years of Engineering experience preferably in the military domain; experience in the delivery of complex support solutions to government/military customers is an asset.

Skills:  Minimum of 5 years of practical work experience in a Service Engineering environment, preferably in marine electronics; experience in building and troubleshooting computer issues, radar, and electronic sensors is an asset.  Experience with navigation products is an asset.  Extensive knowledge of Electronic and Windows operating systems; working knowledge of system networks and software scripting; excellent customer relation, prioritization, organizational, multi-tasking and communication skills; detail oriented; ability to work independently as well as part of a team.  A working understanding of communication and data transfer standards is essential.  Previous experience and willingness to train other internal and customer technicians an asset.

Other:  Ability and willingness to travel (must have a valid passport) and continually learn new procedures and techniques; must be eligible to meet and maintain requirements for security clearance as applicable and if required must be able to work additional hours to meet the objectives of the position.
 

Why OSI?

We have a Professional Development program in place that supports our employees in their career development by providing funds, time, and opportunities to become better at what they do.

At OSI you can make a difference. We are a change willing organization that is always looking for new ideas. We strive to improve what it is we do and how we do it. If you have ideas we would love to hear about them.

OSI fosters an inclusive and diverse culture. We celebrate our diversity and strive to be more inclusive because it makes us a better company.

We also offer great benefits: 
  • Extended healthcare 
  • Dental care
  • Group Retirement Savings Plan
  • Emergency Travel Assistance
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program

title: Design Engineer
description:
Dynamix Agitators
Design Engineer - Full Time Position
Location: Richmond, British Columbia

About the Job:
Job Title:MECHANICAL ENGINEER, ENGINEERING CONTRACTOR
Employment Type: Full Time position
 Department: Engineering
 Reports to: Engineering Manager
Direct Reports: Not applicable 

 Position Overview:  
  • Create drawings, documentation, and engineering calculations required for the Product Development Process.  
  • Manage product development tasks as requested. 
  • Document all results.

 Primary Work Activities and Responsibilities: 
Engineering:
  • Demonstrate consistent and proficient application of mechanical engineering principles in the design of parts and projects for Dynamix equipment.
  • Create 3D models and prepare manufacturing drawings using design software. Ensure due consideration to mechanics of materials and compliance with accepted practices of geometric dimensioning and tolerancing (GD&T).

  • Practical knowledge of Manufacturing processes, with special attention to materials, machining.
  • Experience in Engineering documentation and reporting.

  • Licenced Mechanical or Chemical Engineer. (PEng)
 
Thank you for your interest in this exciting opportunity. We appreciate all candidates; however, we will contact only those qualified to meet our current needs.

title: Field Service Engineer
description:
Job Title: Field Service Engineer

 

Job Summary: Maintain ScriptPro’s computer-based technology and automation equipment at customer sites, nationally and worldwide. This is a road warrior, heavy travel position. You get to keep all airline/rental car travel points. Great work-life balance with five days off in a row. Competitive starting pay including annual increase, generous overtime, and bonus opportunity. We offer comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, vision, life, short- and long-term disability, 401K match, PTO, CCTO (paid volunteer work), and 9 paid holidays.

ScriptPro develops, sells, and supports state of the art products and services for healthcare system customers including federal agencies such as the Department of Defense, VA, Indian Health Services as well as multiple major hospital systems around the country.  These customers require certain security clearances and health related tests and vaccines in order to gain access to their locations.  To support ScriptPro customers and as a condition of employment, you will be required to gain federal security clearance and/or prove compliance with certain health related tests and vaccines such as but not limited to tuberculosis, annual flu, and the COVID vaccine (requests for a religious or medical exemption will be considered).  Federal security clearance (See the Standard Form 86 link below) can include additional background checks such as but not limited to credit history and drug testing.


Reporting Relationship: Field Service Supervisor

 

Work Schedule: Generally, a rotating 9 days on, 5 days off schedule.  Overtime is typical and paid. Regular and punctual attendance is an essential function of every job at ScriptPro LLC.

 

Scope of the Role:

• Troubleshoot, diagnose, and repair equipment onsite at pharmacies and remotely by phone

• Administer training and support to pharmacy staff when needed

• Diagnose customer workflow issues and optimize ScriptPro system performance

• 80% or more travel is an essential function of this job and is required (equal amounts of long-distance driving and air travel)

• Physical demands of this role require lifting up to 55lbs unassisted, and lifting up to 120lb, push/pull up to 800lbs assisted, climb various ladder types, lifting and stacking servers, mounting monitors, computers, or status screens (including but not limited to 65 inch LCD TVs), as well as stand 6-8 hours per day.

 

Education and Experience Requirements:

• Preferred BS in Electronics or Computer Science, or equivalent work experience

• General knowledge of IT, Windows NT/XP/7/8/10

• Experience with computer systems repair and a strong mechanical aptitude

• Must be able to lift 70+ lbs. daily, including when traveling by auto or air

• It is ScriptPro’s policy to run a comprehensive background check post offer.  And, must be able to obtain Department of Defense security clearance after date of hire. See Standard Form 86 to preview requirements

• Must be available to work as needed and assigned

 

Attributes Desired:

• Maturity and integrity are a must

• Strong organizational and customer service skills

 

Working Conditions:

This position is a combination of office and shop environments. Regularly exposed to dust, odors, oil, fumes and noise.  May be exposed to moving mechanical parts, vibration and electrical shock and exposures to all weather conditions.   This is a very active position and regularly required to stand, walk, sit, stoop, bend and reach.  Ability to push/pull and lift independently is required.   Motor coordination skills and ability to work with tools is also required.  This job includes specific vision ability including close, distance and color. Ability to learn and solve practical problems and interpret a variety of instructions is required.  Focused attention during extended periods of travel time.

  

ScriptPro is not sponsoring any type of visa for this position.

ScriptPro is an Equal Opportunity Employer Committed to a Diverse and Inclusive Workforce.

Please visit www.scriptpro.com to learn more about the mission of our company

title: Field Engineer
description:
Overview:

Provides technical engineering information to ensure construction work complies with all engineering standards, codes and contract specifications.

What you will be doing:

 

  • Meets daily with project crews to review production schedule and confirm all materials, equipment and resources are readily available for production to continue on schedule and within budget.
  • Collects, coordinates and analysis shop drawings, design specifications, material requirements and project data through the duration of the project to ensure quality and contract specification compliance.
  • Provides technical input for project work plan and scheduling. Identifying risk elements of production, materials, equipment or process that could negatively impact the budget or schedule.
  • Evaluates daily production, schedule and budget projections to accurately track project performance. Documents daily activities in Company approved methods and technologies.
  • Notifies team members and manager of any significant schedule changes and recommends solutions for management consideration.
  • Perform additional assignments per managementâ€™s direction.
  • Remits accurate project quantity input and controls using assigned project cost coding to ensure project financials are accurately reported. Manages cost coding with Company finance and accounting teams regarding employee time, materials, equipment and subcontractor needs.
  • Reviews and approves daily timecards for all Company construction crews. Works with Office Manager, payroll and job construction supervisors to resolve timecard inquiries, as needed.
  • Reviews project specifications for quality assurance at the beginning of work, during the project work and after work completes. Initiates and manages appropriate certificates, inspections and other documentation regarding construction production on the project site.
  • Works with construction crews and engineering leaders to plan field layout on the project site, ensuring appropriate utility and commercial lines are marked before production begins. Initiates and manages any permits needed before work can begin.
  • Conducts required Job Hazard Analysis (JHAs) to ensure a safe and compliance work environment for all construction personnel. Attends weekly safety meetings with field team and project leadership; presents field analysis as needed.
  • Assists the estimating team with project schedules and provides technical input as needed.
  • Assists the development of design drawings and provides technical input, as needed.
  • Coordinates subcontractor work methods, schedule and crews as needed.
  • Reconciles job close-out checklist with owner representative and field crews at the end of the project.
  • Maintains knowledge of Company values and strategic plan.
What we are looking for:
  • Bachelor's Degree in a related field required.
  • 1+ year experience preferred.
  • Construction engineering experience or knowledge required.
  • Beginner knowledge of construction equipment & techniques, drawing & specifications, building materials and required standards applicable to the project.  
  • Ability to assume responsibility, interface and communicate effectively with others.
Why work for us:

Some of the benefits you may be eligible for as an employee are:

  • Comprehensive compensation package and paid time off program
  • Industry leading 401(k)/RRSP
  • Medical/Extended Health Care, Dental, Vison and/or Provincial Medical
  • Wellness benefits & Employee Assistance Program
  • Tuition Reimbursement Program

We are an EEO/AA/ADA/Veterans employer.

title: Senior Design Engineer
description:
Description

At Xilinx, we are leading the industry transformation to build an adaptable, intelligent world. ARE YOU bold, collaborative, and creative? We develop leaders and innovators who want to revolutionize the world of technology. We believe that by embracing diverse ideas, pushing boundaries, and working together as ONEXILINX, anything is possible.

Our culture of innovation began with the invention of the Field Programmable Gate Array (FPGA), and with the 2018 introduction of our Adaptive Compute Acceleration Platform (ACAP), has made a quantum leap in capability, solidifying our role as the adaptable platform supplier of choice. From the beginning, we have always believed in providing inventors with products and platforms that are infinitely adaptable. From self-driving cars, to world-record genome processing, to AI and big data, to the world's first 5G networks, we empower the world's builders and visionaries whose ideas solve every day problems and improve people's lives.

If you are PASSIONATE, ADAPTABLE, and INNOVATIVE, Xilinx is the right place for you! At Xilinx, we care deeply about creating significant development experiences while building a strong sense of belonging and connection. We champion an environment of empowered learning, wellness, community engagement, and recognition, so you can focus on work that matters - world class technology that improves the way we live and work. We are ONEXILINX.


Job Description


IP Design Solutions is an expert engineering team that is used by Xilinx to develop new technologies that will help Xilinx enter or excel in new or developing markets. In doing this, the team works very tightly with key customers in the target markets.


The position is for a senior design engineer that will work on design projects targeting Xilinx products. The scope of work will focus mainly on logic/HDL design and verification on projects related to development of communications and security systems. This person will work as an integral part of a highly talented team during project execution and is expected to deal and interact with customers on a regular basis. The person will be expected to work within a high quality development process and where possible and when necessary lead change and improvements to this process.



Xilinx is a US federal government contractor and subcontractor. As required by Executive Order, our US employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 regardless of the employee's work location or work arrangement (e.g., telework, remote work, etc.), subject to such exceptions as required by law. If selected, you will be required to be vaccinated against COVID-19 and submit documentation of proof of vaccination or have an approved accommodation by December 8, 2021.


Qualifications
  • BS with 4+ years of exp MS with 3+ years of exp or PhD in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineeringor related equivalent

Technical

  • Minimum of 4years of design and development experience, preferably in a customer facing role
  • Minimum of 4years of experience in FPGA VHDL and/or Verilog design, Xilinx technology and tools, FPGA verification and test
  • Experience in writing technical documentation, including Requirement/Design/Test Specifications, Test Plans and User Guides
  • Experience in HW testing, including working with test equipment – logic and traffic analysers, test generators etc.
  • Some experience in Perl/Python scripting
  • SystemVerilog/UVM
  • Ethernet and packet processing
  • Wireless applications at layer 2 and below, e.g. baseband or radio

General

  • Capability in defining innovative new products that solve real world problems or track record of delivering high quality, complex projects on time
  • Ability to communicate technical information in an organised and understandable fashion
  • Ability to work within a team
  • Must be capable of demonstrating problem solving, debugging and organisation skills

title: Senior Solutions Engineer
description:
As a Senior Solutions Engineer, you will be the primary technical resource for our Enterprise Accounts team. You will share your product and technical expertise through presentations, product demonstrations, and technical evaluations (Proof Of Values). As the technical expert, you will work with clients to understand their requirements and pain points, then design the right solution for their business needs. During the sales cycle you will guide clients through trials and POVs, demonstrating Sumo Logic's ability to meet and exceed their requirements and building a positive relationship that will provide continuous value to our customers. Finally, you will have the opportunity to work cross-functionally with our Product Management and Engineering teams to share your knowledge and experiences to ultimately improve our business and our customers' success.

We seek talent who wants to leverage their technical and people skills to help deliver solutions to clients directly and become a trusted advisor in the process. Above all else, you should be highly self-motivated and extremely curious to learn more Sumo Logic and the vast problems that it can solve.

Responsibilities

  • Partner with the Account Executives / Account Managers to understand customer challenges and mains, and articulate Sumo Logic's value proposition, vision, and strategy to customers
  • Technically close complex opportunities through advanced competitive knowledge, technical skill, and credibility
  • Understand and help orchestrate all phases of the sales cycle, including leading technical validations during the Proof of Value phase 
  • Be successful working with all levels of an organization, from executives down to individual developers and Site Reliability Engineers
  • Deliver product and technical demonstrations of the Sumo Logic service
  • Work cross functionally with Product Management and Engineering to improve the Sumo Logic service based on your experience with customers

Requirements

  • B.S. in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field; M.S. in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (preferred)
  • 4+ years as a Solutions Engineer (preferred), Solutions Architect (preferred), Sales Engineer (preferred), Implementation Consultant, Support Engineer, Site Reliability Engineer, or a Software Developer with experience leading projects and/or working with customers
  • Hands on knowledge of Security related products, technologies, and sources such as IDS/IPS, SIEM/Log Management, Network / Endpoint Security, Threat Detection, Incident Response, MSSP/MDR, Threat Feeds, CASB, etc
  • Experience with open source collections (Telegraf, FluentBit, FluentD, Open Telemetry, etc.) (preferred)
  • Experience with leading and running technical validations like Proof of Value (preferred)
  • Experience selling and working with pure SaaS solutions in multi-tenant architectures
  • Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Microsoft Azure (certification is preferred)
  • A broad background and understanding of technical infrastructure (servers, networking devices, storage, etc.)
  • Modern application architecture (micro-services, containers) understanding and experience working with Kubernetes, Docker, and/or Lambda (preferred)
  • Experience with various monitoring tools like Splunk, Datadog, Elastic, New Relic, etc. (preferred)
  • Comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced startup environment and experience at a successful startup (preferred)
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, as well as business and technical acumen 

About Us

Sumo Logic is the pioneer in continuous intelligence, a new category of software, which enables organizations of all sizes to address the data challenges and opportunities presented by digital transformation, modern applications, and cloud computing. The Sumo Logic Continuous Intelligence Platform™ automates the collection, ingestion, and analysis of application, infrastructure, security, and IoT data to derive actionable insights within seconds. More than 2,100 customers rely on Sumo Logic to build, run, and secure their modern applications and cloud infrastructures. Only Sumo Logic delivers its platform as a true, multi-tenant SaaS architecture, across multiple use-cases, enabling businesses to thrive in the Intelligence Economy.

title: Field Service Engineer
description:
The spirit of discovery among Fluke Reliability Systems, our drive to innovate and openness to new ideas, has only one goal: to offer our customers the perfect solution, anywhere in the world. FRS offers a broad range of high-quality products, services and training tailored to the needs of maintenance professionals in the areas of alignment systems, condition monitoring and nondestructive testing. In July 2019, Fluke Corporation, a company of the Fortive group, acquired PRUFTECHNIK and combined eMaint and Fluke Connect to create Fluke Reliability Systems.







Fluke is leading the world in creating software, test tools and technology that will support customers today and in the future. We are a customer-obsessed market leader with a strong reputation for reliability, quality and safety.



A wholly owned subsidiary of Fortive Corporation (www.fortive.com), Fluke is a global corporation headquartered in the greater Seattle area. Driven by the successful Fortive Business System, Fluke offers the passion of a startup with the resources of a Fortune 500 company. We are focused on the growth of our individual employees, teams and the Fluke brand.







Position Description:



Passionate about providing reliable solutions to customers in a world of industrial manufacturing? Fluke Reliability is seeking a motivated individual to join our service team as a Field Service Engineer. As an FSE, you will be required to travel to customers’ sites to perform professional services. Our service solutions include in-the-field alignment and vibration measuring as well as remote condition monitoring support. You will be responsible for planning travel to and from clients’ sites, preparing equipment for the jobs, meeting with clients and performing the work, and generating reports upon completion of the projects. Most projects range from 1 to 3 days, but larger projects can be assigned. Additionally, customer product training may be assigned.



Responsibilities:





+ Promote and perform onsite professional services to support customer’s reliability initiatives



+ Provide remote/onsite product training for clients looking to improve their knowledge of the products and their applications



+ Create reports and supplemental service documentation – maintain information in the company database



+ Communicate with the customer to ensure satisfaction and implement any necessary corrective actions



+ Book all necessary travel, maintain expenses, and submit expense reports in a timely fashion



+ Good people skills and ability to mentor and develop technical staff



+ Interface with cross functional work teams such as customer support/services, marketing/sales, and management



+ Misc. other duties commensurate with the capabilities of a Field Service Engineer






+ Bachelor’s degree or equivalent technical qualifications in electrical/ mechanical engineering or physical sciences.



+ Able to demonstrate a successful career, with previous experience in service, maintenance, or technical role



+ Valid Driver’s License is required (Passport is a plus).



+ Proficient communication skills in French and English



+ Working knowledge of MS Office, Excel, Salesforce, CAD software



+ Travel on weekends and/or holidays: Approximately 50%-85%, primarily North America, with some potential international travel



+ Ability to lift 50lbs of equipment, ascend and descend stairs, ladders, don/doff PPE and fall protection, and work in uncomfortable manufacturing conditions




Fortive’s essential technology makes the world stronger, safer, and smarter. We accelerate transformation across a broad range of applications including environmental, health and safety compliance, industrial condition monitoring, next-generation product design, and healthcare safety solutions.







We are a global industrial technology innovator with a startup spirit. Our forward-looking companies lead the way in software-powered workflow solutions, data-driven intelligence, AI-powered automation, and other disruptive technologies. We’re a force for progress, working alongside our customers and partners to solve challenges on a global scale, from workplace safety in the most demanding conditions to groundbreaking sustainability solutions.







We are a diverse team 17,000 strong, united by a dynamic, inclusive culture and energized by limitless learning and growth. We use the proven Fortive Business System (FBS) to accelerate our positive impact.







At Fortive, we believe in you. We believe in your potential—your ability to learn, grow, and make a difference.



At Fortive, we believe in us. We believe in the power of people working together to solve problems no one could solve alone.



At Fortive, we believe in growth. We’re honest about what’s working and what isn’t, and we never stop improving and innovating.














Fluke is leading the world in creating software, test tools and technology that will support customers today and in the future . We are a customer-obsessed market leader with a strong reputation for reliability, quality and safety.



A wholly owned subsidiary of Fortive Corporation ( www.fortive.com ), Fluke is a global corporation headquartered in the greater Seattle area. Driven by the successful Fortive Business System, Fluke offers the passion of a startup with the resources of a Fortune 500 company. We are focused on the growth of our individual employees, teams and the Fluke brand.

title: Design Engineer
description:
Brandt is continuing to grow and expand our business and we are looking for hard-working, creative individuals to join our team. We are currently seeking Design Engineers, for our Agricultural Division,which specializes in the design and manufacturing of customized heavy equipment innovations that improve our customer's efficiency and productivity.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Designing engineering systems, machines and devices which meet customers’ needs and which, when produced, comply with sound engineering practices and standards.
  • Review, evaluate, and improve upon engineering designs, drafting, schematics and specifications.
  • Perform engineering analysis and develop test procedures, provide quality standards and adherence.
  • Recommend improvements to current design of products.
  • Ensure that designs are safe, efficient, effective, and able to be cost effectively manufactured.
  • Provide feedback and advice regarding the technical and structural aspects of projects.
  • Collaborate with other departments to ensure project success.
  • Support the Platform Team Leader as required.
  • Perform other related duties as assigned.
  • Mechanical Engineering degree or Mechanical Engineering technology certificate.
  • 2 years of direct work experience.
  • Proficiency with SolidWorks is preferred.
  • Meticulous attention to detail; strong mechanical background with focus on machine design preferred.
  • Experience with steel fabrication, manufacturing processes, machine design and machining methods, including material selection, welding processes and machined component design.
  • Strong problem identification and problem resolution skills.
  • Practical experience with product development and testing.
  • Able to create alternative solutions to problems.
  • Familiar with mechanical and hydraulic systems.
  • Familiar with ERP systems and lean manufacturing processes are considered an asset.
  • Strong work ethic and positive team attitude.
  • Flexibility to adjust to shifting priorities and deadlines.

title: Field Service Engineer
description:
Field Service Engineer


Quebec, QC, Canada


Role: Field Service Engineer Department: Service and Sales Enablement Division: Breast & Skeletal Health Location: Quebec City, Quebec


As a leading innovator of women’s health, we at Hologic are empowering people to live healthier lives everywhere, every day.


As the engine of our business, our engineering teams continually challenge our ways of working, being pragmatic in their approach to innovating. From our field service engineers who work tirelessly to reduce our customer downtime, to our manufacturing engineers who keep our laboratories and manufacturing equipment performance in perfect condition.


Our Field Service Engineers are instrumental in providing a first-class customer experience when repairing and maintaining our products on customer sites.


We are looking for a talented and skilled Field Service Engineer to join our Breast & Skeletal division servicing our medical imaging equipment across Quebec City.


You will be experienced in providing engineering support to medical devices.


You will be comfortable travelling as required for the job, typically 5 days per week with overnight stays averaging around 60-70%.


You will love troubleshooting and finding issues to solve, the more complex the better!


But equally, you will be a fantastic communicator with our customers, setting clear expectations and be able to build a strong rapport.


Does this sound like you? Then read on!


What does your day-to-day look like?


• Providing emergency service and repairs using troubleshooting skills in electrical, electronic, and mechanical systems.


• Installing instruments at customer sites


• Planning and completing preventative maintenance on time.


• Preparation of laboratory design for new instrument installations.


• Liaising with customer IT departments and assisting with information systems installations and troubleshooting.


• Accountability for maintaining assigned inventory.


• Supporting marketing activities such as exhibitions.


• Routinely complete administrative paperwork, such as but not limited to: Time Reports, Expense Reports, Equipment Site Assessments, Inventory Reports, Internal Laboratory Reports, Equipment Checklists and Field Service Reports.


• Providing basic usemaintenance training to customers.


Not everyone can be an FSE at Hologic, to be considered we require the following:


Education: Certification in Electro-Mechanical / Electronics


Experience: We want to see your experience as a service engineer within medical devices. You will be able to troubleshoot complex electrical, pneumatic and mechanical systems.


Medical imaging and laser experience is advantageous.


You’ll be able to build meaningful relationships with your customer base and become a trusted partner.


You will have a full and clean driving license!


So why join Hologic?


We are committed to making Hologic the company where top talent comes to grow. For you to succeed, we want to enable you with the tools and knowledge required and so we provide comprehensive training when you join as well as continued development and training throughout your career.


We offer a competitive salary and annual bonus scheme, one of our talent partners can discuss this in more detail with you.


From a benefits perspective, you will join our wide-ranging benefits policy including retirement savings plan, vacation, medical and dental insurance and many more!


If you have the right skills and experience and want to join our team, apply today. We can’t wait to hear from you!

title: Field Service Engineer - Network Engineer (Entry, Intermediate & Sr.)
description:
As the first and often the most frequent point of contact for our clients, you will have the greatest opportunity to influence the client's perception of Evertz. This position is a challenging mix that combines technical know-how and customer service skills both in-house and when traveling to our customerâ€™s production studios and distribution facilities.

You will be challenged with configuring, commissioning, and systematically trouble shooting Ethernet/IP networks for the latest advancements in broadcast networks and video processing equipment.
 

Responsibilities:

  • Engage in implementation, documentation and deployment on the build out of both small and large scale IP Networks supporting broadcast infrastructures
  • Respond and provide technical direction to customers regarding operational issues, firmware upgrades and general maintenance
  • Assess the customerâ€™s application, troubleshoot and diagnose issues through research and/or re-creation to determine the root cause
  • Recommend solutions utilizing various levels of technical language appropriate to the customer in a timely, clear and professional manner
  • Maintain a communication link between customer service and other departments by partnering to resolve customer issues and communicating customer feedback to aid in design changes including customer â€œfeature requestsâ€ to product managers
  • Support the development of product communications by generating or authoring customer guides and provide the technical writing group with information including Pinouts, FAQ, Application notes, Best Practices and customer product or system configuration and product integration with other manufacturerâ€™s products
  • Install product(s) or systems at customer sites and delivering training to customers in-house or abroad
  • (RFC 2328), PIM, QOS, RIP, Sflow, SNMP, STP/RSTP/MST (IEEE 802.1d), VARP/VRRP, VLAN (IEEE 802.1q), VRF

Qualifications:

  • Unparalleled desire to help the customer and deliver service excellence
  • Education in Computer Networking or related recent practical experience
  • Electrical, Electronic, or Computer Electronic Technician or engineering education or related recent practical experience
  • A strong comfort level with Linux is highly desired
  • Some Network trouble shooting experience
  • Knowledge of IP Networking Protocols (IGMPv2/v3, RIP, BGP, OSPF, EIGRP)
  • Knowledge of Internet network technologies (DNS, Firewall, SSH, HTTP)
  • Must have a valid Ontario driverâ€™s license

What we offer:

  • Employer funded benefits program
  • Competitive total compensation package
  • Work-life balance
  • Employee Assistance plan
  • Employee Discount Platform
  • Career progression
  • Casual work environment
  • Social events and sports teams

About Us:

Evertz Microsystems (TSX:ET) is a leading global manufacturer of broadcast equipment and solutions that deliver content to television sets, on-demand services, WebTV, IPTV, and mobile devices (like phones and tablets). Evertz has expertise in delivering complete end-to-end broadcast solutions for all aspects of broadcast production including content creation, content distribution and content delivery.

Considered as an innovator by their customers, Evertz delivers cutting edge solutions that are unmatched in the industry in both hardware and software. Evertz delivers products and solutions that can be found in major broadcast facilities on every continent. Evertzâ€™ customer base also includes telcos, satellite, cable TV, and IPTV providers.

With over 1700 employees, that include hardware and software engineers, Evertz is one of the leaders in the broadcast industry. Evertz has a global presence with offices located in: Canada, United States, United Kingdom, Germany, United Arab Emirates, India, Hong Kong, China, Singapore, and Australia. Evertz was named one of Canadaâ€™s 50 Best Managed Companies, which recognizes excellence in Canadian-owned and Canadian-managed companies. Canadaâ€™s 50 Best Managed Companies identifies Canadian corporate success through companies focused on their core vision, creating stakeholder value and excelling in the global economy.

Evertz makes certain there is an equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with AODA, Evertz will strive to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources upon scheduling your interview.

Thank you for considering a career with Evertz

title: Product Engineer - Associate - PSP - JLL101
description:
Title:                              Product Engineer
Work Location:Remote Location
Duration:12+ Months


Job Description 
The Product Engineer is responsible for the suspension component and system design, development, and engineering release for production vehicles.  The Engineer will take part in development of vehicle level functional objectives and work to establish, and achieve, the corresponding component level functional objectives.  The Engineer will be responsible for the components/system from initial concept, to kinematic/compliance Modeling, to structural analysis, to validation, through component and vehicle launch.
Job Specific Requirements         
component design (FMEA), analysis (CAE), vehicle packaging (NX), model/drawing integrity (Teamcenter), development, component validation (DVP&R, change management (CN), engineering bill of material (EBOM/CODEP), build support, issue management (GIMS), fastened joint design, and assembly torque development.
Requirements:
  • Bachelor of Science Degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering * If a recent college graduate then GPA minimum of 2.5 *
  • Two (2) years chassis engineering design and development experience
  • Demonstrated automotive interest (via hobbies or college project)
  • Demonstrated passion to work in automotive industry.
Preferred Requirements:
  • Experience with problem solving such as Red-X (preferred)
  • Experience with robust design such as DFSS (preferred)
  • Ability in NX/Teamcenter (preferred)
  • 2 years suspension design, development, and validation experience (preferred)
  • Experience with release systems (preferred)
  • Master of Science Degree in Engineering (preferred)
  • SAE collegiate design project team experience (preferred)

title: Engineering Technician
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood Applied Intelligence -Automation and Controls is currently recruiting for a SeniorElectrical Controls Technologist (3) in Burlington, ON. with the ability to create PLC programs and prepare electrical schematics in the Automotive Electrical Controls industry.

 

This is an excellent opportunity to work with a strong collaborative senior team, to work directly with customers, to define the requirements of the projects, and to implement solutions. As a member of the team, you will receive onboard training, learn how to handle commissioning responsibilities, and play a key role in the growth of this business. For individuals with a strong IT background and interest, there is an opportunity to develop your skills integrating controls systems with computer systems. This position will report to the Branch Manager. This is a hands-on job that requires field work in Canada, USA, and Mexico. 

 

Responsibilities

  • Be involved in the design, installation, and configuration of new and existing equipment automation together with equipment/process personnel
  • Design and integrate control systems on new and existing equipment.
  • Provide technical expertise and support on equipment, processes and methods aimed at sustaining or increasing output
  • Design, test, and validate systems (individually or as a member of a team)
  • Be involved in new and existing production line expansion installation and support
  • Research new technology or CIM applications to provide feedback to team for new enhancement
  • Review the project scope, proposals, job specification and resolve differences, providing constructive feedback to the person giving direction in a respective manner to achieve the best solution possible
  • Apply standard practices and techniques in specific situations, adjust and correlate data, recognize discrepancies in results and follow through with a series of related detailed steps or processes
  • Provide hardware and software enhancement ideas or request to improve productivity or quality
  • Contribute to multiple technical projects targeting continuous improvement results in the areas of safety, quality, efficiency, delivery and cost
  • Work independently and with a team of Engineers/Technologists to assist in software development aspects of larger projects; work with other team members and IT personnel on system launches and upgrades
  • Provide support for Customer Integrated Manufacturing (CIM) Projects from project design, implementation, production launch, to project closure
  • Provide daily CIM operation support to end users to ensure system availability
  • Manage the scope of the project to deliver the customers requirements in the customer specified format
  • Deliver projects on time and with least cost for the defined scope and highest quality to our customers
  • Provide daily status notes on launch and during projects
  • Lead in the development and implementation of applications

 

Skills / Qualifications

Skills & Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering (or Applied Science), or a Technologist Certification. Applicants are expected to have a minimum of five years PLC programming experience in the automation industry along with a history of increasing project responsibility
  • Proficient in PC operating systems and high level of ability in MS Office products
  • Knowledge of PLC controllers and programming languages (ideally Rockwell or Siemens) is mandatory
  • Knowledge of networks, JAVA, C, HTML, and IT systems is an asset
  • Multiple language knowledge would be highly desired
  • Excellent controls system troubleshooting skills are expected
  • A strong understanding and interest in machine integration, equipment monitoring system and tracking solutions
  • Excellent communication skills, written and verbal
  • A self-starter who is dynamic and flexible with high adaptability to changes is preferred
  • Local and international travel may be required; Travel is typically 25%
  • Authorization to work legally in Canada without sponsorship from Wood is required

CEC Controls is a Wood Automation and Controls company

 

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Aircraft Design & Development Project Engineering (Montreal Dorval, QC, CA)
description:
Aircraft Design & Development Project Engineering-MON18483

Description

BOMBARDIER

Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy, efficiency, reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.

The role of Project Management is to control the scope, schedule and budget, of the activities within the Aircraft Design and Product Development team. Your daily tasks will include proactive leadership in problem resolution, establishment of scope, schedule and budget for multiple projects, and execution of the related deliverables. You will also be coordinating internal and external activities between multiple technical functions, including Program and Suppliers.
If you enjoy working in a flexible environment as part of a dynamic and autonomous team with visibility and interaction with senior management, this job is for you!

In your role, you will:

• Manage projects and activities related to major milestones for one of many existing and/or new platforms;
• Manage cross-functional teams in the establishment of scope, schedule and budget of projects;
• Lead and coordinate Engineering Change planning, ensuring completeness and harmonization with stakeholders;
• Enforce adherence to Bombardier practices and Knowledge Standards to promote integrity and consistency in technical activities
• Work closely with technical experts, business leaders, suppliers, and customer representatives to ensure adherence and compliance of projects scope, schedule, and budget;
• Manage priorities between projects and activities, complete strategic schedule analysis, and communicate and harmonize these priorities;
• Identify and report on risks and lead risk mitigation planning and execution;
• Participate and/or coordinate within the internal safety and security processes to assess, contain, and correct potential product deficiencies with cross-functional stakeholders.
• Prepare and provide visibility of budget requirement / resource allocation;
• Prepare and present visibility reports for the various levels of the organization;
• Coordinate Integrated Product Development Team (IPDT) cross-functional reviews;
• Lead and/or coordinate A/C level or work package requirements and design solutions development through the various stages of requirements development and documentation. Includes coordinating with other functions to ensure completeness and cohesiveness.
• Coordinate multi-site activities and remote-participation as necessary;
• Coordinate formal document release (Drawings, ModSums, Compliance Documents, Service Bulletins etc..);

Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,

• You have an Engineering degree/diploma or equivalent working experience, with 3-5 years in project management or aerospace (recent graduates will be considered);
• You are familiar with Program/Project Management processes and principles;
• You have sound aircraft technical and/or manufacturing experience;
• You have previous systems development, flight testing, or avionics experience would be an asset.
• You demonstrate a professional attitude and superior communication skills;
• You have excellent organizational, time management skills, foresight, accuracy, attention to detail and commitment to objectives and responsibilities;
• You have a natural leadership and pro-active attitude with the ability to manage multiple priorities;
• You are self-motivated, autonomous, enthusiastic and results oriented;
• You are technically curious;
• You demonstrate ability to work willingly and independently in a fast paced, challenging environment;
• You have effective problem-solving skills with ability to make good decisions to move projects along to meet or exceed the targets;
• You have good computing skills; proficient in MS Office and experience with MS Excel and MS Project is an asset.

Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigration status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.

Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities

Your ideas move people.

title: Avionics Engineer
description:
The Organization

De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Ltd. (‘DHC’) is a proudly Canadian aerospace company currently transitioning its corporate headquarters to Calgary, AB. DHC is undertaking a consolidation of its underlying subsidiary companies under a single brand currently offering engineering, aftermarket, new aircraft manufacturing, modifications, parts manufacturing and flight training. DHC currently has approximately 1,200 employees based in BC, AB and ON as well as in markets and distribution hubs world-wide. Our strong entrepreneurial spirit, together with a culture of empowerment, quality and innovation create opportunities to grow and succeed in an organization with a proud heritage and bright future.

 

Profile

The Avionics Systems Engineer coordinates all technical aspects of assigned design projects, provides technical support to the production line, and assists with resolution of in-service problems and customer requests.

 

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Perform tasks related to the development and support of Avionics Systems for the aircraft product.
  • Participate in or lead conceptual definition, launch preparation, preliminary definition, detail definition, release, product certification and entry into service within the Engineering System.
  • Prepare or review technical requirements documents, system/ground/flight test procedures and reports, certification reports.
  • Integrate the development activity of avionics systems with internal and external groups as well as participating in meetings and reviews with certification authorities.
  • Support of flight testing including witnessing of tests may be required.
  • Support production, procurement and customers as necessary.

 

Education & Professional Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical/Electronics Engineering, or equivalent.
  • At least 5 years' relevant experience with the design, development, integration and certification of avionics systems including Flight Management Systems.

 

Experience

  • Familiar with and understand pertinent TCCA, FAA and EASA rules and requirements.

 

Skills

  • Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office software tools to produce presentations and reports.
  • You have strong analytical skills and business acumen.
  • You are a team player with a strong sense of initiative, responsibility, and good judgment.
  • You are able to manage several concurrent projects and meet tight deadlines.
  • You think quickly and creatively in a fast-moving and changing business context.
  • You have excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
  • Must be willing to travel to support various regulatory activities.

 

At De Havilland Canada, we aim to be inclusive and diverse and provide equal opportunity for employment. All qualified applicants, regardless of gender, age, race, religion, sexual orientation and disability, are encouraged to apply.

title: Product Engineer
description:
One team. Global challenges. Infinite opportunities. At Viasat, we’re on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. For more than 35 years, Viasat has helped shape how consumers, businesses, governments and militaries around the globe communicate. We’re looking for people who think big, act fearlessly, and create an inclusive environment that drives positive impact to join our team. 

Job Responsibilities 

Viasat is in the business to connect the world. As a global broadband services and technology company, we are connecting international communities to the internet by offering residential internet service; enabling passengers and operations crews to stream high-bandwidth media, applications, and content when traveling globally on commercial, business or government aircraft and maritime vessels.  The Engineering Organization in Commercial Mobility helps to deliver and maintain Viasat's best-in-class in-flight wifi services to our global Commercial Airline customers. 

You will be an engineering leader on a multi-disciplinary Software Product Engineering team working within a multi-regional, cross-functional software product organization. The Product Engineering team provides engineering guidance for new features that deliver value to our commercial airline customers. You will be responsible for working with the Product Management team and airline customers to generate and translate business needs into feature specifications and a development plan, and will support the Engineering teams as they execute throughout the product lifecycle. The solutions you design will interact with a complex and dynamic satellite networking system and cloud enabled ground segment, requiring a broad multidisciplinary understanding and approach to problems. 

In this role, you will: 

  • Work with Product Management to understand product feature needs and perform technical translation 
  • Turn customer requirements into software acceptance criteria 
  • Drive the planning and estimations of initiatives through collaboration with the DevOps teams 
  • Analyze protocol specifications and assist in software understanding and decomposition 
  • Work with DevOps leads to define Epics that independently add business value but preserve the system architecture 
  • Work with DevOps leads to turn Epic status into program level status 
  • Work with DevOps to define and in some cases document interfaces 
  • Mediate technical conversations between the engineering organization and the customer 
  • Assist with the definition of system test plans and procedures 
  • Partner with product owners and team leads on delivery roadmap and product features 
  • Represent architectural perspective of product boundaries to the team 
  • Work with the other members of the Product Engineering team to incorporate features into a technical roadmap that feeds into the overall product portfolio roadmap for the business

Requirements  

  • 5+ years experience as a technical leader within a cross functional engineering organization 
  • Ability to bridge the desires of the customer with the capabilities of the product by carrying technical expertise into strategic conversation about products 
  • Experience with Linux, iptables firewall and internet networking protocols 
  • Experience with defining and maintaining interface specifications 
  • Ability to influence and drive software engineering teams to help meet business needs through technical guidance 
  • Systematic problem-solving approach, coupled with a strong sense of ownership and drive 
  • Experience with leading systems level analysis and design by quickly understanding new technologies and domains, capturing use cases, and translating this into work to be done by cross functional software development teams 
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills to drive interaction with product managers, customers, and developers 
  • Write both technical and non-technical documentation that is clear, concise, and speaks to a wide audience 
  • Problem solver with excellent leadership skills who can motivate others to reach company objectives 
  • BS in EE, CS or related field 
  • Up to 10% Travel 

Preferences 

  • Technical and software engineering background in the areas of cloud computing, enterprise computing, servers, networking, and virtualization technology and products 
  • Expertise in designing, analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems 
  • Familiarity and experience working within a scaled agile software development organization that practices Scrum 
  • Exposure to front end business development and process 
If the Federal Executive Order for Government Contractors becomes effective, this role may require vaccination.  In such instance, absent an approved accommodation based on a religious or medical reason, employees in this role will be required to be fully vaccinated no later than applicable deadlines, which are unknown at this point.  Viasat will strive to give individuals as much notice as practicable if a vaccine mandate becomes applicable to this role.

To learn more about this site and other office locations, please click here!

title: Product Engineer
description:
Descripción del grupo

El grupo de Mechatronics, Mirrors y Lighting se especializa en tecnologías automotrices que impulsan el futuro de la movilidad. Combinando un profundo conocimiento de sistemas para desarrollar experiencias únicas de acceso a vehículos, sistemas de visión inteligentes y tecnologías avanzadas de iluminación automotriz, la experiencia de MML ilumina el camino hacia la innovación, la seguridad y el estilo.

 

Resumen de la función

Gestionar los cambios de ingeniería y coordinar los pilotajes y construcción de prototipos como parte del proceso de nuevos lanzamientos.

Responsabilidades clave

  • Crear y administrar los BOM (Bill of materials) para los diferentes programas activos, asegurando la integridad de la información y la concordancia con los dibujos de ingeniería.
  • Llevar a cabo auditorías a los BOM para asegurar que le información sea consistente con lo establecido en el sistema BAAN y en los dibujos de ingeniería.
  • Gestionar los cambios de ingeniería a través del sistema ChangeX emitiendo solicitudes de cambios (change requests - CR) y coordinar con las diferentes áreas funcionales de la División la factibilidad de dicho cambio.
  • Generar y comunicar los cambios de ingeniería aprobados y asegurar su correcta implementación en el sistema BAAN.
  • Asegurar el control de la documentación generada por cambios de ingeniería para dar cumplimiento con lo establecido en el sistema de gestión de calidad.
  • Coordinar la fabricación de muestras y prototipos como parte de las diferentes fases de validación de nuevos lanzamientos de programas.
  • Crear listados de materiales en el Sistema Internacional de Información de Materiales (IMDS) para dar cumplimiento a la regulación y estándares internacionales en materia ambiental, y para obtener la aprobación del PPAP de cliente.
  • Elaborar y actualizar instrucciones de empaque para todos los números de parte producidos en la División, asegurando su correcto despliegue en todas las áreas de producción.
  • Participar en actividades y proyectos VA/VE para la generación de ahorros en la División.

 

Educación y Experiencia

  • Carrera profesional concluida en ingeniería mecánica, mecatrónica o afín al puesto.
  • Mínimo 3 años de experiencia en puestos similares en la industria automotriz.

 

Competencia Requerida

  • Habilidad para la interpretación de dibujos de ingeniería.
  • Manejo intermedio de AutoCAD.
  • Conocimiento en manejo de portales de nuestros clientes. (según aplique)
  • Conocimiento de requerimientos específicos de nuestros clientes. (según aplique)
  • Iniciativa
  • Trabajo bajo presión
  • Trabajo en equipo
  • Comunicación efectiva.
  • Inglés avanzado

Concientización. Unidad. Empoderamiento.

En Magna creemos que una fuerza laboral diversa es fundamental para nuestro éxito. Es por eso que estamos orgullosos de ser un empleador con igualdad de oportunidades. Contratamos sobre la base de la experiencia y las competencias laborales alineadas a los requisitos del puesto, independientemente del género, color, raza, origen étnico, nacionalidad, edad, ciudadanía, estado civil, discapacidad, religión o creencias, orientación sexual o identidad de género. Para Magna es prioritario asegurar la privacidad y uso de su información personal por lo que su información será tratada de conformidad con la Ley Federal de Datos Personales en Posesión de los Particulares en México. Le pedimos por favor que no envíe aplicaciones a vacantes por correo electrónico.

title: Field Engineer
description:
Overview:

Provides technical engineering information to ensure construction work complies with all engineering standards, codes and contract specifications.

What you will be doing:
  • Meets daily with project crews to review production schedule and confirm all materials, equipment and resources are readily available for production to continue on schedule and within budget.
  • Collects, coordinates and analysis shop drawings, design specifications, material requirements and project data through the duration of the project to ensure quality and contract specification compliance.
  • Provides technical input for project work plan and scheduling. Identifying risk elements of production, materials, equipment or process that could negatively impact the budget or schedule.
  • Evaluates daily production, schedule and budget projections to accurately track project performance. Documents daily activities in Company approved methods and technologies.
  • Notifies team members and manager of any significant schedule changes and recommends solutions for management consideration.
  • Perform additional assignments per managementâ€™s direction.
  • Remits accurate project quantity input and controls using assigned project cost coding to ensure project financials are accurately reported. Manages cost coding with Company finance and accounting teams regarding employee time, materials, equipment and subcontractor needs.
  • Reviews and approves daily timecards for all Company construction crews. Works with Office Manager, payroll and job construction supervisors to resolve timecard inquiries, as needed.
  • Reviews project specifications for quality assurance at the beginning of work, during the project work and after work completes. Initiates and manages appropriate certificates, inspections and other documentation regarding construction production on the project site.
  • Works with construction crews and engineering leaders to plan field layout on the project site, ensuring appropriate utility and commercial lines are marked before production begins. Initiates and manages any permits needed before work can begin.
  • Conducts required Job Hazard Analysis (JHAs) to ensure a safe and compliance work environment for all construction personnel. Attends weekly safety meetings with field team and project leadership; presents field analysis as needed.
  • Assists the estimating team with project schedules and provides technical input as needed.
  • Assists the development of design drawings and provides technical input, as needed.
  • Coordinates subcontractor work methods, schedule and crews as needed.
  • Reconciles job close-out checklist with owner representative and field crews at the end of the project.
  • Maintains knowledge of Company values and strategic plan.
What we are looking for:
  • Bachelor's Degree in a related field required.
  • 1+ years of construction engineering experience required.
  • Beginner knowledge of construction equipment & techniques, drawing & specifications, building materials and required standards applicable to the project.
  • Ability to assume responsibility, interface and communicate effectively with others.
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently and effectively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Skill in verbal and written communication needed.
  • Proven self-starter and self-motivated to learn and grow knowledge.
  • Knowledge of construction scheduling and production time management
  • Construction engineering experience or knowledge required.
Why work for us:

Some of the benefits you may be eligible for as an employee are:

  • Comprehensive compensation package and paid time off program
  • Industry leading 401(k)/RRSP
  • Medical/Extended Health Care, Dental, Vison and/or Provincial Medical
  • Wellness benefits & Employee Assistance Program
  • Tuition Reimbursement Program

We are an EEO/AA/ADA/Veterans employer.

title: Product engineer position - Electrical installation products
description:
Product engineer position - Electrical installation productsTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB Installation Products Division (formerly Thomas&Betts),is the number one manufacturer of electrification products in North America with a 125-year history of providing innovation and customer- focused solutions for connecting and protecting electrical systems, as well as a unique differentiated medium voltage offering. Our products are used all around you, every day - orbiting the earth, working on Mars, on the fastest trains we ride, in the fastest cars of the world, crossing oceans, in factories producing your food, in the tallest buildings of the world, in the most modern hotels and in the walls of your home. With a portfolio of more than 200,000 products marketed under more than 38 premium brand names, our Division offerings are found wherever electricity is used. ABB-ELIP is a North-American leader in the manufacture of electrical fittings, boxes, cable trays, and other accessories. This position is held thanks to the contribution of approximately 1,600 employees and the application of proven management principles such as team spirit and continuous improvement. We strive for excellence on a daily basis and focus on leadership and open communication with all our employees, our customers and our partners and suppliers as a whole.Reporting to the head of the Engineering Department, the incumbent has technical responsibility for a portfolio of electrical installation products for the industrial, commercial, and residential sectors. He ensures the conformity and maintenance of the products according to the codes and standards applicable on the market. In addition, he leads the projects for the development of new products that meet customer needs.
Your responsibilities

  • Manage and draw up the functional specifications of the existing products that are part of his portfolio (specifications):
  • Maintain the performance and ensure the safe operation of the products.
  • Review the design of the products with the project team.
  • Validate the design: prototyping, certification, and product testing plan.
  • Adapt products according to the new certification requirements for the codes and standards.
  • Develop new products to meet the needs of the market:
  • Participate in creativity sessions.
  • Support product managers in market research.
  • Act as a technical leader for development.
  • Establish a budget for design and proof of concept.
  • Plan and conduct design reviews.
  • Provide deliverables as defined in the design process.
  • Participate in the industrialization of new products.
  • Carry out the transfer of documentation to the operations and service groups.
  • Carry out post-mortem studies on projects.
  • Document the products:
  • Define the quality criteria and the documentation necessary for the supply of the components and materials.
  • Produce final drawings, data sheets, reports, and engineering BOMs documenting product design, validation, and certification.
  • Support innovation upstream:
  • Participate in strategic reviews for the marketing of the products.
  • Research project opportunities and conduct preliminary studies for the feasibility of development projects.
  • Provide technical support for sales, quality, purchasing, and manufacturing.

Your background
  • Undergraduate education in mechanical, electrical, or industrial engineering.
  • 2 to 5 years of experience in design engineering for a manufacturing company.
  • Knowledge of the design, prototyping, and validation processes for the development of new products (FMEA, functional analysis, etc.).
  • Skilled with design tools and software.
  • Training in project management (an asset).
  • Familiar with the manufacturing processes: machining, molding, etc. (an asset).
  • Analytical mind (essential).
  • Structured, disciplined, and organized.
  • Team spirit and communication skills.
  • Sense of creativity and entrepreneurship.

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our websitewww.abb.com.For the 4th year in a row, ABB Canada has been recognized as one of Canada's top employers by Forbes Magazine and has been ranked #1 within the industry category. Also named as Canada's Top 100 Employers, Montreal's Top Employers, Canada's Top Employers for Young People, and Best Candidate Experience Award (CandE Award), ABB's culture and commitment are to provide a caring workplace where everyone collaborates, feels valued, respected, included and supported. Also committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to the applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.#LI-Onsite
